characters.name: Aaron_Cash
characters.description: One of the most senior and respected guards at Arkham, Aaron Cash is only afraid of one inmate - Killer Croc, who severely wounded Cash once during a riot at the asylum. Cash remains determined, however, to keep the asylum's inmates under control and to conquer his fears of Croc. His fateful encounter with the villain happened when a team of four other Arkham security guards were transferring Croc through the asylum. He had been struck with several tranquilizer darts, but these had worn off. Att...

characters.name: Aaron_Helzinger_(Gotham)
characters.description: Aaron Helzinger, also known asAmygdala,was an Arkham Asylum inmate.

characters.name: Abattoir
characters.description: Arnold Etchinson(also known asAbattoir) is a serial killer who grew up convinced that his family members were evil. In result, he eventually murdered them believing that their deaths would protect the world from further perils. Etchison also believed that he absorbed the life force from each victim after his or her death.

characters.name: Abel_Cuvier
characters.description: Dr. Abel Cuvierwas a genetics expert specialized in splicing.

characters.name: Abner
characters.description: Abneris a mentally-ill obese criminal who acted as a henchman of both Two-Face and The Joker, being the only henchman other than Bruno to remain a member of the Joker's squad by the time of the 1970s.

characters.name: Abraham_Langstrom
characters.description: Abraham Langstromis the father ofKirk Langstrom, the original Man-Bat. Abraham is a corrupt corporate magnate that commissioned a new vampiric upgrade of the Man-Bat serum for himself. In his transformed state he murders his enemies and feeds on the blood of Gotham's poor.

characters.name: Abuse
characters.description: Abuseis a fictional character in the DC Universe.Colin Wilkeswas an orphan abducted by the Scarecrow and rescued by Batman. Colin was injected with venom and inhaled fear gas and became disoriented and attacked his hero, Batman. Colin later discovered that the chemical reaction of the venom and fear toxin allowed his body to change at will, and he was inspired to become the vigilante Abuse, watching over street kids and orphans like himself. After several team-ups, he became best friends with Da...

characters.name: Abyss
characters.description: Abyssis a criminal operating out ofBangladeshand former leader ofBatman Incorporated. Created byLex Luthorto act as his own personal Batman, he was driven insane by experiments performed on him. Abyss would later encounter Batman after Batman Incorporated apparently murdered him.

characters.name: Ace_the_Bat-Hound
characters.description: Ace was a German Shepherd dog originally owned by an engraver named John Wilker. He was found byBatmanandRobinafter his master was kidnapped by a gang of counterfeiters. With his master unable to fight off the kidnappers, Wilker's dog jumped to his defense. Ace put up a savage attack but was beaten into unconsciousness by the thugs. Disoriented but determined to rescue his master, the brave canine dove into the river in search of Wilker. While on patrol that night, Robin spotted the dog struggli...

characters.name: Ace_the_Blade_Wolf
characters.description: Ace the Blade Wolfis aBumbershoot MechanicsBlade Wolf robot reprogramed byBatman. Ace can transform into a motorcycle.

characters.name: Addison_Cobblepot
characters.description: Addison Cobblepotwas the one ofPenguin Twinsdaughter of Oswald Cobblepot, the crimelord also known asPenguin.

characters.name: Aiden_Cobblepot
characters.description: Aiden Cobblepotwas the one ofPenguin Twinsson of Oswald Cobblepot, the crimelord also known asPenguin.

characters.name: Alan_Scott
characters.description: Alan Scottis the originalGreen Lanterncreated byBill Finger, also known asThe Sentinelwas a paranormal super-hero vigilante previously active inGotham City. He was a compatriot of Earth-2'sBatmanon theJustice Society of Americaand was made a figure of Gotham City's history in New Earth continuity. He is not to be confused with post-Silver Age Green Lanterns, who are space cops while Alan Scott was a mystical detective/vigilante.

characters.name: Alfred_Beagle
characters.description: As he became part of Batman and Robin's adventures, Alfred decided to get in shape and start exercising. Bruce noticed Alfred's hard work and allowed him to go on vacation. Alfred spent his vacation on a health resort, where he worked extremely hard to become a more fit person. Upon his return to Gotham, Alfred hadlost weightand was no longer stout, but instead he was a slender and thin man and he also grew a fine line of mustache.[8]

characters.name: Alfred_Pennyworth_(Earth-1)
characters.description: Alfred Pennyworthwas the butler and security guard ofBruce Wayne. A friend of his late fatherThomas Wayne, he took over legal guardianship after he andhis wifewere murdered. When Bruce became the vigilante Batman, Alfred reluctantly helped him investigate the circumstances behind his parents' murder and later his war on crime in Gotham.

characters.name: Alfred_Pennyworth_(Earth-43)
characters.description: Following Batman's staking, Alfred returned to the brownstone, but was plagued by nightmares, unable to bear his guilt over his role in his master's 'death'. Eventually, after Gordon came to talk to him about Gotham's recent crime wave in Batman's absence, Alfred, hoping to give Gotham a savior again and convincing himself that his master was still a good man, returned to the crypt and removed the stake from Batman's corpse. Angrily proclaiming that he was now nothing but a monster who would nev...

characters.name: Alice
characters.description: Aliceis an enemy ofBatwomanand the former high madame of the Religion of Crime inGotham. She is depicted as highly eccentric, malicious and violent. She speaks predominately in phrases and quotes from the Lewis Carroll novel Alice's Adventures in Wonderland. Despite this theme, she denies any connection to the Mad Hatter (Jervis Tetch) or the Wonderland gang. She is shown using guns, knives, small weapons, and poison, and employs personal bodyguards, although she has a multitude of willing follo...

characters.name: Alisa_Adams
characters.description: Alisa Adamsis a scientist at the Gotham City S.T.A.R. Labs. She started out as Henry Simmons's assistant, but got fired by Ivy, but soon got her job back as Ivy's assistant.

characters.name: All_Caste
characters.description: The All Caste is an ancient group of warrior monks hidden in the Himalayan mountains that have been around for thousands of years.Ducra, their leader, claims to have lived for over three thousand years.

characters.name: Allesandro
characters.description: Allesandro is a local journalist in Italy. He becomes close friends withHelena Bertinelli.

characters.name: Alpha
characters.description: Once Cassandra had become Batgirl, she encountered Alpha again. Working as an international terrorist-for-hire, Alpha had planted a Fusion Bomb inGotham City, only to be struck with amnesia before he could leave the city. Once she tracked him down, Batgirl saved Alpha from mob members that he had betrayed. She convinced the amnesiatic Alpha that he was a heroic Secret Agent named Michael Sommers (explaining his skills and equipment), and enlisted his help in locating the nuclear device.

characters.name: Amazo
characters.description: Amazois a robotic enemy to theJustice Leaguewho was sold on the black-market and brought toGotham Citywhere it served as a would-be puppet for several Gotham super-villains and an enemy toBatmanandNightwing.

characters.name: Amina_Franklin
characters.description: Amina Franklinwas the sister of Wayne Franklin, the deranged vigilante known asGrotesk. She worked at Saint Eligius Medical Center andLeslie Thompkins' clinic inGotham City. A Russian mobster namedPeruntargeted Amina as a means of avenging himself against her allegedly deceased brother Wayne.Batmanarrived in time to prevent Perun from harming Amina. Whilst staying in police protection, Wayne eventually attacked and kidnapped Amina, planning to graph her face onto his. When Batman arrived to stop...

characters.name: Amy_Rohrbach
characters.description: Sgt. Amy Rohrbachwas a member of theBlüdhaven Police Department. WhenDick Graysonas an officer, she supervised his time on the force. Rohrbach would eventually discover his operations asNightwing.

characters.name: Amygdala
characters.description: AmygdalaAKAAaron Helzingeris a super-villain enemy ofBatmanwho first appeared inShadow of the Bat#3in 1992. He is a large and muscular brute who suffers from uncontrollable violent rage due to a botched brain-surgery.

characters.name: Anarky
characters.description: Lonnie Machinwas an ordinary child who, while abnormally intelligent, is apolitical and socially unaware. At eleven he gained a foreign pen pal, Xuasus, as part of a school program. Every month they would write to each other about their lives; Lonnie about how wonderful the United States is; Xuasus about the poverty and political repression that made up his nation.

characters.name: Anarky_(Beware_the_Batman)
characters.description: Anarkyis an enemy toBatman, who tries to cause chaos throughout Gotham, as his name implies. He is the main villain of the series.

characters.name: Anarky_(DC_Animated_Universe)
characters.description: Anarkyis a villain who appeared inThe Batman Adventures.

characters.name: Anchoress
characters.description: The Anchoressis a metahuman supercriminal introduced in the New 52.

characters.name: Andrew_Warner
characters.description: Andrew Warnerwas a meta-human U.S. governor and an enemy ofBatman. He is known as beingTheman who quit being humanorThe man who quit the human race.

characters.name: Ant-Man
characters.description: Jumbo Carson was a mobster inGotham Citywho fell into a chemical polluted river, miniaturizing his body. Jumbo took up the bug inspired moniker of, "Ant-Man" in order to try and rob his former mob associates of their money. For this scheme, Ant-Man started following Batman's sidekickRobinand used his small-size to assist the boy-wonder unnoticed, manipulating Robin into thinking he was more powerful. Throughout this, he had Robin target his former partners-in-crime while Jumbo stole their money.

characters.name: Anti-Batmen
characters.description: This is a disambiguation page — a list of articles associated with the same title.

characters.name: Ariane_(Earth-43)
characters.description: Arianewas a researcher in the occult and an ally and advisor of Batman as he explored the supernatural and his transformation into a vampire.

characters.name: Arkham_Inmate
characters.description: The inmate resided atArkham State Hospitalwhich also houses his idolArthur Fleck, also known by his alter-ego Joker. Arthur is later put on trial for the murders he committed two years ago, which would earn him the death penalty if found guilty. Despite Arthur once again embracing his Joker persona and representing himself, Arthur decides to dismiss the Joker identity when having a change of heart. Arthur briefly escapes when his followers blow up the courthouse, but he is rearrested and sent ba...

characters.name: Arkham_Knight_(Astrid_Arkham)
characters.description: Astrid's super-villain persona originated in the video-gameBatman: Arkham Knightalthough in it the knight had adifferent true-identity. She is however the first incarnation of the Arkham Knight in mainstream comics.

characters.name: Arnold_Stromwell
characters.description: Arnold Stromwellwas a prominent mob boss inGotham Citybefore turning himself in to the authorities. His estranged nephewTony Zuccowas responsible for the murder of the parents ofDick Grayson.

characters.name: Arthur_Watts
characters.description: Dr. Arthur Wattsis a disgraced scientist, computer programmer and dangerous terrorist from the world of Remnant. Following his supposed death, his consciousness was digitally transferred to Earth and he teamed up withKilg%reto destroy and remake Gotham City and Central City in his own twisted image. While ordering Kilg%re to destroy the Justice League, Watts used Star Labs technology to rebuild his lost body and give himself cybernetic enhancements.

characters.name: Atomic_Man
characters.description: Atomic Man is a enemy ofBatman, who was once a electrical engineer who committed and crime and was captured, he uses a special device to commit crimes now.

characters.name: Azrael
characters.description: Azraelis a name given to the champions of the amoral Catholic extremist guild, theOrder of St. Dumas. Azrael acts as the deranged agent of the Order, often serving as an ally and enemy toBatmandue to his violence, diluted moral-system, and homicidal tendencies.

characters.name: Azrael_(Arkhamverse)
characters.description: Batman encounters Azrael (birth name is Michael Lane) many times throughout the game, where he gives cryptic statements before disappearing and leaving an ambiguous symbol. He appears to be stalking Batman (hence, the side mission title "Mystery Stalker"). Once all the symbols are collected, they form a map of Azrael's location, leading Batman to the Gotham Cathedral. At the church, Azrael reveals that he has been sent to observe Batman, believing he is a warrior foretold by an ancient prophecy.

characters.name: B.G._(Big)_Trubble
characters.description: B.G. ("Big") Trubbleis a villain that appeared in theBatmannewspaper strips from the 1960s. He made his first appearance in the July 16th, 1967 strip and his final appearance in the November 7th, 1967 strip. These comic strips weren’t seen again until they were republished in Batman - the Silver Age Newspaper Comics Collections by IDW decades later.

characters.name: Baby_Doll
characters.description: Mary Louise DahlAKABaby Dollwas a villain first featured in theBatman: The Animated Seriesepisode of the same name. Baby Doll is portrayed as an actress driven to insanity by prejudice against a condition which prevented her from physically-aging. While intelligent and disturbed, she assumes the persona of a joyful sitcom little girl and gimmicks herself around television shows and children's toys.

characters.name: Baby_Face
characters.description: Alfonso Vincenzo Giuseppe Face, better known by his criminal alias "Baby Face", is an enemy ofBatmaninBatman: The Brave and the Bold, voiced byTom Kenny. He is a lot like a stereotypical gangster, complete with a voice similar to Edward G. Robinson. As his name implies, he has the face of an infant.

characters.name: Baby_Jane_Towser
characters.description: "Baby" Jane Towserwas a wealthy gullible heiress who took an instant liking to theJoker's work with art and decided to become his muse, unaware that she was just a pawn for his crimes.

characters.name: Bagley
characters.description: He appeared inTopsy Turvy, where he was on a phone call with the press. He kept bragging about his achievements and how he has been invited to the Gotham Palace Theater to a banquet of honor.

characters.name: Bane
characters.description: Baneis an escaped convict from an island prison in South America and a super-villain/assassin. Bane has abnormal physical strength as a result of having undergone experiments involving a derivative of the drug Venom. He became known as "The Man Who Broke the Bat" when he brokeBatman's back, forcing Bruce Wayne to give up the Batman persona while he recuperated. Bane was originally created by writersChuck DixonandDoug Moenchand artist,Graham Nolan, from a concept byDenny O'Neil. He first appeared...

characters.name: Bane_(Injustice_Universe)
characters.description: He is officially classified as a Power User. He is a member of the Society, former member of the Regime and an enemy of Batman and the Insurgency.

characters.name: Bane_(Young_Justice)
characters.description: In "Drop Zone", Bane headed a facility in the Caribbean that producedVenom. The factory was a rogue organization called the Cult of the Kobra and Bane was easily defeated by a member who used a variant of Bane's steroid called Kobra Venom. Bane soon escaped the island and declared war on the Cult. Bane was soon captured byRobinand his team, but was able to plead with them to work with him in order to stop the Cult. When Bane and the team failed to stop the Cult, he tried to kill the young heroes...

characters.name: Barbara_Eileen_Gordon
characters.description: The first wife of Gotham City police commissioner James W. Gordon and the mother of James Gordon, Jr., little is known of Barbara's early life. Barbara and James (then a police lieutenant) moved to Gotham from Chicago, Illinois, shortly before the couple discovered that they were expecting their first child. A short time later, Lt. Gordon was assigned to track down the mysterious "Batman". After James, Jr. was born, Barbara discovered that her husband was having an affair with his partner,Sarah ...

characters.name: Barbara_Gord-son
characters.description: Bruss later infiltrated Arkham's asylum and learned that he and Barbara are also being targeted by the Laughing Man to end their investigation. Barbara was about to be kill by the Laughing Man while in bed until she was saved by the intervention of Bruss, now known as Nosferatu. Following Arkham's imprisonment, Barbara became the Chief of Police and later closed down Dr. Psykho'sThe Palace of Sin.

characters.name: Barbara_Gordon
characters.description: Barbara "Barb/Babs" Gordonis a superheroine and member of theBat-Family. Created by William Dozier, Julius Schartz, Gardner Fox and Carmine Infantino, she is the daughter of CommissionerJames Gordonand an ally ofBatmanandDick Grayson. From 1967 to 1988, she operated as the superheroineBatgirl, serving as the second character to use the identity. Barbara continued to operate, though was forced into retirement due to her crippling duringBatman: The Killing Joke.

characters.name: Barbara_Gordon_(Earth-1)
characters.description: Barbara Gordonwas the daughter of GCPD detectiveJames Gordon. Initially working as a librarian, she was inspired to fight crime afterBatmanbegan his war on crime. Initially studying aboard, Barbara returned to Gotham to become the vigilanteBatgirl, working alongside Batman as a member ofthe Outsiders.

characters.name: Barbara_Gordon_(Matsudaverse)
characters.description: Batgirlis theBatman'sfirst sidekick, beforeRobin. Years later, Barbara became an information broker known asOracle.

characters.name: Barbara_Hardy
characters.description: Barbara Gordon Hardy was an ex-thief who was determined to become a S.H.I.E.L.D. agent. Using her natural athletic skills to fight crime, she created a superheroic identity, theBlack Bat. She quickly proved her worth to S.H.I.E.L.D. agent Bruce Wayne. Barbara was invited to join the secret organization.

characters.name: Barbara_Kean
characters.description: Barbara Keanappears in the television seriesGotham, which acts as an origin show to several DC related characters in the years prior to Bruce Wayne becoming Batman. She is introduced in the "Pilot" episode, initially as the fiancée to protagonistJames Gordon. But it becomes clear she has had a troubled past with alcohol and drugs, and is also revealed as the former bisexual partner of Renee Montoya.

characters.name: Barbatos
characters.description: Barbatos(originally spelled (Barbathos)is a cosmic being that was once worshiped by humans as a demon. Barbatos is typically perceived as being abat-like demon, nightmare or a literal bat affiliated withGotham City, the Wayne Family and Bruce Wayne. In reality it is theHyper-Adapter, created byDarkseidto torment Batman throughout time. At times the Hyper-Adapter has claimed to be theMonarch Batthat appeared to Bruce when he discovered theBatcaveas a child as well as the bat that burst through th...

characters.name: Basil_Karlo
characters.description: Basil Karlo, the originalClayface, was an actor who was driven mad when he heard of a remake of the classic horror film he had starred in, Dread Castle, and that he wouldn't be in the leading role. Adopting the persona of "Clayface", the villain of one of his old films, he became a serial killer targeting the cast and crew. He was eventually stopped byBatmanandRobin. Later versions of the character reimagined him as being transformed into a behemoth of shapeshifting, clay-like flesh.

characters.name: Basilisk
characters.description: Basiliskis a fledging terrorist cell. They have been responsible for some of the events inSuicide SquadandThe Flashseries.

characters.name: Bat-Cow
characters.description: Bat-Cowis a cow with a bat-like pattern on its face which was adopted byDamian Wayne.

characters.name: Bat-Hombre
characters.description: Bat-HombreAKALuis Peraldais a South American criminal who worked for the drug-cartel leader El Papayago. Luis took up the moniker the Bat-Hombre so that he could further his criminal operations while the authorities merely thought he was a vigilante superhero.

characters.name: Bat-Mite
characters.description: Bat-Miteis a troublesome former member of theBat-Familywho is both an ally and adversary toBatman. Bat-Mite is a 5th Dimensional being comparable to a god who is Batman's self-proclaimed, "Biggest Fan". Bat-Mite uses his vast powers to bend reality around Batman for his own fanboy amusement and help him fight crime. Later comics would retcon Bat-Mite into being a hallucinated figure albeit of potentially paranormal origins.

characters.name: Bat_Clan_of_Hida
characters.description: TheBat Clan of Hidais an ancient Japanese clan led by Eian that appeared inBatman Ninja.

characters.name: Batgirl_(Dozierverse)
characters.description: After hearing so many tales of the Dynamic Duo's exploits and fighting crime, she took on a crime fighting persona herself and joined them to become a valuable member of the new Terrific Trio.

characters.name: Batman_(Brane_Taylor)
characters.description: Brane Taylor(originally simply known asBrane) is a possible future hero who becameBatman(referred to in comics asBatman 3000) after watching some archived footage of the Dynamic Duo in action.

characters.name: Batman_(LEGO_Animated_Universe)
characters.description: Batman, also known as Bruce Wayne, is the leader of the Bat-Family and leader of the Justice League.

characters.name: Batman_(Terry_McGinnis)
characters.description: Terry McGinnis is Batman several decades into the future, also known as Batman Beyond. He is the successor of Bruce Wayne and protector ofNeo-Gotham. After his father, Warren McGinnis, was murdered, Terry took up the mantle of Batman from Bruce Wayne. After avenging his father's death, Terry continued to fight crime as Batman in Neo Gotham. The history of this Terry McGinnis follows the same history as that of the DCAU with the addition that this universe had aBatman Incorporated.

characters.name: Batman_(Thomas_Wayne)
characters.description: TheFlashpointreality is a world which was created whenBarry Allentravelled back in time to save his mother from being murdered by Professor Zoom. This caused a butterfly effect that rewrote the entire history of Earth-Prime and the Multiverse. As a result, Barry became trapped in this universe with his original memories but no memory of having caused the universe's reboot.

characters.name: Batman_Incorporated
characters.description: Batman Incorporatedwas a global non-profit organization publicly funded byWayne EnterprisesandBruce Wayne. The group selects vigilantes from across the world to train and supply for crime-fighting purposes while also making them swear oaths.

characters.name: Batman_of_Zur-En-Arrh
characters.description: TheBatman of Zur-En-Arrhis an alternate, alien form of the Batman moniker. Originally introduced as the alien scientistTlano, later comics revealed that the alien is actually a violent alternate-personality ofBruce Wayne.

characters.name: Batman_Rogues_Gallery
characters.description: A gathering of the most traditional top tier villains byBrian Stelfreeze.

characters.name: Batmen
characters.description: The"Batmen", or theBatmen Militia, were a group of people who were inspired byBatmanto fight crime and corruption inGotham City. Members of the party had suffered injustice and decided to follow in Batman's footsteps, albeit with the contrasting intention of murdering criminals instead of apprehending them to the proper authorities, which is presumably why Batman refuses their assistance and has them arrested. Noted members includedAntonand the former GCPD officer,Brian Douglas.

characters.name: Batmen_of_All_Nations
characters.description: The Batmen of All Nationsalso known as theClub of Heroesand theInternational Club of Heroesis an international team of vigilantes lead byBatmanwhich consists of vigilantes who were inspired or otherwise take influence from Batman.

characters.name: Batwoman_(Disambiguation)
characters.description: Batwomanis the name of several superheroines, usually mysterious, but love-interests of Batman. The mainstream version is Kate Kane and the Pre-Crisis version is Kathy Kane, on Earth 11, she is the reverse-gender counterpart ofBatmanhimself, inJLA: The Nail,Selina Kyle, takes the name afterBatgirlandRobinwere killed by theJoker. Different versions of the character appear in other media, however, Kate Kane, as Batwoman, appears inDC Universe Online.

characters.name: Batwoman_(Kate_Kane)
characters.description: Katherine "Kate" Kaneis the secondBatwoman. Debuting in52#11, she is a member of the Kane family and, throughher father, the cousin ofBruce Wayne. Batwoman has headlinedher own comic seriessince 2011 and served as a vital member of theBat-Family.

characters.name: Batzarro
characters.description: Wayne Bruceis a distorted clone ofBatman, presumably created through the same process as Bizarro, the failed clone of Superman. At times it seems as thoughBatzarrois trying to aid Batman, but his mangled dialogue and inexplicable actions make it difficult to be sure. Batzarro describes himself as "the world's worst detective".

characters.name: Bedbug
characters.description: Bedbugis a mysterious villain able to control his victims in their sleep. Bedbug is able to control people or "sleepers" to do his bidding such as robberies by using mysterious bugs to infect their mind while they sleep. He debuted in 2011.

characters.name: Bekka
characters.description: Bekkais the daughter of Himon, one of the New Gods whose achievements include invention of the sentient Mother Box computers and discovery of the "x-element" that fueled his co-creation of the teleporting Boom Tubes alongside fellow scientist Metron. For many years, Bekka lived with her father in secret on Apokolips as Himon organized an underground uprising against Darkseid's tyrannical rule. Hunted for his role in this planned insurgence, Himon took extra care to shield Bekka from Darkseid's n...

characters.name: Bette_Kane
characters.description: Batwomanand Bat-Girl were created to be romantic interests forBatmanandRobin, respectively, as well as wannabe crime-fighting associates. Bat-Girl wore a red-and-green costume to "flatter" Robin. Bat-Girl appeared seven times between 1961 and 1964, but then disappeared in 1964 (along with Batwoman,Ace the Bat-Hound, andBat-Mite) when new Batman editor Julius Schwartz decided she and other characters were too silly. It has been suggested by scholars that the characters of Batwoman (in 1956) and B...

characters.name: Bianca_Steeplechase
characters.description: Bianca Steeplechaseis an Elseworld version of theJokerfrom the reality ofEarth-37. She is the main antagonist in the storylineThrillkiller.

characters.name: Big_Top
characters.description: Big Topis the super strong member of theCircus of Strange.

characters.name: Bird
characters.description: Birdwas a member ofBane's gang and was instrumental in helping Bane in his efforts become the new crime lord of Gotham. Bird owned a pet falcon which he namedTalon.

characters.name: Birds_of_Prey
characters.description: Oracle contacted Black Canary to go on a mission for her. From then on the Birds of Prey was a team. The original recruit of Oracle's was actually Power Girl. The Birds of Prey spent the first part of their existence operating out of theGotham Clock Tower, and for many missions the Bird were essentially just a partnership ofOracleand theBlack Canary. After Black Canary was kidnapped by the villainSavant, Oracle contacted theHuntressfor help, eventually taking her in as a permanent agent, and lat...

characters.name: Bizarro-Batman
characters.description: Bizarro-Batmanis an imperfect clone ofBatmancreated by the imperfectSuperman-cloneBizarro. Bizarro did this to team up with the Bizarro-Batman similarly to how Superman and Batman team-up.

characters.name: Black_Alice
characters.description: Black Alice(Lori Zechlin) is an anti-hero who can temporarily take the magical powers of any being, gaining all their skills and power to protect her hometown of Dayton, OH, but leaving the individual powerless in turn.

characters.name: Black_Canary
characters.description: Black Canaryis an ally ofBatmanthat is noted for her martial-arts skills and her "Canary Cry" – a high powered, sonic scream with the ability to shatter objects and incapacitate villains. Among the first generation of superheroes, she was a member of theJustice Society of America, the first superhero team to appear in comic books.

characters.name: Black_Lightning
characters.description: Black Lightingis a superhero that occasionally interacts withBatman.

characters.name: Black_Mask
characters.description: Roman Sionis, a former business executive and mafia boss who originally hatedBruce Waynerather than Batman, wears a black wooden mask and leads the Sionis Crime Family, also known as theFalse Facers. Black Mask eventually became a mob boss controlling large sections of Gotham City's criminal underworld. Following the suspicious death of his multi-millionaire parents, Sionis had inherited their fortune and went on to bankrupt their company. Saved by a buyout by Bruce Wayne, Sionis came to resent ...

characters.name: Black_Mask_(Earth-43)
characters.description: Roman Sionis of Earth-43was, like in many realities, the villainBlack Maskand an adversary ofBatman, who had become avampire.

characters.name: Black_Mask_(Under_the_Red_Hood)
characters.description: Black Maskis a major antagonist in the 2010 animated movieBatman: Under the Hoodand a minor antagonist in its 2020 animated interactive filmBatman: Death in the Family.

characters.name: Black_Spider
characters.description: Eric Needham was a small time crook who was addicted to heroin. Eric was first sentenced to prison after mugging and nearly killing an elderly woman but, as a minor, he was out in three years. Over the next twenty-four months, Eric married his friend Linda Morrel and they had a son, Michael. Desperate for money to buy more drugs, Needham continued to steal to support his habit, culminating in a fateful liquor store robbery. Gunning down a customer who'd lunged for him, Eric realized far too late...

characters.name: Black_Spider_(Arkhamverse)
characters.description: Eric Needham, also known asBlack Spider, was a vigilante who was eventually press-ganged into joining theSuicide Squad.

characters.name: Black_Spider_(Telltale)
characters.description: Black Spideris a secondary antagonist inBatman: Sins of the Father. An professional assassin, he was hired byFloyd Lawton/Deadshotto attack various personnel linked toThomas WayneandArkham Asylum.

characters.name: Black_Spider_(Young_Justice)
characters.description: Black Spideris an assassin and a member of theLeague of Shadows.

characters.name: Black_Widow
characters.description: The Black Widowwas a villainess and enemy ofBatmanin theBatman 1960s TV Series. She was portrayed byTallulah Bankhead.

characters.name: Blackbeard
characters.description: Blackbeardis a pirate-themed villain and foe ofBatman. A gangster in disguise, he takes a yacht hostage until defeated by the Dark Knight.

characters.name: Blaze
characters.description: When Batman and Robin arrive at the Gotham City Bank, False Face, disguised as an armored car guard, gave him away by parking the armored car near a fire hydrant. The villain makes his hasty escape in his Trick-Truck in its armored car guise, and the Caped Crusaders follow him in theBatmobileto an alley where False Face and his henchmen ambushed them. While Batman and Robin deal the henchmen, False Face disappears in the confusion and Blaze tries to escape in the Batmobile, but Batman stops her ...

characters.name: Blitzkrieg
characters.description: Blitzkriegis an antagonist ofCatwomanwho wishes to make a name for herself as a super-villainess.

characters.name: Blob_Thing
characters.description: Blob-Thing, as it was nicknamed by the Hulk, was a being created by the Shaper of Worlds from Orville Baker's imagination to help the latter capture the Hulk. While it was initially able to hold the Hulk, he eventually broke free and destroyed Blob-Thing.

characters.name: Blockbuster
characters.description: Blockbusteris a super-villain alias which has been held by two brothers,Mark DesmondandRoland Desmond. Blockbuster is typically distinguished by having a giant body and super-strength, caused by a super-steroid. They are also known to suffer from pain, imbalanced brain-chemistry, and rage from their condition.

characters.name: Blockbuster_(DC_Animated_Universe)
characters.description: Blockbusteris also an ex-Member of Luthor/Grodd's Legion of Doom, and was killed by Killer Frost.

characters.name: Blood_Tiger
characters.description: Blood Tigeris a former captain of a warlord, now running the third biggest drug ring in Tinasha, Africa.

characters.name: Blue_Max
characters.description: Blue Max(also known as Shivering Blue Max Baron) is a villain that appeared inBatmannewspaper strips from the 1960s. He made his first appearance in the July 10th, 1967 strip, and his final appearance in the March 24th, 1968 strip. These comic strips weren’t seen again until they were republished in Batman - the Silver Age Newspaper Comics Collections by IDW decades later.

characters.name: Bluebird
characters.description: Harper Rowgrew up in the Narrows ofGotham Citywith her younger brother,Cullen. They both had a rough life due to abuse, abandonment and the lack of money. She later became the vigilanteBluebird.

characters.name: Bone
characters.description: Boneis a mob boss who looks like he is made out of bones.

characters.name: Boneblaster
characters.description: Boneblasteris one ofGotham's newbie villains. He tries to become famous by defeating other villains, such asCatwoman,Poison Ivy, andHarley Quinn.

characters.name: Bookworm_(DC_Comics)
characters.description: The BookwormAKAAlexander WyvernorA.S. Scarletis a super-criminal enemy ofBatmanand theHuntress, originating from the1966 Batman TV series. He is a criminal mastermind, obsessed with books.

characters.name: Boomerang_Killer
characters.description: The Boomerang KillerAKAThomas Willowoodand bornThomas Wayne, Jr.is an enemy ofBatmanwho is Bruce Wayne's secret older-brother that uses weaponized boomerangs to commit murders. The Boomerang Killer is an inspiration behindLincoln Marchin New 52 continuity and is a likely influence for theThomas Wayne, Jr. Owlman.

characters.name: Branden
characters.description: Branden was noted for his overly violent approach to law enforcement, andJim Gordonsaid to his face that his force was a "lunatic gestapo". He also briefly served as Acting Police Commissioner under MayorPeter Grogan, when Gordon was suspended for his involvement withBatman. Although he was quickly indicted afterwards for his usage of excessive force, Branden was eventually murdered by theHangman Killerduring the events ofBatman: Dark Victory.

characters.name: Brendan_Bowman
characters.description: Brendan Bowman was a young Gotham professional whose mind was controlled byChoke, the leader of theCleaners.

characters.name: Brian_Bryan
characters.description: Brian Bryanwas a friend and mentor toJean-Paul Valley. Once the self-proclaimed "worst psychiatrist to ever practice the healing arts," the former alcoholic Brian Bryan has found a calling worth starving off his vice; guiding the troubled and very naive Jean-Paul Valley towards an understanding of himself and peace with his damaged psyche. When Brian and Jean-Paul first met they were both lost souls, homeless vagrants, Jean-Paul lost in his insanity and Brian in his drinking. They began their Od...

characters.name: Brimstone
characters.description: Brimstonealso known asNicholas Lucienwas a villain who appeared inThe Brave and the Bold Issue #200.

characters.name: Briscoe
characters.description: Briscoewas a pilot and mechanic that took care of Sheba, the covert stealth helicopter used by the Suicide Squad.

characters.name: Bronze_Tiger
characters.description: Bronze Tigeris a master martial artist who has encounteredBatmanand fought him many times. Bronze Tiger originates fromDenny O'Neil'sDragon's Fistsmythos, first appearing inRichard Dragon, Kung Fu Fighter.

characters.name: Bronze_Tiger_(The_Brave_and_the_Bold)
characters.description: Bronze Tiger was one of the most powerful Martial Artist in the DC universe as he was able to beat even Batman.

characters.name: Bruce_Wayne
characters.description: Batmanis a crimefighter operating inGotham City, he serves as its protector, using the symbol of abatto strike fear into the hearts of criminals. Unlike other superheroes, Batman is often depicted to lack any "superpowers", instead using lifelong training and equipment to fight crime. His secret identity isBruce Wayne, a rich playboy and philanthropist who swore to fight crime after witnessing his parents' brutal murder. He has served as a member of various teams, including theJustice League, th...

characters.name: Bruce_Wayne_(Clone)
characters.description: This Dark Knight was a clone ofBruce Waynecreated byDarkseid. The Batman's apparent death occurs inFinal Crisis#6when he confronts Darkseid. Batman announces that he will break his "no gun" rule while facing Darkseid. Wielding a sidearm made on Apokolips, Batman shoots Darkseid in the chest with a bullet made of Radion (the same bullet used to kill Orion), just as Darkseid unleashes his Omega Sanction, or the "death that is life", upon Batman. However, the Omega Sanction does not actually kill i...

characters.name: Bruno
characters.description: Brunois a Neo-Nazi woman and ruthless gang leader inGotham City, originating from the possible future storyDark Knightand its elseworld prequels. One ofBatman's more obscure enemies, nowadays she is arguably best remembered for the distinctive pair of red swastika pasties on her exposed breasts and glutes.

characters.name: Brutale
characters.description: Brutaleis a master at throwing knives. He carries all types of blades and is primarily an enemy ofNightwing.

characters.name: Bryce_Napier_(White_Knight)
characters.description: Bryce is a pre-adolescent boy, blonde like his mother, with a slightly pointed nose like his father, and he has both purple eyes inherited from one of his father's heterochromatic eyes.

characters.name: Bud_and_Lou
characters.description: Like their master, Bud and Lou love to laugh maniacally and play jokes on their foes. Like the other animal characters onKrypto the Superdog, they also seem to be quite intelligent (a reference to the intelligence of actual hyenas). For instance, in "Bat Hound and the Robin", while stealing pillowcases for The Joker to carry loot in, they deduced that the pillowcases made of one material would be better because pillowcases made from the other fabric would shrink in the wash, meaning less loot co...

characters.name: Bureau_of_Missing_Villains
characters.description: Batman's Bureau of Missing Villainswas a series of case files maintained byBatmanon so-called "missing villains", minor criminals whom he'd fought and defeated early in his career but had since vanished into obscurity. The files were first published as part of the short-livedBatman Familymini-series which ran from 1975 to 1978.

characters.name: Buzz_Bronski
characters.description: Buzz Bronskiwas aGotham Citymobster. He was once the lieutenant ofSalvatore ValestrainBatman: Mask of the Phantasm.

characters.name: Cabala
characters.description: Cabalawas the husband and partner of criminalDr. Cassandra Spellcraftwho was also a world famous alchemist and science practitioner.

characters.name: Calculator
characters.description: Calculator escaped from prison and decided to reinvent himself. Having heard how a friend overheard Black Canary talking to herself during a fight and hearing tales about Oracle, the Calculator turned himself into an Oracle for supervillains. Being friends with several villains, he began to get people jobs and soon created a large network of information and connections. He tipped Bolt off about a crate two young hoodlums were selling. Unfortunately, the hoods shot and nearly killed Bolt. He also...

characters.name: Calendar_Man
characters.description: Julian Gregory Day, better known asCalendar Man, is known for committing themed crimes that corresponded with holidays and significant dates. While sometimes used as a "Joke villain" Calendar Man was reintroduced inBatman: The Long Halloween, as an unsettling criminal-mastermind who keeps track of Gotham's ongoings from his cell inArkham Asylum. Gotham City's hopes for a day off are often clouded by the knowledge that any holiday of note is likely to be shadowed by Calendar Man's presence.

characters.name: Calvin_Zabo
characters.description: Dr. Calvin ZaboAKAMister Hydeis a Marvel comics super-villain themed after the literary character of Mister Hyde. He originates as a villain to Thor but has also served as a predominate enemy toDaredeviland theHulk.

characters.name: Cameron_Chase
characters.description: After her father. The Acro-Bat, a costumed superhero in a low-level superteam, was murdered by a villain named Doctor Trapps, Cameron Chase dedicated her life to the pursuit of justice. Eventually becoming a highly skilled and prized DEO agent, Chase had a number of solo adventures before becoming part of Manhunter's escapades. A relationship with tech guru Dylan Battles has recently produced a pregnancy and will likely affect her work. Cameron's father, Walter Chase, was Acrobat of the Justice ...

characters.name: Candyman
characters.description: Candyman is one ofGotham City's five major crime-lords in a possible future. He is depicted as an overweight man with an apparent obsession with candy, working dessert themed word-play into his language and constantly eating sweets. Candyman was assisted byJackanapes, a hyper-intelligent gorilla raised bythe Joker.

characters.name: Captain_America
characters.description: Circa 1945, Captain America was summoned to Gotham City. As he and Bucky arrived at Gotham Municipal Airfield, another plane was hijacked. As Steve went to liberate the plane, he was aided by Batman (Bruce Wayne) and Robin (Dick Grayson). While they interrogated the goons, they succumbed to Joker Venom, making the superheroes realize this hijacking was orchestrated by The Joker. Steve's superiors; however, realized Joker's was just a pawn and believed the mastermind to be Bruce Wayne. They sent ...

characters.name: Captain_Boomerang
characters.description: George "Digger" HarknessAKACaptain Boomerangis a super-villain in the DC universe. While primarily an enemy of the Flash, Digger is also a major recurring member of theSuicide Squadand an occasional enemy toBatmanandRobin.

characters.name: Captain_Slash
characters.description: He is a villain who hides inside a chemical factory and fights the hero Nightwing. On one occasion, Nightwing entered the chemical factory but was challenged by Slash, who got the upper hand on him and threw him into a vat of chemicals, his lightning insignia also appeared on Joker'svideogame helmetthat gave him the ability to digitally download money, later on, whenJoker 2.0was trapped inside a videogame, he met Slash but their meeting was disrupted by Nightwing who attacked them both with a be...

characters.name: Captain_Stingaree
characters.description: Captain Stingareeis a foe of theBatman, a criminal who commits crimes using a pirate motif.

characters.name: Carlo
characters.description: Carlowas a fraudulent sideshow fortune teller who gained real psychic powers after a brain operation, and used those powers to become a successful thief.

characters.name: Carmine_Falcone
characters.description: Carmine "The Roman" Falconeis a powerful Mafia chieftain nicknamed "The Roman", with a stranglehold overGotham City's organized crime. Falcone made his debut in the four-part storyBatman: Year Onewritten byFrank MillerandDavid Mazzucchelliin 1987. Later his family and characterization were expanded in the maxiseriesBatman: The Long Halloween. He is also often depicted as beingCatwoman's estranged father whom she holds a vendetta with.

characters.name: Carnage
characters.description: The United States Congress appointed Cassandra Briar to cure Cletus. She implanted a chip into him that inhibited his hostile tendencies; however, the symbiote was able to disable the chip and Cletus faked being sane. Briar took Cletus to Gotham City, where she also cured The Joker. Carnage eventually revealed himself and attempted to kidnap Cassandra and Joker and while Cassandra was rescued by Batman and Spider-Man, Carnage escaped with Joker.

characters.name: Carrie_Kelley
characters.description: Carrie Kelley was a thirteen year old schoolgirl and girl scout on Earth-31 who was attacked by muggers one night, but was saved by the recently returned and grizzled elder Batman on his first night out of retirement. Soon, she would spend her lunch money on a Robin costume and hunt down some petty con-men to find Batman again, using a slingshot loaded with firecrackers as weapons.

characters.name: Cassandra
characters.description: Cassandrawas an illegitimate Indian fakir whoBruce Waynelearned the art of enduring pain from.

characters.name: Cassandra_Cain
characters.description: Cassandra Cainis a member of theBat-Familyas a protégé and adoptive daughter of Batman. The daughter of assassinsDavid CainandLady Shiva, she was raised to become the greatest weapon for theLeague of Assassins. However, horrified from her first killing, she fled to the Batman family for protection. Becoming the fourth claimant of theBatgirlidentity, she helped him andTim Drakeprotect Gotham. Cassandra has also used other identities, includingBlack BatandOrphan.

characters.name: Cat-Woman_(Earth-43)
characters.description: While out walking one night, Selina is attacked by the vampireCreach- Creach being one of the few surviving vampires after the majority were killed in the destruction of the Batcave-, who turns into a wolf to hunt her. Although he bites her in his wolf form, Selina escapes him by falling into a river, subsequently returning to her apartment to collapse.

characters.name: Catman
characters.description: Thomas Blakewas a world-famous trapper of jungle cats who turned to crime because he had grown bored with hunting and had squandered most of his fortune. He became a burglar calledCatmanwho committed his crimes in a catsuit made out of an ancient African cloth he believed gave him a cat's nine lives.

characters.name: Catwoman
characters.description: Catwomanis a cat-themed criminal fromGotham Cityand one ofBatman's most-well known enemies.Selina Kyleis often portrayed as a thief and cat burglar with divided loyalties. Her criminal activities are often tempered by a reluctant altruism, making her an inconstant villain and occasional ally to Batman. She regularly eludes capture by the Dark Knight and maintains a complicated relationship which frequently fluctuates between flirtatious to romantic. From 2002'sHushstoryline, Catwoman has often b...

characters.name: Catwoman_(Arkhamverse)
characters.description: Three months afterthe events at Blackgate, Catwoman conducted a cat burglary at a government building to steal data. It was during this time that she first encounteredBatman, who attempted to stop her. Batman pursued her throughout Gotham until cornering her at the top of a construction site, while also fending off members of theDEOwho were after both of them (Catwoman for her theft and Batman due to the mistaken belief that he was an accomplice to her).

characters.name: Catwoman_(Batman_Beyond)
characters.description: The daughter of Danton Black, the Firestorm villainMultiplex, the newCatwomanhas the ability to create up to 9 versions of herself, something quite useful when she is executing her heists

characters.name: Catwoman_(Batman_Ninja)
characters.description: Catwomanis a thief and burglar, a persona adopted bySelina Kyle, operating in Gotham City. After an incident at Arkham Asylum, Catwoman was transported to Feudal Japan by an experiment conducted byGorilla Grodd. After transported, she was a double-crosser betweenBatmanand Gorilla Grodd.

characters.name: Catwoman_(DC_Animated_Universe)
characters.description: Assassins attempted to kill Selina on the highway, but Bruce Wayne's evasive driving saved them both. Catwoman became ever concerned about the true nature of Multigon, and broke into the facility created in the mountains. She was captured and tied together with Batman. Red Claw had stolen a plague and activated it to kill the two. However, Catwoman broke them free and, at Batman's urging, escaped from the facility. While Batman destroyed the plague, Catwoman faced Red Claw. Red Claw had superior...

characters.name: Catwoman_(Hunted)
characters.description: Selina Kyleis a professional thief who goes by the criminal monikerCatwomanand is one of Batman's frequent allies. Despite her nature in assisting Batman, she has no desire in fighting crime with him, but rather takes part in her own plans by stealing from other criminals and saving those in need. Following a failed attempt at stealing the valued Cat's Eye Emerald, Selina joins forces with Interpol andBatwomanto take downBarbara MinervaandRoman Sionisin their attempt to shut down their criminal ...

characters.name: Catwoman_(Injustice_Universe)
characters.description: Catwomanis a minor antagonist ofInjustice: Gods Among Usand a major character ofInjustice 2, classified as a Gadget User. She is a playable character. Utilizing her bullwhip, acrobatic skills, and steel claws, Catwoman is one of the fastest fighters in the game.

characters.name: Catwoman_(Matsudaverse)
characters.description: Selina Kyle is a charity fundraiser by day and cat burglar by night. This led her to cross paths with theBatman. They both fought ninjas ofHideo Katsutogether and Yin notes the similarities to the two of them.

characters.name: Catwoman_(Reevesverse)
characters.description: Selina Kyle, also known asCatwoman, is a thief and criminal operating inGotham City. The illegitimate daughter ofCarmine Falcone, she served as a waitress at theIceberg Lounge. Selina would ally herself withBatmanduringRiddler'sreign of terror when their goals aligned to investigate her father's empire.

characters.name: Catwoman_(Telltale)
characters.description: Catwomanis a global thief for hire and dual identity adopted bySelina Kyle. Initially working for theChildren of Arkham, she became allied with the vigilanteBatman, eventually working with him to stop the group's attacks onGotham. In reality, Selina worked with him to achieve her own ends, leaving shortly before the final battle. A year after the encounter, Catwoman returned to Gotham as an employee ofthe Pact, bringing her back into Batman's life.

characters.name: Catwoman_(The_Brave_and_the_Bold)
characters.description: In "Death Race to Oblivion!" as one of the heroes and villains kidnapped byMonguland forced into his race across the desert. Utilizing a high-tech "Catmobile" equipped with various weapons and gadgets, Catwoman attempts to knock theHuntressout of the race by destroying her motorcycle. Unfortunately for her, Huntress outsmarts her and Catwoman ends up being taken out herself when her car is forced off a cliff. At the end of the episode, she and the rest of the villains are shown captured in a sph...

characters.name: Catwoman_(Tomorrowverse)
characters.description: Catwomanwas the criminal alias used bySelina Kyle. The illegitimate daughter ofCarmine Falconeand an unnamed woman, she was a high-class burglar and occasional ally ofBatman. Around the Dark Knight's second year, Selina became involved in his investigations into the Falcone Crime Family and later helped him battleTwo-Faceand other "freaks".

characters.name: Chameleon
characters.description: TheChameleonwas a villain and character created forThe New Adventures of Batman. He is in reality a robot operated by dwarf scientist,Dr. Devious.

characters.name: Chancer
characters.description: Chanceris a low-tier super-villain inGotham Cityand enemy toBatman. He is a professional-criminal who seems to have almost nothing but good luck for his criminal operations that apparently stems from his, "Baton of Luck".

characters.name: Charlatan
characters.description: On the world known as Earth-Two, some time after Harvey Dent (Two-Face) was cured, a movie company heard his story and made a movie. Paul Sloane played the lead and while they were filming the part where Harvey gets a face full of acid, the prop man swapped the prop acid out for real acid because Sloane stole his girlfriend. Sloane was left horribly disfigured and followed in Dent's footsteps as a super-villain. Some years later, Dent would plead with and fail to redeem the second Two-Face, as S...

characters.name: Charlie_Caligula
characters.description: Carlo CalzoneAKACharlie Caligulais a Roman Emperor themed Italian enemy ofBatmanfrom theClub of Villains.

characters.name: Charlotte_Gage-Radcliffe
characters.description: Charlotte Gage-Radcliffeis an overzealous girl with magical powers who attempted to become the nextBatgirlafterCassandra Cainretired from the role. Charlotte was convinced to give up being Batgirl but shortly returned with her new identity of theMisfit.

characters.name: Charlotte_Rivers
characters.description: Charlotte Riversis a TV anchorwoman who has a romantic relationship withBruce Wayne.

characters.name: Charlotte_Russe
characters.description: She later joined Simon in dancing the "cakewalk" to celebrate the capture of Batman, Robin and Batgirl, but the three heroes escape and defeated Simon and his gang, and trapped them with the imprisoned villains.

characters.name: Chase_Meridian_(DC_Comics)
characters.description: Dr.Chase Meridianis a criminal psychologist working inGotham City. She was later placed in charge ofArkham Towerin the aftermath ofFear State.

characters.name: Cheetah
characters.description: Dr. Barbara Ann Minervais the thirdCheetahand is the arch-nemesis ofWonder Woman. In addition to this, Cheetah has been a notable enemy toCatwoman, an inmate ofArkham Asylum, and a member of theSuicide Squad.

characters.name: Chemo
characters.description: Chemois an enemy of Metal Men,Superman,Black Lightning, and sometimesBatmanalong with having been a member of theSuicide Squad.

characters.name: Cheshire
characters.description: Cheshireis an assassin whose Vietnamese mother was raped and left to birth Jade alone. Jade became one of the deadliest assassins in the DC universe, an expert on both martial arts and poisons. Always switching from the good to bad side, she has constant on-off relationship with Speedy. She sometimes battles the Justice League and Batman, since she has history with Catman, and defends him.

characters.name: Cheshire_(Hunted)
characters.description: Jade Nguyenis a professional assassin and criminal who goes by the nameCheshire. Under the employment ofRoman Sionis, she andNosferatatry to killCatwomanandBatwomanon a rooftop when they attempt to break into Sionis' meeting with various other criminals. While battling Catwoman, Cheshire is knocked unconscious after falling to the ground, which alerts the rest of the criminals of Catwoman and Batwoman's presence.

characters.name: Cheshire_(Young_Justice)
characters.description: Cheshireis a highly-skilled assassin working for the League of Shadows. She is also Artemis's older sister.

characters.name: Chronos
characters.description: David Clintonwas a small-time Physics professor from Gotham City who developed the technology to travel in time asChronos.

characters.name: Chucko
characters.description: Chucko was a nasty bullying type who truly enjoyed inflicting misery on others. A head enforcer for his Jokerz gang, he was a lot stronger and faster than his flabby gut would lead one to believe. True to his sadistic nature, Chucko's face was always hidden behind his mocking clown mask. During the heist at Gotham Shipping to get a component for a Satellite Jammer for the Joker, he fought off Batman by firing a ray gun at him, although it was later destroyed when Batman threw a batarang at it, c...

characters.name: Chugg
characters.description: When Batman and the Ergonian Police surround the building, Zarbor sends energy into an army of robots that were stored inside a warehouse. After Zarbor sends the robots to attack, Chugg begs to him for wanting a shot of energy too, but Zarbor refuses and tells him to go away. While Zarbor observes his robot army encasing the Ergonian Police officers in bubbles, Chugg betrays him by setting the four villains free, but Zarbor escaped with the power plants.

characters.name: Clayface
characters.description: Clayfaceis the alias of eight villains appearing in comics.

characters.name: Clayface_(Cassius_Payne)
characters.description: After the Mud Pack,Preston PayneandSondra Fullerfall in love and eventually have a child together named Cassius "Clay" Payne, who became the fifth Clayface who debuted in Batman #550. The boy is separated from his parents and held in a government laboratory. The full extent of his powers are unknown. The name "Cassius Payne" is a pun on "Cassius Clay" the birthname of legendary boxer Muhammad Ali.

characters.name: Clayface_(Earth-1)
characters.description: Clayfacewas a criminal operating inGotham City. As part of a scheme orchestrated by"Harvey Dent", he impersonatedBruce Wayne's grandfatherAdrian Arkham.

characters.name: Clayface_(Filmation)
characters.description: Clayface, aliasMatt Hagen, is a villain who appears inThe New Adventures of Batman.

characters.name: Clayface_(Johnny_Williams)
characters.description: The eighthClayfacedebuted inBatman #614(June 2003), but was not formally introduced untilBatman: Gotham Knights #60(February 2005).Johnny Williamsis introduced as a former firefighter inGotham Citywho is transformed into a claylike creature by an explosion in a chemical plant. He first discovers his transformation after he accidentally kills a prostitute; horrified and stricken with guilt, he plans to commit suicide. Just then, he is approached byHushand theRiddler, who tell him that the chemica...

characters.name: Clayface_(The_WB)
characters.description: Clayface made an appearance in the 12th episode of the short-livedBirds Of Prey, and was portrayed by Kirk Baltz. That version of Clayface was a sculptor who was inspired by other people's pain. Like the other claylike villains who adopted the alias of Clayface, he was a shapeshifter, but his superpowers were explained that came from taking a special formula that was specifically tailored by a crooked scientist to work with his D.N.A. In that series, he is hired by theJokerto defeatCatwoman. He ...

characters.name: Clayface_(Todd_Russell)
characters.description: ClayfaceVII debuted inCatwomanVol. 3 #1(January, 2002), but is not actually shown untilCatwomanVol. 3 #4(May, 2002). This version of Clayface is not named untilCatwomanVol. 3 #44. Having the power to change into virtually any shape and size, he preys upon prostitutes inGotham City's East End until Catwoman is able to incarcerate his shriveled body inside a freezer.

characters.name: Clayface_(Young_Justice)
characters.description: Clayfaceis a mutant supervillain who fought against the Justice League.

characters.name: Claything
characters.description: The sixthClayface, also known asClaything, debuted inBatman #550. Claything is created when a skin sample fromCassius Paynecomes to life and merges with a DEO (Department of Extranormal Operations) scientist, Dr. Peter Malley. He has the ability to melt objects simply by looking at them. Claything is destroyed and his remains are stored at the DEO Headquarters.

characters.name: Clock_King
characters.description: Clock Kingis a title used by two fictional supervillains. The first Clock King debuted inWorld's Finest Comics#111 (August 1960), and was created by France Herron and Lee Elias.

characters.name: Clock_King_(DC_Animated_Universe)
characters.description: The Clock Kingwas a criminal obsessed with precise timing. His crimes often targetedGotham City's MayorHamilton Hill, who he blamed for ruining his life.

characters.name: Clownface
characters.description: The villain that would come to be known asClownfaceoriginally began as a stray piece of Clayface's body that became unattached and gained enough sentience to morph itself into a mute old man. This man was found and taken to Arkham Manor because of his unresponsiveness.Bruce Waynewho was undercover as Jack Shaw in the manor, was able to recognize the man as a portion of Clayface but avoided blowing his own cover to alert the guards.

characters.name: Clownhunter
characters.description: Clownhunteris an anti-heroic vigilante inGotham Cityfixated on killing theJokerand his supporters.

characters.name: Cluemaster
characters.description: Arthur BrownortheCluemasteris a criminal mastermind enemy ofBatmanand the evil estranged father ofStephanie Brown. After losing his job as a game-show host, he became a criminal mastermind who left behind puzzles like theRiddler, before abandoning this gimmick for more strategic schemes.

characters.name: Cluemaster_(Matsudaverse)
characters.description: TheCluemasteris a villain in the TV animated seriesThe Batman.

characters.name: Colonel_Blimp
characters.description: Colonel Blimpis a minorBatmanenemy who relies on blimps and zeppelins in his crimes.

characters.name: Colonel_Gumm
characters.description: Colonel Gummwas a villain created for thelive-action Batman television seriesof the late 60s. He later calls himselfGeneral GumminBatman '66.

characters.name: Composite_Superman
characters.description: First appearing inWorld's Finest Comics #142, June 1964, Joseph Meach was a high diver who had fallen on hard times. In an attempt to draw publicity to himself, Meach set up a water tank on a sidewalk inMetropolisand dived off a high building. Unbeknownst to Meach, the plastic tank he used was leaking, leaving only an inch of water; and Meach would have died if not for the intervention ofSuperman. The Man of Steel, upon hearing of Meach's misfortunes, obtained a job for him at the Superman Museu...

characters.name: Court_of_Owls
characters.description: TheCourt of Owlsis an aristocratic secret society which is centuries old with immense power and influence embedded into the very architecture and history ofGotham City. The Court of Owls was created by writerScott Snyderand artistGreg Capulloand made its first appearance inBatman(Volume 2) #1.

characters.name: Crazy_Quilt
characters.description: Paul DekkerAKACrazy Quiltis an enemy ofBatman. He was a painter who was driven insane, causing him to commit crimes themed around colours and quilts. In the New 52, he was reimagined as a deranged mad geneticist/artist namedDr. Paul Dekkerwho was obsessed with studying immortality, leading him to "quilt" life in unnatural and horrific ways.

characters.name: Crazy_Quilt_II
characters.description: Crazy Quilt IIis the successor ofCrazy Quilt. She is against both theJustice LeagueandBatman.

characters.name: Creach_(Earth-43)
characters.description: Creachwas aVampireand a former member ofDracula's family before being 'recruited' by theJoker.

characters.name: Creature_from_Planet_X
characters.description: TheCreature from Planet Xis an alien enemy ofBatman.

characters.name: Creeper
characters.description: Jack Ryder is an outspoken television newscaster and reporter for a Gotham City TV station. As Ryder, he is the anchorman of a show in which he deliberately antagonizes his guests in order to raise attention on hot topics, like stem cell research and medical nanotech. During his research on the revolutionary "nanocells" therapy of Doctor Vincent Yatz, he discovered an experimental mixture which enabled the body to regenerate to the point of completely replacing the skin of a badly scarred burn v...

characters.name: Creote
characters.description: Creoteis a character created byGail Simonefor theBirds of Preyseries.

characters.name: Crime_Doctor
characters.description: For a while, it seemed that Thorne's mind had been destroyed due to the incident, but still, doctors held out a slim hope for recovery and a the Crime Doctor later resurfaced during a crisis of the multiverse. Thorne had returned to his criminal career, his mind seemingly intact, though Thorne's continued knowledge of Batman's true identity was in doubt. The Crime Doctor usually never took part in physical battles against superheroes, but he was recruited byLex LuthorandBrainiacinto their superv...

characters.name: Crime_Doctor_(Bradford_Thorne)
characters.description: For a while, it seemed that Thorne's mind had been destroyed due to the incident, but still, doctors held out a slim hope for recovery and a the Crime Doctor later resurfaced during a crisis of the multiverse. Thorne had returned to his criminal career, his mind seemingly intact, though Thorne's continued knowledge of Batman's true identity was in doubt. The Crime Doctor usually never took part in physical battles against superheroes, but he was recruited byLex LuthorandBrainiacinto their superv...

characters.name: Crime_Syndicate
characters.description: The Crime Syndicatealso known as theCrime Syndicate of America,Crime Syndicate of Amerika, and theCrime Societyis a fictional supervillain team of DC Comics. It is one of the DC's parallel universe where the evil counterparts ofJustice Leaguewho they often fight.

characters.name: Crimson_Knight
characters.description: The Crimson KnightAKARichard "Dick" Lyonsis a knight themed mobster enemy ofBatmanwho faked the identity of a vigilante ally to the Dynamic Duo.

characters.name: Crispus_Allen
characters.description: Crispus Allenwas a member of theGotham City Police Department, partnered withDetective Montoyafor many years.

characters.name: Crux
characters.description: Shortly afterJason Todd,Roy Harper, andStarfirejoin up to form a makeshift team, Crux finds a picture of Starfire posted to the internet. Seeing as it was a Tamaranean ship that killed his parents, Crux feels that Starfire is partially to blame for the accident, even though she wasn't actually involved. Crux tracks down Starfire in Colorado, where Jason and Roy are dealing with a threat known as the Untitled, and attacks. Knowing he probably can't beat Starfire outright, Crux baits her into foll...

characters.name: Curar%C3%A9
characters.description: Curaréwas a member of theSociety of Assassins, and its deadliest and most infallible killer.

characters.name: Curtis_Base
characters.description: Curtis Basewas a corrupt businessman who used a lifelike mask to try and imitate theJoker.

characters.name: Cyborg
characters.description: Upon release from medical care, he found his life was seriously inconvenienced with the fearful reactions of the public at his implants; even his girlfriend rejected him. In addition, he was also disallowed his participation in athletics not only for his implants but for his poor grades which were further exacerbated by his long convalescence. However, when his old friend attempted to use Victor's troubles to manipulate him into attempting a terrorist attack on the United Nations, Victor found a...

characters.name: Cyclotronic_Man
characters.description: Ned CreeganaliasCyclotronic Man,One Man MeltdownandBag O'Bonesis an enemy ofBatmanand theOutsiders.

characters.name: Cynthia
characters.description: Cynthiawas a synthoid created by Louie forHoward Groote.

characters.name: Cypher
characters.description: Cypher first appeared in the episode Control. He tried to capture Dr. Jason Burr for the League of Assassins, in order to steal the plans for the Ion Cortex, to work for the organization from within his mind. Though he managed to gain temporary control over Katana, and later Batman, the two heroes were able to defeat and capture him. Then he made small appearance in the episode Reckoning, where he and other super-villains from Blackgate prison were hired by Ra's al Ghul to kill Batman. For killi...

characters.name: Cypher_(Beware_the_Batman)
characters.description: Cypher first appeared in the episode Control. He tried to capture Dr. Jason Burr for the League of Assassins, in order to steal the plans for the Ion Cortex, to work for the organization from within his mind. Though he managed to gain temporary control over Katana, and later Batman, the two heroes were able to defeat and capture him. Then he made small appearance in the episode Reckoning, where he and other super-villains from Blackgate prison were hired by Ra's al Ghul to kill Batman. For killi...

characters.name: Cyrus_Pinkney
characters.description: Cyrus Pinkney: April 22, 1846: Our recent financial troubles have forced us into business with one Henry Cobblepot, a print magnate of questionable repute. The man cares little for me and my 'base station', as he put it. And so the negotiations are left to Solomon. But I fear his idealism shall lead us down a treacherous road. For Cobblepot is a sneak - and surely his sweet words mask a nefarious intent.

characters.name: Dagger
characters.description: Thirty years after Batman had battled the arch-criminalthe Dagger, a second Dagger surfaced in Gotham, this one a motorcyclist in a purple costume with daggers strapped to his arms and legs. The outfit was accented by orange gloves and boots, a kerchief concealing his nose and mouth, and a "D" on his chest.

characters.name: Dagger_(David_Rennington)
characters.description: Thirty years after Batman had battled the arch-criminalthe Dagger, a second Dagger surfaced in Gotham, this one a motorcyclist in a purple costume with daggers strapped to his arms and legs. The outfit was accented by orange gloves and boots, a kerchief concealing his nose and mouth, and a "D" on his chest.

characters.name: Dagger_Clown
characters.description: The Dagger Clownwas aRed Trianglethug that wields daggers.

characters.name: Daggett_Industries
characters.description: Daggett Industriesis a amoral company was run byRoland Daggett. Originating from the episodeFeat of Clay Part IofBatman: The Animated Series, the company and is most commonly affiliated with the tragic backstory ofClayface.

characters.name: Dala
characters.description: DalaAKADala DuBoisis avampire, and ally of the vampiric super-villain known asThe Monk. Dala is notable for being the very first femaleBatman Villainand also one of the antagonists inBatman's first ever two part story.

characters.name: Daniel_Mockridge
characters.description: Daniel Mockridgeis a character in the television showBatman: The Animated Series.

characters.name: Daredevil
characters.description: Daredevilwas the alias ofMatthew "Matt "Murdock, a blind lawyer from New York that moonlights as a vigilante crimefighter. UnlikeBatman, he lives and operates on a modest salary with a minimal amount of weapons and gadgets.

characters.name: Dark_Claw
characters.description: Dark Clawis a character of the Amalgam Universe which is presented by Access. He is a result of Batman merging with Marvel Comics'Wolverine. Along with Super Soldier (An amalgamation of Superman and Captain America) and Spider-Boy (An amalgamation of Ben Reilly and Conner Kent), Dark Claw is one of Amalgam's most popular characters.

characters.name: Darkseid
characters.description: Darkseid is a New God of the Fourth World, one of the most powerful beings in the DC Multiverse. As a major enemy of theJLA,Batmanhas outwitted Darkseid on several occasions. Darkseid created theHyper-Adapterto torment the Wayne family throughout time.

characters.name: Dave_the_Dummy
characters.description: Dave the Dummywas a former member ofCatwoman’s gang. He was later disguised as a juror byLucky PierreduringJokerand Catwoman’s trial.

characters.name: David_Cain
characters.description: David Cainwas a master assassin, servant ofRa's Al Ghul, former mentor toBruce Wayne, former lover ofLady Shiva, and father toCassandra Cain. Cain follows his own code of conduct and has but one loyalty; the highest bidder.

characters.name: David_Wheeler
characters.description: David Wheelerwas an unscrupulous child psychologist who ran a therapy ranch for troubled kids.

characters.name: David_Zavimbe
characters.description: Batwing is a representative of Batman Incorporated from the city of Tinasha, within the Democratic Republic of Congo. Batwing, The Batman of Africa was created by writer Grant Morrison and first depicted by artist Yanick Paquette. He first appeared in the fifth issue of Batman, Incorporated. According to fellow Batman, Incorporated artist, Chris Burnham told iFanboy that he designed the character first, while Paquette was the first to draw him in interiors. In line with Morrison's use of obscure...

characters.name: Dawn_Golden
characters.description: Dawn Goldenis a character that plays a major role in the Golden Dawn storyline, which ran throughout the entirety ofBatman: The Dark Knight. Her sudden disappearance sets the events of the story into motion, and as the story progresses, Dawn is revealed to be a childhood friend ofBruce Wayne.

characters.name: Dawn_Robbins
characters.description: Dawn Robbinswas a spoiled and bored movie actress who was the target of a scheme byThe PenguininThe Penguin's a Jinx.

characters.name: Dawnfire
characters.description: Dawnfirewas a member of the African super-hero team,The Kingdom, murdered by the villainMassacre.

characters.name: Deacon_Blackfire
characters.description: Deacon BlackfireAKAJoseph Blackfireis a manipulative and power-hungry cult-leader who affects warped and perverted variations of religious zealotry, and practices brainwashing, occult rituals, and worship of his own being.

characters.name: Deadman
characters.description: Boston Brandis a ghost, formerly a circus acrobat who was murdered during a trapeze performance by a mysterious assailant known only as Hook.

characters.name: Deathstroke
characters.description: Deathstroke the Terminator, more often referred to as simplyDeathstroke, is a villain published by DC Comics. First appearing inNew Teen Titans#2,Slade Wilsonis a former soldier turned mercenary and assassin hired by those who can bid the highest. He is often considered an enemy of theTeen TitansandDick Grayson's arch-nemesis. However, Deathstroke has often encounteredBatmaneither due to contracts within Gotham and conflicts involving theJustice League. He is also the father ofGrant,JosephandRos...

characters.name: Debbie_Yamamoto
characters.description: Debbie Yamamotowas a TV news reporter inThe New Adventures of Batman.

characters.name: Deity
characters.description: Deitywas a superhero operating in Congo and one of the members ofThe Kingdom.

characters.name: Dick_Grayson
characters.description: The youngest in a family of acrobats known as the "Flying Graysons," Dick watched as a mafia boss killed his parents in order to extort money from the circus that employed them (whose name was later revealed to beTony Zucco). Bruce Wayne, secretly the vigilante Batman, took him in as his legal ward after witnessing their deaths, and eventually as his sidekick,Robin.

characters.name: Dick_Grayson_(Beyondverse)
characters.description: Dick Graysonwas a retired superhero named Nightwing who suffered a past injury which took his right eye and put a bullet in his spine. While Dick Grayson is only mentioned on the show, he appears in an issue of the 2010 unlimitedBatman Beyondcomic series. He makes his debut in the issue "Hush Beyond".

characters.name: Dinah_Drake_Lance
characters.description: Dinah Drake-Lancewas the originalBlack Canaryand long-time member of theJustice Society of America. She is also the mother ofDinah Laurel Lance, the second Black Canary.

characters.name: Dinah_Laurel_Lance
characters.description: Dinah Lance was born into a family of crime fighters: her father Larry Lance, was a police officer and her mother was the original Black Canary.

characters.name: Director_Bones
characters.description: The team kidnapped the InfinitorFuryin an attempt to extort money. Although they were defeated by Fury's teammates,Infinity, Inc., Helix managed to escape. Later, the second Wildcat (Yolanda Montez) learned that she was in fact a cousin of Helix's new member, Carcharo, and that they are both products of the same genetic experiments as Helix. The two teams battled to a stalemate and Mr. Bones was arrested while the others escaped. Carcharo soon turned on the Helix and kidnapped Mr. Bones. In the ...

characters.name: Dr._Burton
characters.description: Dr. Burton's name and wild black kinky hairstyle is a reference toTim Burton, who directedBatmanandBatman Returnsand given top billing producer credit onBatman ForeveroverPeter MacGregor-Scottto aleivate any fan fears about his replacement as director of theBatman Film Franchise. This character is a creation ofJanet Scott Batchler.

characters.name: Ducra
characters.description: Ducra was a woman who was over 3.000 years old and was the leader of the All Caste. She knows about theLazarus Pitsand can smell it on other people. After Jason Todd was raised from the dead,Taliaintroduced Jason to Ducra. Talia hoped that Jason still can be a great man if he get the proper Guidance - Ducra! Ducra said, that Jason will be the death of many people but she trained him. Years later, Jason returned to theChamber of Alland found the dead body of Ducra.

characters.name: Duela_Dent
characters.description: Duela Dentis an enemy turned former-member of both theTeen TitansandTitans East. Introduced under the alias ofJoker's Daughter, she has also used the aliases "Catgirl", "Scarecrone", "Riddler's Daughter", "Penguin's Daughter", "Card Queen", and "Harlequin".

characters.name: Duke_Thomas
characters.description: Duke Thomasis a vigilante and a member of theBat-Family. He joined the We Are Robin movement and became one of hundred of civilian teenagers to don the Robin R and fight for their city. Eventually, he would leave the movement and join the Batman Family as the vigilante calledThe Signal.

characters.name: Earth_Strike
characters.description: Earth Strikewas a founding member ofThe Kingdom, an African-based supergroup.

characters.name: Earthmover
characters.description: Tony Maychekwas a close friend and employee ofBill Wallace, until the tragic accident that turned him intoEarthmover.

characters.name: Eddie_Burlow
characters.description: Eddie is a young security guard at the asylum, a rookie.

characters.name: El_Diablo
characters.description: The third person to take the identity ofEl Diablowas an ex-criminal namedChato Santana.

characters.name: Electro
