characters.description: Electrois a villain and character created specifically forThe New Adventures of Batman.

characters.name: Eli_Strange
characters.description: Eli is first seen playing a game of poker with the Russian mob, betting a valuable bracelet, winning big and cleaning house. Before he can walk away with his winnings, the mobster forces him to play another hand, in which he discovers Eli's sleeve loaded with cards. Before he can give the order to have him killed, the mobster's thugs realize their bracelet (Eli's was a fake replica) had been stolen,Catwomanpouncing from the ceiling and taking out the entire group of criminals. She thanks Eli for...

characters.name: Enigma
characters.description: Enigma, who is the Riddler's Daughter, has been a member of both the Teen Titans and the Titans East. She has been the heroic and criminal partner ofDuela Dent, daughter of Harvey Dent.

characters.name: Ergonian_Commander
characters.description: After freeing Robin, the Dynamic Duo, Bat-Mite and the commander followed the energy readings from the power plants Zarbor stole from Gotham City to an amusement park, where Joker, Penguin, Catwoman and Clayface were caught by a giant clown animatron activated by Zarbor, and the heroes captured in a net. The commander gave Batman a pair of cuffs that will deplete Zarbor's powers, and after tricking and defeating Zarbor, the commander later explains to Batman and Robin that while the power plant ...

characters.name: Eric_Cohen
characters.description: Eric Cohenis a detective in the Gotham City Police Department.

characters.name: Eric_Needham
characters.description: Eric Needham was a small time crook who was addicted to heroin. Eric was first sentenced to prison after mugging and nearly killing an elderly woman but, as a minor, he was out in three years. Over the next twenty-four months, Eric married his friend Linda Morrel and they had a son, Michael. Desperate for money to buy more drugs, Needham continued to steal to support his habit, culminating in a fateful liquor store robbery. Gunning down a customer who'd lunged for him, Eric realized far too late...

characters.name: Essence
characters.description: Essence is a mysterious female entity with links toJason Todd's training to become the Red Hood.

characters.name: Esther_Cobblepot
characters.description: Esther was the wife ofTucker Cobblepot. She was said to have been an active member of theDaughters of the American Revolution. Her maiden name was unknown and she likely came from a family in Gotham's high society as she married into the Cobblepot Family, who were known for wealth that was on par with the Wayne Family.

characters.name: Ethan_Bennett
characters.description: Ethan Bennettwas aGCPDDetective before he was driven insane by theJokerand transformed intoClayface.

characters.name: Etrigan
characters.description: Etrigan was a demon from Hell who usually found himself allied to the forces of good. Etrigan resembled a squat, muscular human with orange (or yellow) skin, horns, red eyes, and ears resembling bat wings.

characters.name: Felicity_Strode
characters.description: Not much is known about Felicity Strode prior to her marryingHenri Ducardbut she was an expert assassin for a terrorist organization. While they kept their lives secret from each other they did bear child andMorgan Ducardwas born.

characters.name: Frenchy_Blake
characters.description: "Frenchy" Blakewas the head of ajewelry theft gangoperating duringBatman's early days. He was among the first criminals the Dark Knight apprehended after a series of heists from wealthy citizens.

characters.name: Gardener
characters.description: The GardenerAKADr.Bella Gartenis a super-villain introduced asPoison Ivy's eco-terrorist ex-girlfriend.

characters.name: George_Grayson
characters.description: George Graysonis a crook and the brother ofJohn Graysonand uncle ofDick Grayson. He, along with his wife Clara, Dick's auntHarriet Cooper, andCharles Grayson, are some of the only remaining relatives of Dick Grayson.

characters.name: Ghost-Maker
characters.description: Ghost-Maker(Minhkhoa Khan) was the childhood friend turned rival ofBatman. Having trained to become a vigilante, he took on more lethal means to fight crime and often worked off-grid. After theJoker Wartore up parts of Gotham, Ghost-Maker came to Gotham to take over protection from Batman, though events led him to leave and become friendly with the superhero. Ghost-Maker would later leave the city after helping foil plans by theScarecrowandSimon Saint, mentoring the vigilanteClownhunterand becom...

characters.name: Gilda_Dent
characters.description: Gilda Dentis a fictional character who has appeared inBatmancomic books sinceDetective Comics#66 (August 1942), alongside her fiancée Harvey Dent (soon to be the criminal mastermindTwo-Face) . She has since been a recurring character throughout Batman stories with Two-Face.

characters.name: Goliath_(Dragon_Bat)
characters.description: Goliathis a paranormal Dragon Bat pet ofDamian Wayne'sRobin.

characters.name: Gotham_Girl
characters.description: Claire Cloveris ametahumanoperating inGotham Citywho underwent experimental treatment with her older brother,Hank, that granted them superpowers. The two operated as superheroes under the aliases ofGothamandGotham Girl. After Hank's death, Claire joined the Batfamily, though she fell under the influence of thePsycho PirateandBane.

characters.name: Gray_Face
characters.description: Gray Facewas a name used by millionaire shipownerBlair Gownset. Gownset posed as a mystical Malayan crimelord inGotham City's chinatown.

characters.name: Green_Arrow
characters.description: Green ArrowAKAOliver Queenis a vigilante from the city of Star(ling) City, California who uses archery and a Robin Hood gimmick. He is occasional super-heroic partner toBatman. He teamed up with him when they were members of theJustice League of America.

characters.name: Gregorian_Falstaff
characters.description: Gregorian Falstaffwas a corrupt magnate that rivaledBruce Wayne. Falstaff often came into conflict withLucius FoxatWayne Enterprisesand secretly worked forRa's al Ghul.

characters.name: Grendel
characters.description: Grendel, also known by his other alias asHunter Rose, and later nicknamedThe Devilby his enemies, was a psychotic assassin turned feared crimelord who used to haunt the streets of New Jersey before his death.

characters.name: Grim_Knight
characters.description: TheGrim Knightis a version ofBruce Waynefrom the Dark Multiverse brought to Prime Earth bythe Batman Who Laughs. He is an alternate reality version of himself who was an enemy of the law and murdered all the criminals which he came across.

characters.name: Grumpy
characters.description: Grumpywas an accomplice of theJokerin theRobbery of Gotham National Bank.

characters.name: Gwen_Altamont
characters.description: Gwen Altamont reenters Selina Kyle's life at the funeral for their fellow friend,Lola MacIntire. The pair meet up with each other afterwards so they can catch up. Gwen tells Selina that she is a fence now and would be willing to fence for her.

characters.name: Gypsy
characters.description: Gypsystarted her career as a superhero in Detroit with the Justice League of America. As the mysterious Gypsy she is an unseen defender of justice. She has been associated with the Justice League Task Force, the Conglomerate, and the Birds of Prey.

characters.name: Haley_the_Dog
characters.description: HaleyisDick Grayson's dog who briefly became the superhero known asBitewing

characters.name: Hank_Clover
characters.description: After his death, Hank's body was recovered byHarvey Dentfor his muscular build, with the intention of ressuscitating his corpse withLazarus ResinandVenomand masquerade him asBanein his Task Force Z project.[1]With his memories rewritten byMister Bloomand The Thinker and under the leadership of theRed HoodHank worked as one of the undead peons of Dent to fight crime in the city under the mask of Bane. This would come to a first stop when Red Hood asked for increases in Lazarus Resin intakes with ...

characters.name: Harley_Quinn
characters.description: Harley Quinnis a character created for the showBatman: The Animated Series. She first appears in the episode "Joker's Favor" and has frequently appeared ever since. She began asJoker'smolland then retconned to be his former psychiatrist atArkham Asylum. Quinn eventually become a well known Gotham criminal in her own right, frequently working withPoison Ivyon crime sprees.

characters.name: Harley_Quinn_(Batman_Ninja)
characters.description: Harley Quinnwas working for theJokerin Gotham City and the enemy ofBatman. After being transported to Feudal Japan byGorilla Grodd, she assisted Joker in fighting for control over the country with other villains, includingTwo-Face,The Penguin,Poison IvyandDeathstroke.

characters.name: Harley_Quinn_(DC_Comics)
characters.description: Dr. Harleen Frances Quinzel, also known asHarley Quinn(a pun on the word "harlequin"), first appeared in theBatman: The Animated Seriesepisode "Joker's Favor", where she served as a humorous female sidekick tothe Joker. In her first appearances she was depicted as a character completely devoted to the Joker, totally oblivious to his psychotic nature and obvious lack of affection for her; this characterization has remained more or less consistent throughout her subsequent appearances.

characters.name: Harley_Quinn_(Injustice_Universe)
characters.description: Harley Quinnis a supporting anti-hero ofInjustice: Gods Among Us(2013) and a major character ofInjustice 2(2017). She is a playable character and uses a variety of weapons, from a massive hammer to booby-trapped gifts. Thus, she is a Gadget User.

characters.name: Harley_Sinn
characters.description: Harley Sinnwas an enemy ofHarley Quinn, but eventually became an ally, and began fighting against many of Harley Quinn's numerous enemies.

characters.name: Harold_Allnut
characters.description: Harold has two major disabilities: he is mute therefore cannot speak, as well as having a misshapen body, much like a hunchback, even his own mother being repelled by him. Nevertheless, he has proven to be very gifted in terms of technology and electronics. Harold first appeared inThe Question#33 (December 1989), where he was expelled from his house inGotham City, and ended up in Hub City. His first appearance in a Batman comic was inBatman# 448 (early June 1990), which was Part 1 of The Penguin...

characters.name: Harriet_Cooper
characters.description: Harriet Cooper, best known simply as Aunt Harriet from the Batman television series, is a character that first appeared in the comic book Detective Comics #328 (June 1964).Created by writerBill Fingerand artistSheldon Moldoff, the character is the paternal aunt ofBruce Wayne's ward,Dick Grayson.

characters.name: Harvey_Bullock
characters.description: Harvey Bullockis aGCPD officerknown for his dislike ofBatmanand his alliance withCommissioner Gordon.

characters.name: Harvey_Bullock_(Earth-1)
characters.description: Harvey Bullockwas a police detective from Hollywood, California.

characters.name: Harvey_Dent
characters.description: Two-Faceis a criminal split between "good" and "evil" sides. OnceGotham City's amiable and courteous District Attorney,Harvey Dentwas one ofBatman's closest allies and friends, working with the vigilante to clean up the city. However, after being horribly disfigured during a trial, Dent's sanity fractured and he became one of the city's most notorious criminals, obsessed with duality, fate, chance and (occasionally) the number two. Unlike other villains, Two-Face often is displayed as having a m...

characters.name: Harvey_Dent_(Earth-1)
characters.description: The twin brother of Jessica Dent, Harvey was the more brash and aggressive of the siblings. Whilst his sister befriendedBruce Wayne, he bullied the billionaire, due tohis motherbeing a member of theArkham familyand their history of mental health issues. During one particular incident outside theArkham Manor, Harvey mocked Bruce with the murder-suicide of his grandparents, eventually causing Wayne to lash out and fight him. Some time after they graduated High School, Bruce attempted to make conta...

characters.name: Harvey_Harris
characters.description: Harvey Harrisis an expert detective and mentor toBatman, one of the few people to deduce his identity.

characters.name: Havana
characters.description: Beginning her life, Sergeant Rock and Bulldozer go about recruiting new members for the Suicide Squad, including Havana and Modem. As the rookies, they were learning from the minds of World War II veterans and the ways of the squad. As they watch the other members do their mission, Havana sees that the Suicide Squad go on a mission to an island that is inhabited by evolved, mutated, dangerous ants. The team accomplishes their mission of killing the ant queen but only one member of the Squad surv...

characters.name: Helena_Bertinelli
characters.description: The HuntressisHelena Rosa Bertinelliis an ally to and member of theBat-Family. She is a murderous vigilante who specializes in the use of a crossbow. Helena was also for a time one of the versions ofBatgirland is a regular member of theBirds of Prey.

characters.name: Hired_Killer_Number_5
characters.description: The fifth hired killer to try and take out a hit onHarley Quinnwas a large and tall man who was easily defeated by her and, due to his size, was fed to the newly rescued dogs that she brought home with her.

characters.name: Holly_Robinson
characters.description: Holly Robinsonmade her first appearance inFrank Miller'sBatman: Year Oneas a 13-year-old prostitute who lives withSelina Kyle. Holly plays a small but significant role in the story when she encounters a disguisedBruce Wayneduring one of his early attempts at crimefighting and stabs him in the leg. Wounded by this attack and a subsequent battle, Wayne escapes back to his home, brooding on the fact that his enemies do not fear him. This encounter is an impetus for his creation of the Batman person...

characters.name: Hugo_Strange
characters.description: Professor Hugo Strangeis a major adversary toBatman. First appearing inDetective Comics#36, he is Batman's oldest adversary and one of his most dangerous foes. Initially a mad scientist who utilized various scientific methods to fuel his schemes, Strange has often been depicted as obsessed with Batman's identity and even donning the role himself. He is also one of the first foes to learn of his dual identity of Bruce Wayne.

characters.name: Hugo_Strange_(Arkhamverse)
characters.description: During Bruce's second year as Batman, Professor Strange treated various people with psychological issues and often used his treatment sessions with his patients as a front to further his own agenda through experimentation. One of those patients wasAlberto Falcone, the heir to the Falcone Crime Family. Strange operated out of Blackgate Prison withHarleen Quinzelas his intern and established a residence and secondary office at Park Row in Old Gotham. Behind the scenes, Strange lusted to achieve do...

characters.name: Hulk
characters.description: Bruce created the Gamma Bomb, but during testing Banner noticed that a civilian, Rick Jones, had snuck onto the testing area. He was able to throw Jones into a protective trench, but couldn't get himself to safety. The bomb detonated and Bruce was changed by the gamma radiation, which caused him to frequently transform into the vastly powerful, green-skinned, humanoid monster called Hulk in times of great stress.

characters.name: Huntress_(Carol_Danvers)
characters.description: Carol Danvers was an adventurer who went by the name of the Huntress. As the Huntress, she broke into the loft of Logan Wayne, aka,Dark Claw, tracking down leads to Creed H. Quinn,the Hyena. As she snooped through the loft, she came across the greatest secret of all: the costumes of Dark Claw and thus his true identity. Before she could leave, Dark Claw entered through a passage way behind the closet and pinned the Huntress to the ground. Undecided what to do with the intruder, the two began to ...

characters.name: Huntress_(Crisis_on_Infinite_Earths)
characters.description: Huntressis an Earth-2 vigilante created byHelena Wayne, the daughter ofBatmanandCatwoman.

characters.name: Huntress_(The_Brave_and_the_Bold)
characters.description: Huntressis a supporting character inBatman: The Brave and the Bold.

characters.name: Hush
characters.description: Dr. Thomas "Tommy" Elliotwas a childhood friend ofBruce Wayne. He becomes a costumed criminal who targets both Batman and Bruce Wayne. Although Hush's name originates from a nursery rhyme,Hushlives up to it by using manipulation and guile instead of noisy "signatures". Tommy and Bruce Wayne were childhood friends, and unbeknownst to Bruce, dark reflections of each other. A childhood sociopath, Elliot tried to kill his parents so he could inherit their fortune. When his plan failed, due partly to...

characters.name: Iceberg
characters.description: Icebergwas a member of the Suicide Squad, who has powers to control ice.

characters.name: Iman_Avesta
characters.description: Iman Avestais a Special Agent withinAmanda Waller'sAgencywho worked with the vigilanteBatmanto capture a criminal cabal calledthe Pact. After their defeat, Avesta worked with the vigilante to uncover Waller's operations in the Agency andthe Jokerreign of terror.

characters.name: Iron-Hat_Ferris
characters.description: Iron-Hat Ferriswas a villain who appeared inBatman Issue 39.

characters.name: Ivy_Pepper
characters.description: Ivy "Pamela" Pepperis a criminal and eco-terrorist in Gotham who has poisonous powers.

characters.name: Jack_Drake
characters.description: A well respected businessman and archeologist, Jack Drake was a man who could never stay down in one place for long lengths of time. He stayed, however, inGotham Citylong enough to meet a young woman named Janet, who would later become his wife. The couple became a strong team in business, expanding their company far and wide. As time passed, Janet gave birth to the Drake's first and only son, Timothy. Although the Drakes loved their son, business always seemed to take a higher priority; Tim was...

characters.name: Jack_Edison
characters.description: Jack Edisonis a stunt driver and mechanical engineer that owesBatmana life debt. Edison is brilliant enough in automotive engineering that Batman comes to him to design and build hisBatmobiles.

characters.name: Jack_Napier_(White_Knight)
characters.description: Jack Napier, also known as theWhite Knightand theJokeris the protagonist of the storyBatman: White Knightand is a recurring character in its sequelBatman: Curse of the White Knight.

characters.name: Jackie_Napier_(White_Knight)
characters.description: Jackie Napier, is one of the twin children of Harley Quinn andJack Napier, also known as the notorious Joker.

characters.name: Jacob_Kane
characters.description: Colonel Jacob Kane is the father of Katherine "Kate" Kane who is also known as Batwoman.

characters.name: James_Gordon
characters.description: James Worthington "Jim" Gordonis Commissioner of theGotham City Police Departmentand one ofBatman's most trusted allies. Created byBill FingerandBob Kane, he first appeared inDetective Comics#27 (May 1939) and served as one of Batman's first supporting character. In most incarnations, Gordon is the police commissioner ofGotham City. He shares the hero’s deep commitment of ridding the dark and corrupting city of crime.

characters.name: James_Gordon_(Earth-1)
characters.description: James Worthington Gordonwas a detective in the Gotham Police Department. After his wife's death, he became disillusioned and fallen into line with the rest of the GCPD. After allying withthe Batmanto capture a prolific serial killer, Gordon began working with the Dark Knight to clean the city.

characters.name: James_Gordon_(Earth-43)
characters.description: While investigating mysterious 'throat-slash' murders- the victims' throats having been slashed and their bodies almost completely drained of blood-, hampered by the mayor's reluctance to publically admit that there was anything wrong dur to the concerns about the bad impression it would create, Gordon suspected that there was something more strange than usual about the murders, but even he could never have predicted the truth. When Batman revealed his new ally,Tanya, to Gordon, Gordon was shock...

characters.name: James_Gordon_(Gotham)
characters.description: James Gordonis a former soldier rookie detective in Gotham City. He is the central figure and focus of theGothamtelevision show.

characters.name: James_Gordon_(Reevesverse)
characters.description: Lt. James "Jim" Gordonis an officer in theGotham City Police Departmentand ally ofthe Batman. Gordon often served as a contact between the vigilante and the GCPD, often serving a mediator between them. Gordon would also help Batman on a series of cases, including the capture of mobsterCarmine Falconeand investigations intothe Riddler.

characters.name: James_Gordon_(Telltale)
characters.description: James Gordonis one of the few clean cops in theGotham City Police Departmentwho was a reluctant ally to the vigilanteBatmanand the vigilante's main contact on the force. During theChildren of Arkham's attacks onGotham City, Gordon worked with the vigilante to stop them and brokered an official partnership between him and the GCPD. After their defeat, he was promoted to Police Commissioner. A year later, Gordon worked with Batman to capturethe Pact, despite problems caused byAmanda Wallerand herA...

characters.name: Jarro
characters.description: JarrotheStarro in a Jaris an alien, "Star Conqueror" who was grown and adopted byBatman.

characters.name: Jarvis_Pennyworth
characters.description: Jarvis Pennyworth was a British man who moved to America where he was butler toThomasandMartha Waynefor many years. Jarvis assisted the couple in raising a youngBruce Waynewhile his own son Alfred was slated to take his place as Wayne butler in the case of his retirement or death. When Martha Wayne became pregnant with their second son Thomas Wayne, Jr., the Waynes and Jarvis planned on leaving Gotham City.

characters.name: Jason_Bard
characters.description: Jason Bardis a police officer with theGotham City Police Departmentworking underJames Gordon.

characters.name: Jason_Todd_(Arkhamverse)
characters.description: Jason Toddwas once Robin, and worked alongsideBatman. He was tortured and believed to be killed by theJoker. However it was discovered that Jason was alive and hell-bent on destroying his former mentor as theArkham Knightbefore he decided to assist Batman once again wanting to kill him himself. The Arkham Knight worked with bothScarecrowandDeathstroketo turnGotham Cityinto a city of fear.

characters.name: Jason_Todd_(Earth-15)
characters.description: Realizing that he was going to die, Todd decided to use reverse psychology on Superman-Prime by telling him that Earth-15's populace would never accept him, hoping it would cause Superman-Prime to either stop his attack to learn how to make the Earth-15 populace accept him or at least allow Todd to get out of Superman-Prime's reach to recover. Unfortunately rather than causing Superman-Prime to calm down, Todd's words enraged the insane Superman-Prime to the point that he decided he would rather...

characters.name: Jason_Todd_(LEGO_Animated_Universe)
characters.description: Many years later, Jason, now known as the Red Hood, organized a plan to get the entire Bat-Family together in one place. He paired up with Two-Face, who would help him by buying Wayne Tech from Bruce Wayne, who had just sold the company. Two-Face's position in the company helped him acquire Brother Eye, a new Wayne Tech entity.

characters.name: Jean-Paul_Valley
characters.description: Jean-Paul Valleyis the first vigilante in publication to go by the name ofAzrael. He is a genetically-augmented assassin and murderous vigilante for the secretive catholic extremist group, theOrder of St. Dumas.

characters.name: Jeannie
characters.description: After defeating the "Three Jokers" and uncovering the true one, Batman reveals toAlfred Pennyworththat he knows not only his identity but about Jeannie and his child. During the story's conclusion, it revealed that Jeannie had informed the GCPD of the Ace Chemicals heist and had faked her death to go into witness protection. It's also implied that the Joker may have been abusive to her (which may have been seen in the original comic as he was about to go into an angry tirade against his wife for...

characters.name: Jeremiah_Arkham
characters.description: Jeremiah Arkhamwas the sadistic head of Arkham Asylum, an institution for the criminally insane. He debuted in 1992. He became an insane supervillain, eventually becoming the secondBlack Mask.

characters.name: Jezebel_Jet
characters.description: Jezebel Jetis a former model who ran the small African country of Mtamba. Jezebel was once a lover toBruce Waynewhile secretly being an agent of the evil secret-society,The Black Glove.

characters.name: Jimmy_Clark
characters.description: Jimmy Clark was a clown in Haly's Circus who was killed by theJokerjust because he bore a resemblance to the clown prince of crime, during the events of Death in the Family (Nightwing #15)

characters.name: John_Grayson
characters.description: John Graysonis a flying trapeze artist, father toDick Grayson(the firstRobinand laterNightwing), and husband toMary Grayson.

characters.name: John_Mayhew
characters.description: Johnathan Mayhewis an eccentric and wealthy billionaire, best known for founding theClub of Heroes. While seemingly benevolent in his original silver-age appearances, as of post-crisis continuity he was reintroduced as a villainous figure.

characters.name: Jonah_Hex
characters.description: Jonah Hexwas a legendary bounty hunter on the American Old West in the 19th Century. His reputation as the deadliest man alive followed him everywhere, and he killed hundreds of men up until his death. Hex was a gruff anti-hero with a deep personal code of honor that kept him on the side of good despite his violent tendencies.Batmanhas teamed up with Hex on multiple occasions both in the past and present.

characters.name: Jubilee
characters.description: Jubilation "Jubilee" Lee(briefly known asthe Sparrow) is a member of the human subspecies known as mutants, born with superhuman abilities. She can generate pyrotechnic energy blasts from her hands. Introduced as an orphaned "mall rat" from Beverly Hills, Jubilee joined the X-Men in the early 1990s, becoming the team's youngest member and often playing a sidekick role to her father-figure,Wolverine.

characters.name: Judomaster_(Hadley_Jagger)
characters.description: Hadley Jaggerwas a WWII hero in the Pacific that became skilled in the martial arts, chief among them being judo.

characters.name: Julia_Pennyworth
characters.description: Julia PennyworthAKAPenny 2is anSRRagent and daughter toAlfred Pennyworth.

characters.name: Justice_League
characters.description: TheJustice Leagueis an organization comprised of the world's most powerful superheroes dedicated to fighting crime and injustice. Formerly known asJustice League of Americaor theJLA, they carry on the legacy of theJustice Society of America. They work a strike-force, acting as Earth's first line of defense against both terrestrial and extraterrestrial threats.

characters.name: Karl_Rossum
characters.description: Rossum retired to a farm outside Gotham, settling for a more pastoral life, though still attended by a host of his robotic creations, albeit ones that he was able to constantly watch. When the Batman android appeared begging for help at his farm, Rossum remained composed, seeing that it was H.A.R.D.A.C's persona and managed to convince him he was indeed a robotic memory, unlike many people who would panic.

characters.name: Karon
characters.description: Catwoman and Slam Bradley turn the tables on the East End's crooked cops. Meanwhile, the aforementioned cops are closing in on Holly, even rousting her closest friends. We wouldn't want to be in their path. Holly is already been hurt, but she can't seem to risk to go after the crooked cops for her girlfriend's life. Karon is the only one there for Holly, besides Selina.

characters.name: Katana
characters.description: Katanais a superb samurai, she uses her deadly sword, The Soultaker, to fight evil around the world. The mystic sword contains the soul of every person killed by it and Katana can communicate with those souls.

characters.name: Katana_(Beware_the_Batman)
characters.description: Katanais an orphaned sword-wielding martial artist/master combatant who defends Gotham City since becoming Bruce Wayne/Batman's bodyguard and ally due to Alfred Pennyworth's recuperation; the latter being her godfather.

characters.name: Kathy_Kane
characters.description: Kathy operated the traveling Kane Circus until she became embroiled in a conflict betweenRa's al GhulandThe Sensei. Targeted by theLeague of Assassinsfor her past connections to Batman, Kathy re-entered the hero's life. Tragically, while the Dark Knight was busy battling theBronze Tiger, Kathy was murdered by members of the League.

characters.name: KGBeast
characters.description: KGBeast(or in Rebirth continuity, simplyThe Beast) is a Russian super-villain, an assassin, and also an enemy ofBatman.

characters.name: Killer_Croc_(Earth-1)
characters.description: Waylon Joneswas born with a rare condition than rendered his skin reptilian. Forced to hide in theGotham Sewers, he was widely reported amongst the city asKiller Croc. Discovered byBatman, Waylon became one of the Dark Knight's allies after helping defeatthe Riddler. In return for sanctuary, he helped Batman in his war on crime, becoming one of the founding members ofthe Outsiders.

characters.name: Killer_Croc_(RWBYverse)
characters.description: Killer Crocis a scaled humanoid criminal who originally had ties withBatman, serving as a frequent enemy of his. DuringDoctor Watts'takeover of Gotham City and Central City, Killer Croc aided the Justice League when innocent lives were at stake, helping save a child from Watts' creatures. Later, he would help the Justice League and Team RWBY fight against Watts andKilg%re, resulting in their imprisonment.

characters.name: Killer_Frost_(Caitlin_Snow)
characters.description: Killer FrostAKACaitlin Snowis a meta-human supervillain and recurring member of theSuicide Squad.

characters.name: Killer_Moth
characters.description: Killer Mothis a supervillain who was primarily remembered as an antagonist ofBatgirlandBatman. Having decided that the lawbreakers ofGotham Cityneeded a costumed protector just as honest citizens had Batman, Killer Moth emulated the Dark Knight in every way, copying his paraphernalia and building on his legend to create his own super villain identity. He eventually came to resemble a dark mirror image of Batman, even adopting the alter ego of a wealthy philanthropist similar to Bruce Wayne. Moth...

characters.name: Kilowog
characters.description: Kilowogis an extraterrestrial member of theGreen Lanterncorps from the planetBolovax Vik. He often serves as a supporting character for various Green Lanterns, includingHal JordanandJohn Stewart. Though not often featured, Kilowog has often featured inBatmanstories featuring the Green Lantern Corps, though they have rarely directly interacted.

characters.name: King_of_the_Cats
characters.description: In March 1952,Gotham Citywas struck by a series of feline-related crimes, perpetrated not by the now-reformedSelina Kyle, but by a costumed criminal known as the King of Cats, a cunning mastermind whose theme revolves around cats. The King of Cats sends flowers to Kyle, causingBatmanto investigate her involvement. He soon becomes convinced that she is innocent, but asks that her, the expert on feline-themed crimes, to aid him andRobinin arresting the King of Cats. Selina, however, refuses, much ...

characters.name: Kirigi
characters.description: Kirigiwas a master of martial arts living in the Paektu mountain range in North Korea, near the border of northeast China. Master Kirigi is renowned among martial arts virtuosos for hisVibrating Palm Technique. Kirigi was the most influential ofBruce Wayne's martial arts instructors and his primary sensei.

characters.name: Kitrina_Falcone
characters.description: Kitrina FalconeorCatgirl, previously known as Kittyhawk, is the daughter ofAlberto Falcone. After her father's death, Kitrina, was raised by her uncleMario Falcone, Alberto's brother, who abused her mentally and physically due to her uniqueness. She became Catwoman's sidekick, after befriending Selina Kyle, who is allegedly her aunt.

characters.name: Klag
characters.description: Klagor theDeep Freeze Menaceis a caveman enemy ofBatman. He is a cro-magnon hunter who survived into modern day via being encased in ice which also gave him superpowers. He acts as a vigilante, unaware of modern society and under the belief that Batman is his old adversary, "Brugg".

characters.name: Knife
characters.description: Knifeis an assassin employed by The Many Arms of Death and an enemy ofBatwoman. A rather stoic and humorless woman, she holds Kate Kane personally responsible for the so-called "taming" of Coryana, which ruined the island's reputation as an independent haven.

characters.name: Knight
characters.description: Cyril Sheldrake was originally Squire to Percy Sheldrake, the original Knight, until Percy was killed by his archenemy Springheeled Jack. Following this, Cyril fell into a period of depression and turned to drugs and alcohol, which depleted his fortune. Fortunately, he later came uponSquire, a poor but kindhearted (not to mention intelligent) commoner who helped to rehabilitate Cyril. After having been completely healed, he assumed the mantle of the second Knight, and made Beryl the third Squire...

characters.name: Kyle_Abbot
characters.description: Kyle Abbotwas a member of the Intergang and a close associate ofBruno ManheimandWhisper A'Daire. He also helped them to interpret passages from the Bible of Crime. Once he realized that they intended on destroying all ofGotham City, he betrayed his colleagues and sided withNightwingandRenée Montoya.

characters.name: Legs
characters.description: One ofGotham City's many homeless people,Legsis a war veteran whose legs were blown off by a landmine. He now gets around on a tray with wheels. He has very strongly held opinions and has been caught up in the periphery of various adventures of Gotham City's costumed guardians.

characters.name: Lincoln_March
characters.description: Lincoln Marchwas a mayoral candidate and the C.O.O. of March Ventures. In reality he is a rogue member of theCourt of Owlswho believes himself to be Bruce Wayne's presumed-dead brother,Thomas Wayne Jr..

characters.name: Lois_Lane
characters.description: Lois Laneprimarily appears inSupermanstories but has encountered Batman, his allies and his enemies on numerous occasions. She is a top investigative reporter and journalist inMetropolisfor the Daily Planet.

characters.name: Lord_Batman_(Justice_Lords)
characters.description: Lord Batmanis a version of Batman from a universe controlled by theJustice Lords. Similar to hiscounterpart from the Justice League's universe, he became the protector of Gotham City after his parents' brutal murder. After the Lords took over their Earth as fascist rulers, Batman joined them in controlling the Earth. However, unlike his teammates, he was convinced to disband the system and restore free will to its citizens.

characters.name: Louis_Fairfax
characters.description: -Fairfax’s plan to deal with the unknown assassins killing off mob leaders

characters.name: Lucius_Fox
characters.description: Lucius Foxis a supporting character appearing inBatmancomic books. Fox acts asBruce Wayne's business manager who apparently unknowingly runs the business interests that supplies Batman's equipment needs as well as financing his operations. Since 2005, Lucius is often depicted as directly involved in Batman's activities, serving as either Bruce's technical supplier and ally. He was created byLen WeinandJohn Calnan, and first appeared inBatman#307 (January 1979).

characters.name: Lucius_Fox_(Telltale)
characters.description: Lucius Foxwas the head of R&D atWayne Enterprisesand friend ofBruce Wayne. Aware of his activities as Batman, he was responsible for the creation of the technology used by the vigilante in the field. Lucius closely worked with Bruce during his first years as Batman and would assist him with his technical expertise. Tragically, his life was lost duringthe Riddler'sreturn to Gotham, affecting both Bruce's operations and his family, particularly his daughterTiffany.

characters.name: Maggie_Kyle
characters.description: Her first appearance isCatwoman: Metamorphosis, where Selina Kyle is beaten up from her life as a prostitute, and a cat is there, comforting her. A nun named Sister Elizabeth talks to Sister Magdalene, about how she disappeared and how she is going to get rid of the cat at the crime scene. Magdalene offers to keep it, and is asked if she has seen Selina, but Magdalene says no. She is unaware that Selina was the prostitute. She is later seen praying in a church, with Sister Elizabeth, for Selina....

characters.name: Maggie_Sawyer
characters.description: Head of Gotham City's Major Crimes Unit and originally from Star City; Sawyer is a career police officer. Rising through the ranks to become a captain in the Metropolic Special Crimes Unit, Sawyer was eventually promoted to Inspector under Commissioner Dan Turpin following the death ofSuperman.

characters.name: Man-Bat
characters.description: Man-Bat(real nameDr. Robert Kirkland "Kirk" Langstrom) is an enemy toBatman, who first appeared inDetective Comics#400, illustrated byNeal Adams.

characters.name: March_Harriet
characters.description: March Harriet, also known asHarriet Pratt, is a grifter and escort who wears a rabbit themed outfit. Eventually, she was enlisted by Tweedledum and Tweedledee to serve as the March Hare for their new Wonderland Gang.

characters.name: Marion_Grange
characters.description: Former district atttorney Marion Grange was a no-nonsense woman who was considered by many of Gotham's citizens to be a vast improvement over current mayor Armand Krol. She ran against Krol for mayor and Grange was elected after winning Batman's endorsement. She first encounteredBruce Wayneat the party being held atThe Iceberg Loungeto mark the mayoral elections. MadmanCornelius Stirkhad headed for the party and only the timely intervention of Bruce as Batman was able to save the newly elected m...

characters.name: Marnie_Herrs
characters.description: Marnie Herrswas the assistant to Simon LaGrieve and a practicing psychiatrist. She was attracted to the super-villain known as Deadshot.

characters.name: Marque
characters.description: Like Cassandra, Marque was considered more of an experiment than a daughter by Cain, another of his attempts to create the ultimate warrior. She was raised among theLeague of Assassinsand trained intensively in martial arts and assassination techniques. Given her current communication ability, it is likely that she was not raised without speech as Cassandra was. Marque understood early on that she was nothing but a tool to her father and would never have his love. Fueled by resentment, she plann...

characters.name: Mary_Grayson
characters.description: Mary Graysonis a flying trapeze artist, mother toDick Grayson, and wife toJohn Grayson.

characters.name: Matthew_Hagen
characters.description: In original continuity,Matt Hagenwas the second incarnation ofClayface. He was a treasure hunter who happened upon a mysterious pool of chemicals in a cavern underwater, which transformed him into a shape-changing metahuman.

characters.name: Maxine_Gibson
characters.description: Maxine Gibson is the best friend ofTerry McGinnis. She is the smartest person in Terry's High School. Max is a straight "A" student, she is even capable of becoming a valedictorian. When Maxine was running a program on "who Batman was?" She ran a search on height and age. She ran a search on whoJokerzwere on her program also. Terry McGinnis turned out to be at the top of the list. When Max was being terrorized by one of the Jokerz that attended her high school, she found out that Terry was not a...

characters.name: Maxine_Gibson_(DC_Animated_Universe)
characters.description: She was likewise invaluable at helping Terry maintain his "normal" life, including coming up with excuses for his long absences forDana Tan, creating diversions that enabled him to slip away when necessary, keeping him updated on developments at school that he missed out on, or just helping him catch up on his schoolwork. Terry jokingly referred to her as his "Alfred" after she made her own joke about not wanting to be called "Robin". Aside from her intelligence, she was also valuable to him as ...

characters.name: Metahumans
characters.description: The prefix meta-, in this context, simply means "beyond"—as in metastable, which is "beyond regular stability; ready to collapse at the slightest disruption", or metamorphosis, which is "the state of going beyond a single shape". So, as an umbrella term "metahuman" simply describes persons and/or abilities beyond normal human limits although the line can often be blurred (E.G. genetic mutations such as deformities or conditions, technology based abilities, powers through the use of steroids, sur...

characters.name: Midnight
characters.description: April Clarksonwas aGCPDofficer who briefly dated Bruce Wayne and assisted him as Batman in tracking down the criminal known asMidnight, who had begun terrorizing Gotham and gruesomely murdering the city's most corrupt. Bruce developed strong feelings for April and was devastated to eventually discover that she was in fact the deranged murderer all along.

characters.name: Mime
characters.description: Camilla Ortinwas a rich young heiress that once led a life of luxury and art as she led a group of touring mime artists across America. Sadly this ended up bankrupting her an she was left broke. Several years onwards, Camilla had grown to hate loud sounds,and went on a short crime spree, trying to silence Gotham City for good.

characters.name: Mirage_(Miriam_Delgado)
characters.description: Miriam became a resistance fighter against the god-like being known as Lord Chaos. She was captured by Lord Chaos' Force Elite and forced to serve as a spy, exposing members of the underground resistance. "Mirage" rebelled against her masters and helped to liberate a neophyte metahuman named Redwing just moments before she would have fallen into the Force Elite's clutches.

characters.name: Mortimer_Drake
characters.description: Mortimer Drakeis a swashbuckling supervillain who calls himself theCavalier. Drake was once a millionaire who turned to crime when his desire to build a private history museum outstripped his ability to pay for the exhibits, so he stole them. Since then, he has lost his millions and his motivation now is theft for profit. As an enemy of ofBatmanhe uses a rapier as his main weapon and whose trademark is excessive (and often false) gallantry.

characters.name: Mr._Bloom
characters.description: Mister Bloomwas a metahuman criminal introduced as the nemesis ofJim Gordon's incarnation of Batman followingBruce Wayne's supposed death. Mister Bloom is a twisted meta-human who sells black-market, "Seeds" which can grant superpowers with the mission of destroying Gotham so it can be rebuilt from the ashes as a less corrupt society.

characters.name: Mr._Camera
characters.description: Mr. Camerais an enemy of Batman who utilized a camera gimmick.

characters.name: Mrs._Chilton
characters.description: Mrs. Chiltonis the mother ofJoe Chilland was a housekeeper forPhilip Wayne, brother ofThomas Waynewho was murdered by her son. She was also aware that Bruce Wayne becameBatman.

characters.name: Ms._Bambi
characters.description: Ms. Bambiwas a female socialite based inGotham City, who pursuedBruce Wayneas a potential suitor.

characters.name: Nick_Gage
characters.description: Nick Gage was once a member of an organization called the Reapers, who unbeknownst to Gage, was really a gang of supercriminals. When Nick discovered this and attempted to quit, the gang killed his fiance in retaliation. Nick was devastated, and joined the police academy to atone for his misdeeds with the Reapers, and bring their kind to justice.

characters.name: Nightrunner
characters.description: Nightrunneris a well trained athlete in parkour from the Clichy-sous-Bois of Paris. He was recruited byBruce WayneandDick Graysonto be France's representative ofBatman Incorporated.

characters.name: Nightslayer
characters.description: Anton Knightis the son of wealthy mobsterCharles Knight. Anton returned toGotham Cityafter his father died and met his adopted daughter,Natalia Knight. Together they continued the Knight crime ring and terrorized Gotham as the Night-Slasher and Nocturna.

characters.name: Nikandros_Stephanopoulos
characters.description: Nikandros Stephanopoulosis a Greek playboy and was once the proud owner of a red Ferrari before it was stolen byCatwoman.

characters.name: Nocturna_(Natalia_Mitternicht)
characters.description: Nocturna, also known asNatalia Mitternacht, is an inmate of Arkham Asylum. She is dubbed by the media as "Nocturna, The Heartless Black Widow" for her string of alleged murder charges on her husbands. In secret, Nocturna is a vampire as well as a thief and an enemy of Batwoman, who operates primarily in Gotham City.

characters.name: O-Sensei
characters.description: O-Senseiwas a mysterious martial arts master that lived to be over 150 years of age. O-Sensei's primary students includeLady Shiva,Bronze TigerandRichard Dragon. He is someoneTaliafrequently consults and associates with.

characters.name: Olivia_Carr
characters.description: Olivia Carris a young girl abducted by Dollmaker and brainwashed into his family.

characters.name: Owlman
characters.description: Owlmanis an alternate, evil version ofBatmanoften hailing from Earth-3 where all traditional heroes are villains and vice versa.

characters.name: Owlman_(Crisis_on_Two_Earths)
characters.description: Owlmanis the villainous counterpart to Batman from an alternate universe, and a high-ranking member of the Crime Syndicate of America, a villainous counterpart to the Justice League.

characters.name: Owlman_(Thomas_Wayne,_Jr.)
characters.description: OwlmanAKAThomas Wayne, Jr.is the Earth-3 counterpart ofBatman. He is an evil man who uses a vast intelligence, incredible skills and an array of owl-themed gadgets to enforce a reign of terror onGotham City.

characters.name: Patricia_Powell
characters.description: Patricia Powellwas a young police officer in theGotham City Police Departmentwho helpedBatmansolve some crimes and had romantic tension with him. Powell disappeared from the GCPD and their relationship wasnt able to develop any further.

characters.name: Patrick_Wayne
characters.description: His father developed Wayne Chemical, but died at a fairly young age, leaving the fortune to his 37-year-old wife Laura Wayne. Laura was a shrewd businesswoman and heavily involved in the Prohibition movement, while raising their infant son. Patrick inherited the family business upon his mother's death. He was the creator of Wayne Tech, which helped support both World Wars. Later, he would combine the Wayne resources to create Wayne Corp. He worked closely with his brother Silas Wayne.

characters.name: Peter_Pauling
characters.description: Peter Paulingwas a corruptGCPDCommissioner that answered toRupert Thorne.

characters.name: Pinky_Pinkston
characters.description: Pinky Pinkstonis aGotham Citysocialite and owner of thePink Chip Stamp Factory.

characters.name: Poison_Ivy
characters.description: Poison Ivyis the alter ego taken byDr. Pamela Lillian Isley, an eco-terrorist and prominent enemy ofBatman. First appearing inBatman#181, she is depicted as one of the world's most prominent eco-terrorists, motivated by an obsession with plants, misandry, botany, and extremist environmentalism with a desire to save the world from the evils of man through any means necessary. A genius scientist and meta-human with hybridized plant DNA, Poison Ivy uses mutant plants, will-bending pheromones and to...

characters.name: Preston_Payne
characters.description: Preston Paynewas the third incarnation ofClayface. Preston was a scientist at S.T.A.R. Labs who experimented on himself withthe second Clayface's DNA to try and cure his hyperpituitarism, only to transform into an acidic melting creature who needs to stay in a hazmat suit. Preston turned to crime as he needed to drain life-force from others by melting them with his touch, all while being driven insane by his crippling loneliness and isolation from humanity.

characters.name: Prometheus
characters.description: A dark reflection ofBatman,Prometheuswas raised by criminals who were gunned down by policemen right in front of him. Dedicating his life to destroying the law, Prometheus traveled the world and trained in the ways of murder. Clad in an armored suit that maximizes his natural skills, he is a master assassin whose physical and mental abilities rival Batman's own. Currently active as a costumed criminal, Prometheus possesses a pathological need to kill enforcers of the law, whether police officers...

characters.name: Ra%27s_al_Ghul
characters.description: Raʾs al Ġhūlis a supervillain and enemy ofBatman. A former healer who later chose a moniker that translates to "Head of the Demon", he is a criminal mastermind and leader of theLeague of Assassins. In most stories, Ra's' goal is to save the Earth from possible ecological devastation, often by destroying most of the planet's population or bringing the world under his control. Though brilliant master of strategy with knowledge in various fields, Ra's al Ghul's greatest asset are hisLazarus Pits, w...

characters.name: Ra%27s_al_Ghul_(DC_Animated_Movie_Universe)
characters.description: At one point, he consideredSlade Wilsonto become his successor and lead theLeague of Assassins, but until his daughter met and fell in love with Bruce Wayne. Seeing Wayne's skill and determination Ra's focused on making Bruce his new heir which angered Slade who was then kicked out of the League and also Ra's believed he failed the tests he presented to him and had him excommunicated. During his feud with Batman, Talia would then orchestrate a plot which involved drugging Bruce and then raping h...

characters.name: Ra%27s_al_Ghul_(Young_Justice)
characters.description: Ra's al Ghulis the leader of The League of Assassins/Shadows and a member of "The Light".

characters.name: Ragdoll_(Peter_Merkel,_Jr.)
characters.description: RagdollAKAPeter Merkel, Jr.is a triple-jointed contortionist and super-criminal best known for his association with the Secret Six.

characters.name: Red_Hood_(Injustice_Universe)
characters.description: Red Hood, a known anti-hero and former partner of Batman, is a playable character inInjustice 2(2017).He is classified as a Gadget user in the game.

characters.name: Red_Hood_(The_Brave_and_the_Bold)
characters.description: Red Hood appears in the Batman: The Brave and the Bold episode "Deep Cover for Batman!" voiced by Jeff Bennett. This version is a heroic alternative reality version ofJoker. Like the Joker, this Red Hood was disfigured after falling into a chemical vat at the Ace Chemical Plant. In his case, he was already a superhero and was actively dropped in byOwlman. However, his sanity is said to have been "Bent, but not broken." Red Hood then tries to rally his world's heroes (alternate versions of the vi...

characters.name: Rick_Flag_Jr.
characters.description: Captain/Colonel Richard Rogers FlagAKARick FlagorRick Flag, Jr.is a U.S. soldier who serves as a consistent leader of theSuicide SquadunderAmanda Waller.

characters.name: Sarah_Charles
characters.description: Dr. Sarah Charlesis an intern at S.T.A.R. labs and a University of Michigan college student.

characters.name: Sarah_Essen
characters.description: During a chain of events that has come to be known as No Mans Land, theJokershoots Essen in her temple after she saves the babies from his plan to attract the attention of TheBatman(although it's implied shortly thereafter that even the Joker wasn't amused by her death). Devastated by her death, Commissioner Gordon apprehended the Joker by shooting him in the leg.

characters.name: Sasha_Bordeaux
characters.description: Sasha Bordeauxis a former ally of bothBruce Wayneand theBat-Familyshe later became a government agent of Checkmate.

characters.name: Scab
characters.description: Scab was responsible for stealing an experimental aircraft. With his gang, he ran amok inGotham City. He once defaced a holoscreen projector on the elevator and then attempted to mug a woman as "payment" for her "smile." However,Terry McGinniswitnessed this and tried to get him to back off, eventually threatening him. Scab, however despite not taking kindly to the threat, moved out of the elevator when security was boarding, causing Terry to scoff in irritation at the Jokerz gang's acts. He late...

characters.name: Scandal_Savage
characters.description: In the build up to Infinite Crisis,Lex Luthorblackmailed Scandal and five other villains, using the alias Mockingbird, into harassing the Secret Society of Super Villains who were under the leadership of an alternate Lex Luthor. For Scandal, working with the Secret Six was about saving her mother. However, she grew close to her team mates, intimately so with Knockout who was working as a mole within the Society. Knockout broke her cover by aiding Scandal in her fight withTalia. TheSecret Sixwere...

characters.name: Selma_Reesedale
characters.description: Selma Reesedaleis a character created for the DC Animated Universe where she was an officer in theGCPD's special-crimes unit.

characters.name: Siam
characters.description: Siamis the criminal alias of three conjoined triplets who are members ofProfessor Pyg'sCircus of Strange.

characters.name: Simon_Dark
characters.description: Simon Dark is a mysterious new vigilante operating out ofGotham City. He seems to have been created from a number of dead bodies and, as such, has no memory of his past. He exhibits some super-human abilities such as enhanced speed and agility, as well as extraordinary strength. He also states that he remembers everything he reads, which implies he may have a photographic memory. Dark claims he doesn't know where he came from, nor how he came to inhabit Gotham City, but remembers he was smaller ...

characters.name: Slam_Bradley
characters.description: Originally from Cleveland, Ohio, Slam loved to fight and was typically portrayed in the middle of one. His career was originally as a tough private detective. Slam often went undercover, as a teacher, a magician, a prizefighter and even a singer on the radio. His partner was an aggravating, buffoonish man named "Shorty" Morgan. Slam was not too original, he started out a slightly exaggerated version of Race Williams and other hard-boiled pulp detectives. Slam had many notable characteristics suc...

characters.name: Smirk
characters.description: SmirkwasJ-Man's right hand and member of theJokerz.

characters.name: Sondra_Fuller
characters.description: Sondra Fullerwas transformed into a clay shape-changer by the Kobra Cult's technologies, a process she agreed to become a subject for because she hated her own face. She was pitted against the Outsiders with other Kobra-made villains, the Strike Force Kobra. Under her new identity as Clayface Four, Fuller abandoned Kobra and started living other people's lives by adopting their identities. Although this was good enough at first, she grew disatisfied with her lack of personality and started a que...

characters.name: SST
characters.description: Wayne EliotorSSTis a would-be vigilante working on a jet-based suit of armor. Eliot had an altercation withMan-Batwhen Eliot's wife Cara hired Man-Bat to follow her husband and find out why he was spending so much time away from home.

characters.name: Stacy_Baker
characters.description: Dr. Stacy Bakerfirst appeared inBatman: Arkham City. She is a doctor who is part of the Arkham City Medical Team led byAaron Cash.

characters.name: Starman
characters.description: Starmanis a name used by several different fictional DC Comics superheroes, most prominently Ted Knight and his sons David and Jack. Created by writer Gardner Fox and artist Jack Burnley, the original Starman, Ted Knight, first appeared in Adventure Comics #61 (April 1941). An astronomer, Knight invented a “gravity rod,” later reinvented as a “cosmic rod,” allowing him to fly and manipulate energy and donned a red and yellow costume with a distinctive finned helmet. Like most Golden Age heroes, ...

characters.name: Stephanie_Brown
characters.description: Stephanie was born the daughter of theCluemaster, one ofGotham City's third-rate villains. Stephanie's father spent most of her childhood in prison or away from the family, and though he claimed to be "rehabilitated upon his return to Gotham", Stephanie was furious to discover that he was actually returning to crime without his need to leave clues behind. She decided something needed to be done. Stephanie tailored a costume for herself, and called herself the Spoiler. She knew where her father w...

characters.name: Summer_Gleeson_(DC_Comics)
characters.description: Summer Gleesonwas a news reporter and anchor working inGotham City. She is an adaptation ofthe DCAU character of the same name, who first appeared in theBatman: The Animated Seriesepisode "Heart of Ice". Versions of Summer have appeared throughout the DC universe over the years.

characters.name: Talia_al_Ghul_(Arkhamverse)
characters.description: The daughter ofRā's al Ghūl,Talia al Ghūlaided her father in his mission to bring their self-defined perception of peace to the world through the eradication of most of its population. After she was trained to a physical and mental peak by her father, Talia was a true force to be reckoned with and used her brilliant mind to implement and run several legitimate business empires that funded theLeague of Assassins' illegal operations throughout the globe. Despite being the second in command of the ...

characters.name: Terrence_Clark
characters.description: Terrence Clarkis a booking agent and enemy of Nightwing.

characters.name: The_Alstairean
characters.description: The Alstaireanis a plant creature from the planet Alstair, who scouted Earth for his species takeover. He had a brief romance with Poison Ivy.

characters.name: The_Archer
characters.description: The Archerappears in two consecutive episodes of the 1960sBatmantelevision series. Archer is a modern-day Robin Hood who robs from the rich and gives to the poor.

characters.name: The_Architect
characters.description: The ArchitectAKAZachary Gatewas an enemy ofGothamwho tried to destroy all that remained of thefive familieswhich founded the city - the Waynes, the Cobblepots, the Elliots the Crownes, and the Kanes.

characters.name: The_Batman_Who_Laughs
characters.description: The Batman Who Laughsis the villainous alternate version ofBruce Waynefrom Earth-22 in the Dark Multiverse. He is a Batman who murdered theJokeronly to be driven insane and adopt the Joker's sadistic anarcho-nihilistic personality for himself, obsessed with corrupting others into the worst version of themselves. This lead to him massacring the villains, heroes and citizens of his universe to appease his hunger for violence. The most trusted disciple of bothBarbatosand laterPerpetua, he was the l...

characters.name: The_Birthday_Boy
characters.description: Ray Salingerwas a serial killer who operated in Gotham. Under the aliasBirthday Boy, he worked forMayor Cobblepotto eliminate political targets and threats. He was the first costumed criminal encountered byBatmanin his crime-fighting career.

characters.name: The_Bookworm
characters.description: The Bookwormwas a villain created for the1960s Batman television series. The character was identifiable by his thick glasses and dark brown leather suit, made to match rare old book bindings. He had an affinity for books and centered many of his schemes around them.The characterwas first referenced as part of the mainstream Batman comic books in 1989'sSecret Origins Special#1 and appeared, in a form dramatically different from his television counterpart, as an enemy of the Huntress inThe Huntres...

characters.name: The_Bouncer
characters.description: The Bounceris a villain and opponent ofBatman, who wears a self constructed suit of elastalloy that allowes him to bounce from objects to evade capture.

characters.name: The_Broker
characters.description: Sherman Fine, also known asThe Broker,provides hideouts and secret lairs for Gotham City's criminals at a monetary price. He's found places for the Joker, Catwoman, Mad Hatter and others. Unlike other villains, his main enemy is Batman's partner,Robin.

characters.name: The_Carpenter
characters.description: Jenna Duffywas a pickpocket and con artist operating out of Keystone City who moved toGothamwhen she attracted unwanted police attention. Jenna was enlisted byTweedledumandTweedledeeto serve astheCarpenterfor their newWonderland Gang. In addition to being a member of the gang, Jenna used her Carpenter alias to start a solo-career as a contractor for super-criminals for the construction of lairs and death-traps.

characters.name: The_Cat_(Earth-1)
characters.description: Selina Kylewas a professional thief and cat-burglar operating inGotham City. After a fateful encounter withBatman, she would don the identity ofthe Cat, using it to steal from the city's criminals. Whilst investigating a gang war orchestrated by"Harvey Dent", Selina would ally herself with Batman and become one of the first members ofthe Outsiders.

characters.name: The_Crusader
characters.description: The Crusaderis a man who is on and off, either being friends or enemies with Azrael. He kills members of religious cults in re-enactments of the martyrdoms of Christian saints. He claims to have been given power by God.

characters.name: The_Dark_Knights
characters.description: The Dark Knights are villainous versions of Batman who were taken moments before their origin Earths fell into inevitable destruction. During the events ofDark Nights: Metal, theCourt of Owlssummoned them to the Prime Earth after ambushing Batman,Superman, andWonder Woman. They summoned Barbatos and his Dark Knights via turning Batman into a doorway to the Prime universe. However, as the Court of Owls rejoiced at successfully summoning the doorway, they were brutally murdered by the Batman Who L...

characters.name: The_Defacer
characters.description: Shawn Tsang, a criminal formerly known as theDefacer, was an enemy ofBatmanandDick Graysonduring his time as Robin. Defacer and her mentorPigeonwere known as art terrorists due to their attempts to steal and vandalize public statues and icons as a form of protest. The two were captured by the Dynamic Duo and arrested.

characters.name: The_Hyena
characters.description: The Canadian government initiated the Weapon X Project. Logan and Quinn of the RCAF are both accepted as candidates for the project, along with four other "volunteers". Few records of the procedures used survive, fragments of Professor Carter Nichols' notes do mention two scientists by name, Cornelius and Hines. Logan's latent meta-mutant healing power kicks in, which allows him to survive the adamantium-crafting process. Creed survives as well but becomes a remorseless killing machine, exactly ...

characters.name: The_Phantasm_(DC_Animated_Universe)
characters.description: Andrea Beaumont is the daughter of wealthy businessman Carl Beaumont and his deceased wife, Victoria. In her youth, while attending Gotham University, she meetsBruce Wayne. When Andrea meets him again at Bruce's house, she defeats him in a small sparring session. Her victory over Bruce is short-lived when Bruce knocks Andrea to the floor and he pins her down. It was at this moment, that she fell in love with Bruce. He is internally conflicted by his desire to lead a normal life with Andrea and k...

characters.name: The_Reaper
characters.description: The Reaperis an identity taken on by various enemies ofBatman. First appearing inBatman#237(December, 1971), the moniker is heavily inspired by theGrim Reaper, a personification of Death. Most incarnations are heavily associated with murderous vigilantism and make use of weaponized scythes. The most famous incarnation isJudson Caspian, who featured in the 1987 storylineBatman: Year Two.

characters.name: The_Shadow
characters.description: The Shadowis a mysterious crimefighter that strikes fear into the hearts of men. UnlikeBatman, he relies on a network of agents all over the world and uses firearms.

characters.name: Three_Face
characters.description: Evelyn has three personalities: Irrational, Practical, and Hedonistic. She wears a costume that is divided in three parts. Her right side favors loud fabrics like polka-dots, stripes, or plaids; her left side favors animal prints like tiger or leopard; and the center is a wide stripe of green. She even wears a leather jacket that is a brown bomber jacket on the right and a black biker jacket on the left. Her face is painted all white with a vertical green center stripe and dark green or black li...

characters.name: Tiffany_Fox
characters.description: Tiffany Foxis one of the daughters ofLucius Fox. In pre-Crisiscontinuities, she is the Fox's eldest child and an employee ofWayne Enterprises. However, in post-Flashpointstories, she is the youngest in the family. Tiffany has primarily served as a minor character in several, though served as a major character in the short-livedI Am Batmancomic seriesas a supporting character toJace Fox. Several versions of Tiffany have also acted as vigilantes and possibleBatgirlmantle holders.

characters.name: Tiffany_Fox_(Telltale)
characters.description: Tiffany Foxis the eldest child ofLucius Foxwho was also a friend ofBruce Wayne. After joiningWayne Enterprisesto become closer to their line of work, she tragically lost her father to an attack orchestrated bythe Riddler. Following this, she became involved with eitherAmanda Waller'sAgencyor Batman's war on crime.

characters.name: Tim_Drake
characters.description: Timothy "Tim" Jackson Drakeis a crimefighter that works withBatman. As the thirdRobinin theBatmancomics, he served asBatman's sidekick, and he is a superhero in his own right. He currently uses the superhero identity ofRed Robin.

characters.name: Tim_Drake_(DC_Animated_Universe)
characters.description: During one night of working solo, Tim came to the aid of a young girl with amnesia, whom he namedAnnie. He developed a bit of a crush on the girl, who seemed to be living in constant fear of an unknown assailant. She later proved to be a lost creation ofClayface, who had created her in order to scout out Gotham for his inevitable return. Unfortunately the girl had 'forgotten' her purpose and continued to run. When Clayface reabsorbed the girl, Tim took her 'murder' very hard and almost killed Cl...

characters.name: Tim_Drake_(Titans_Tomorrow)
characters.description: This version ofTim Drakehails from an alternate future reality where as an adult he took on the mantle of the Batman - something that his younger counterpart swore he would never become. This alternate timeline branched from the regular New Earth timeline shortly following an adventure wherein the Teen Titans traveled to the 31st Century to assist the Legion of Super-Heroes against the Fatal Five-Hundred. While trying to return home, they accidentally arrived at a point in time ten years into th...

characters.name: Trevor_Cahill
characters.description: Trevor Cahill is a neurochemical researcher from Gotham City. He's one of many sources of Starling and helped her and Black Canry with their first case as the Birds of Prey.

characters.name: Trey
characters.description: He was one of many Jokerz gathered in their hideout whenBatmanandTenraided it in the belief that her family was abducted by them.

characters.name: Vesper_Fairchild
characters.description: Vesper Fairchildis a TV and Radio personality who became romantically involved with billionaire playboy Bruce Wayne. She disappeared from Gotham City during the events of No Man's Land, but would rekindle their relationship after the City's reparation. She was eventually killed byDavid Cain.

characters.name: Vicki_Vale
characters.description: Vicki Valeis a photojournalist inGotham City. Vale has been known to have romantic interest inBatman.

characters.name: Victoria_October
characters.description: Dr. Victoria Octoberis a scientific genius scientist, ally of theBat-Family.

characters.name: Whisper_A%27Daire
characters.description: Formerly an agent for the lateRa's al Ghul, Ra's gave Whisper a serum that grants her immortality and the ability to shape-shift. Partnered withKyle Abbot, officially her bodyguard, she is a snake lady, and Kyle himself a wolf man. WhenBatmantries to free her from the immortal mastermind, Whisper refuses his Batman and Batwoman foes help and disappears.

characters.name: Willy_Hank_Stamper
characters.description: Willy Hank Stamperis a mugger that tried to robThomas Wayneand his wifeMarthain front of their son beforeJoe Chill. The difference being thatthe Shadowwas able to intervene and stop it.

characters.name: Condiment_King
characters.description: The Condiment Kingis a joke villain created byBruce TimmandPaul Dinifor theBatman: The Animated Series, as a parody of the campy super-villains who Batman fought in the Silver Age of comics and 1966Batman series. He is a petty criminal who makes use of various condiments, sometimes capable of causing anaphylactic shock, as his weapons. He is generally used as comic relief within the series. His original origin was that of a stand-up comedian who angeredthe Jokerwho kidnapped and brainwashed him ...

characters.name: Copperhead
characters.description: Copperheadis a human/snake hybrid and mercenary enemy ofBatman.

characters.name: Copperhead_(Arkhamverse)
characters.description: Before she appeared in Gotham, Copperhead was already famous throughout most of South America for her skills as an escape artist, after having successfully broken out of fourteen different prisons. She also had tattoos that suggested a connection to a Central American gang. By the time she took the hit on Batman, Copperhead had two outstanding warrants in murder of the first degree and one outstanding warrant in theft.

characters.name: Copperhead_(DC_Animated_Universe)
characters.description: Copperheadwas a supervillain for hire that had a snake-like costume and attributes. A nameless villain with an even more mysterious past, he is known only as a master thief and assassin. His snake suit compliments his contortionist abilities but the forked tongue and reptilian eyes suggest a mutation or genetic enhancing. Copperhead can also administer a fatal venom via his suit's fangs.

characters.name: Copperhead_(Dozierverse)
characters.description: Copperheadwas a villain and enemy ofBatmanandRobin. He only appears inBatman '66.

characters.name: Copperhead_(II)
characters.description: The second incarnation ofCopperheadis an enemy ofBatmanandthe Flash. She is a snake themed assassin with a heavy usage of venom. This iteration of the character is an adaptation ofCopperheadseen in the video gameBatman: Arkham Origins.

characters.name: Cormorant
characters.description: Cormorantwas an assassin for hire. He was killed by the vigilanteSlash, but not because he was a killer; Slash killed Cormorant because he beat his wife.

characters.name: Count_Vertigo
characters.description: Count Werner Vertigo of Vlatava(or simplyWerner Zytlein Prime Earth continuity) is a DC universe villain mainly portrayed as an enemy toBlack CanaryandGreen Arrowbut has foughtBatmanas-well.

characters.name: Count_Vertigo_(DC_Animated_Universe)
characters.description: When Wayne Enterprises was transferring a new type of sonic drill toGotham City, an outside threat began using vertigo-based powers to cause mental hallucinations (the "Vertigo Effect") among the members of theGotham City Police Departmentand Wayne Enterprises executiveLucius Fox. Batman later discovered the threat to be Vertigo, who planned to utilize the drill for his own personal monetary gain. Batman enlisted Talia al Ghul to help subdue Vertigo at his castle, but the attempt was slowed by t...

characters.name: The_Phantasm
characters.description: The Phantasmis a murderous vigilante and former love-interest ofBatman. Once the romantic partner of Bruce Wayne,Andrea Beaumontbecame a murderous vigilante after her father's death at the hands of criminals. Under this alias, she became an enemy of both Batman andCatwoman.

characters.name: The_Reaper_(Judson_Caspian)
characters.description: Judson Caspianwas the second known incarnation ofthe Reaper. A socialite who'd lost his wife during an attempted robbery, he prowledGothamtwenty years beforeBatman's crusade. Caspian would return to vigilantism during Batman's second year, later dying during a confrontation with the Dark Knight. His daughterRachelwas also romantically involved with Bruce Wayne, whilst his sonJulianwould later become a successor to the mantle.

characters.name: Three_Ghosts_of_Batman
characters.description: The Three Ghosts of Batmanis the fan-name given to a group of super-villains themed afterBatman. The three are known respectively asJosef MullerAKABat-Cop,BrancaAKABat-Bane, andMichael Washington LaneAKA theBat-Devil.

characters.name: Jason_Todd
characters.description: Though originally popular, following a revamping of his origin by Max Allan Collins, the Jason Todd version of Robin was not well received by fans. For 1988'sBatman: A Death in the Familystory-line, DC Comics held a telephone poll to determine whether or not the character would die at the hands of theJoker, Batman's arch-nemesis. The character was killed off by a vote of 5343–5271. Subsequent Batman stories dealt with Batman's guilt over not being able to prevent Jason's death. However, in 2005'...

characters.name: White_Knight_(Lewis_Bayard)
characters.description: LewisBayardAKAWhite Knightis an extremist vigilante adversary ofBatmanwith an angelic/falsely benevolent gimmick. He is the son of a guard fromArkham Asylumwho was murdered by inmateDoctor Phosphorus, leading Lewis to desire mass-murdering the asylum's inmates and corrupt-staff along with their entire bloodlines.

characters.name: Wrath
characters.description: The Wrathis an anti-Batman whose criminal parents are killed by then-rookie policemanJames Gordon. As an adult, the Wrath becomes a cop-killer who copies many ofBatman's methods. He perishes in his first appearance. Wrath in appearance and story is an anti-Batman, he is essentially Batman without any preconception of morality or true justice. Unlike Batman, Wrath has no qualms with the use of firearms and murders his victims.

characters.name: Wrath_(Elliot_Caldwell)
characters.description: The originalWrathwas an anti-Batman whose criminal parents were killed by then-rookie policemanJames Gordon. As an adult, the Wrath becomes a cop-killer who copies many ofBatman's methods. His sidekick, a twisted version ofRobin, later took on the mantle of the second Wrath.

characters.name: Wrath_(Matsudaverse)
characters.description: William Mallory'sparents had been jewel thieves who were sent to jail around the same time thatBruce Wayne's parents were murdered. Since then, Will and his younger brother Andy had lived off their family inheritance. They become friends with Wayne and his wardDick Grayson. Resenting the Batman's targeting criminals like their parents "just trying to earn a living," they became Wrath andScorn, an evil analogue of the Bat-team to aid Gotham's villain community. They first appeared to prevent Batm...

characters.name: Arnold_Wesker
characters.description: Arnold Weskeris a ventriloquist with multiple personalities. His puppet is a gangster namedScarface. Under the puppet's psychological influence, Wesker is a dangerous and ruthless criminal and crime boss. It has been implied that the Ventriloquist suffers from multiple personality disorder. Wesker was originally a timid orphan whose deep repression erupted into a barroom brawl, resulting in him being sent to Blackgate Prison. There, he encountered the ventriloquist dummy Scarface and promptly mu...

characters.name: Bane_(Telltale)
characters.description: Baneis a former prisoner ofPeña Durowho escaped thanks to the efforts ofthe Riddler, and became a member ofthe Pact, a group of the world's most dangerous criminals. Bane also synthesized a super-steroid calledVenom, which increased his strength drastically and allowed him to perform seemingly impossible feats. WhenBruce Waynejoined the Pact, Bane remained cautious of the billionaire and his motives.

characters.name: The_Cat_(Nolanverse)
characters.description: Selina Kyle, also known asThe Cat, is a world-class cat burglar and mistress of disguise. Cunning, devious, and cynical, she targeted Gotham's wealthiest in her schemes. However, Selina was secretly in search of a fresh start in life. She was portrayed byAnne HathawayinThe Dark Knight Rises.

characters.name: Deadshot
characters.description: Floyd Lawton, better known asDeadshot, is mercenary, and known to be the world's greatest marksman and one the most lethal assassins in the world. Lawton has created an armored suit that aids him in his battles againstBatman. Deadshot has had a longstanding rivalry withDeathstroke.

characters.name: Derrick_Coe
characters.description: Derrick Coeis the thirdBlack Spider, who was hired by theCalculatorto tortureSavant, a member of theBirds of Prey. He tends to use the latest in high tech weaponry such as laser assisted rifles. He is an Olympic level athlete and has trained intensely in many forms of physical combat.

characters.name: Echo
characters.description: For a time before joining Riddler as Echo,Nina Damfinoworked atPandora's Box, an underground fetish club. Soon, she met female bikerDiedre Vance. The duo started working together, robbing convenience stores. One night, they stumbled upon The Riddler, who was also at a low point in his criminal career. He immediately hired them on the spot and named them Echo and Query.

characters.name: Electrocutioner
characters.description: Lester Buchinsky, aka theElectrocutioner, is a minor villain of theBatmanandNightwing.

characters.name: Emperor_Blackgate
characters.description: Ignatius Ogilvyalso known asEmperor Blackgateand formerly theEmperor Penguinis the prison-king ofBlackgate Penitentiaryand a once powerful Gotham crime-lord.

characters.name: Alberto_Falcone
characters.description: Throughout the events of "Batman: The Long Halloween", variousGotham Citycriminals were murdered by a mysterious serial killer known only asHoliday. At first the murdered criminals were connected to Falcone. "The Irish," a gang of Irish hitmen for hire, were all put under the payroll of Falcone to kill then District-AttorneyHarvey Dentby blowing up his house.
