Later, on Thanksgiving, they were all murdered in a hotel banquet room as they sat down to eat Thanksgiving dinner. By Christmas,Milos Gra...

characters.name: Sofia_Falcone
characters.description: Sofia Falconeis the daughter ofCarmine Falconeand a member of theFalcone Crime Family. She served as one of her father's main enforcers duringBatman's investigations. After Carmine was murdered byTwo-Face, Sofia took control of the Falcone Crime Family, though found herself in contention with new "freaks" inGotham City. In secret, she was operating as the serial killerHangman, targeting people who'd contributed to Harvey Dent's prosition as District Attorney.

characters.name: Firebug
characters.description: Firebugfirst appeared inBatman #318(December 1979). Joe Rigger was a soldier and demolitions expert who returned toGotham Citywhen his family had been killed in three separate building-related accidents. His sanity slipping, Rigger vowed that those buildings would not kill again. Using his military training and a costume containing tanks of napalm, he became the Firebug and set out to burn all three buildings to the ground. He was defeated by theBatmanatop the towering Gotham State Building, and...

characters.name: Firefly
characters.description: Fireflyis a pyromaniacal serial-arsonist and recurring enemy ofBatman. Originally a pyrotechnics expert,Garfield Lynnsturned to crime by carrying out arson attacks and torching huge parts of Gotham in the process. True to his name, Firefly was originally conceived as a light-based enemy of Batman and Robin. However, the modern incarnations are depicted as fire-based, often using gadgets and weapons with pyrotechnical means. Firefly is rarely seen withouta suit capable of protecting him from heat...

characters.name: Fox
characters.description: FoxorFiskwas the alias of Warren Lawford, member of theTerrible Trio. He wore the mask of a fox head.

characters.name: Gaggy
characters.description: Gaggy, also known asGagsworth A. Gagsworthy, wasJoker's original sidekick. After their separation, the Joker got a new sidekick,Harley Quinn, and turned Joker from the Clown Prince of Crime, that he knew, to another psychopath.

characters.name: Gearhead
characters.description: Gearhead, real nameNathan Finchis a cyborg enemy ofBatman. He is best known for having his body hardwired into large mechanical vehicles.

characters.name: Ginty
characters.description: Gintywas an inmate ofBlackgate Prison. He had many tattoos, both inked, and scarified. This man, who towered physically over most of his fellow prisoners, made a decision that was crucial to the outcome.

characters.name: Great_White_Shark
characters.description: Formerly crooked investor Warren "The Great White Shark" White, avoided prison time by pleading insanity and was sentenced to Arkham Asylum. There, among other indignities and tortures, White later attempted to get transferred to a minimum security prison. However, Dr. Anne Carver was revealed to have been killed and replaced byJane Doesome months earlier. Her boss, Dr.Jeremiah Arkhamorders that all the paperwork concerning White's transfer be destroyed in revenge for White robbing Arkham of his...

characters.name: Hypnotic
characters.description: Hypnoticis an upstart criminal underThe Penguin's guidance.

characters.name: Joe_Chill
characters.description: Joseph Chiltonis a common thug inGotham City, infamous for murdering youngBruce Wayne's parents at the behest of mobsterLew Moxon.

characters.name: Johnny_LaMonica
characters.description: LaMonica was hired to kill the crimelordBlack Mask, and donned an appropriately strange mask with his biker gear in order to join his gang, calling himself Black Spider (Coincidentally the alias of another villain,Eric Needham, the original Black Spider). He was intercepted twice byBatman, once when he attempted to kill a guest at a costumed ball at Wayne Manor, and once when he tried to kill Black Mask. Infiltrating theFalse Facersto murder Black Mask, the assassination attempt failed terribly ...

characters.name: Joker
characters.description: The Jokeris a supervillain and the archenemy ofBatman. First introduced inBatman#1(Spring 1940), he was originally a criminal mastermind with a devious sense of humor. Initially intended to serve as a one-time appearances, Joker's instant popularity ensured that the character would continue to appear, becoming a frequent enemy of the Dark Knight andRobin, the Boy Wonder. By the late 1940s, Joker had been reimagined as a harmless prankster. Falling into obscurity by the 1960s, he was re-introduce...

characters.name: Killer_Croc
characters.description: Waylon Jones, also known asKiller Croc, is an alligator-wrestler and sideshow-freak turnedGotham Citymobster, sewer-dwelling super-criminal and enemy ofBatman. He is motivated due to having been born with a rare mutation that caused him to have reptile-like skin, leading to a lifetime of abuse and prejudice which drove him to madness.

characters.name: Lynx
characters.description: Lynx was seen as Billy Hue's girlfriend, leader of the Parisian branch of the Golden Dragons, a Chinese youth gang with members from Macau, Kowloon, and Hong Kong that served the ruthless King Snake. King Snake, was a British businessman and criminal. Robin (Tim Drake), met Lynx in Paris and was amazed by her beauty. Billy Hue later on failed to kill Clyde Rawlins, an American interfering in King Snake’s affairs, due to Robin's interference. King Snake killed Hue as punishment, and Ling was give...

characters.name: Mad_Hatter
characters.description: Obsessed from a young age with Lewis Carroll'sAlice in Wonderland,Jervis Tetch, a brilliant neuroscientist, embraced a delusion that he was the incarnation of a character in the story, theMad Hatter. Using his hypnotic skills for mesmerism, Tetch as the Mad Hatter has committed many crimes, often themed around the book that inspired him and his love of hats and headgear, going so far as to plant his hats, ranging from pith helmets to bowlers, with mind control chips to amplify his hypnosis skill...

characters.name: Sal_Maroni
characters.description: Maroni's first and only Pre-crisis appearance was inDetective Comics #66(Aug. 1942) as "Boss" Moroni, a mobster on trial for the murder of a man named "Bookie" Benson. Harvey Dent, (who was named Harvey Kent in his first appearance and Pre-Crisis on Infinite Earths remained the identity of the first Earth-Two Two-Face), was the prosecutor at the trial. He calledBatmanas his first witness. During Batman's testimony Maroni called Batman a liar, leading Dent to show his proof, Maroni's lucky two-he...

characters.name: Mirror_Man
characters.description: TheMirror Manis a criminal scientist who uses mirrors in his crimes, in a fashion similar to the Mirror Master. He often tries to exposeBatman's secret identity.

characters.name: Mortimer_Kadaver
characters.description: Mortimer Kadaveris a criminal with an obsessed with torture and death. He has foughtBatmanon many occasions.

characters.name: Lew_Moxon
characters.description: Lewis "Lew" Moxonis is a crime boss most famous for hiringJoe Chillto murder young Bruce Wayne's parents, thus making him directly responsible for Batman's existence. His primary front company isMoxon Sky-Hi Advertising.

characters.name: Mr._Combustible
characters.description: Mr. Cobustibleis an upstart criminal underThe Penguin's guidance.

characters.name: Mr._Freeze
characters.description: Dr. Victor Fries(Pronounced "freeze") was an accomplished cryogenicist whose beloved wifeNorawas stricken with a fatal degenerative disease. Fries placed her in suspended animation while searching for a way to cure her. ButGothCorp's CEOFerris Boylestopped funding the research—and Nora's life—and pulled the plug, triggering an accident that transformed Fries' body into a cold-blooded form that must always be kept at sub-zero temperatures; at normal room temperature he will die.

characters.name: Orca
characters.description: Dr. Grace BalinAKAOrcais a human/orca hybrid and mad scientist enemy ofBatman.

characters.name: The_Penguin
characters.description: The Penguin(Oswald Chesterfield Cobblepot) is aGotham Citysupervillain and an enemy ofBatman. Co-created by artistBob Kaneand writerBill Finger, he first appeared inDetective Comics#58(December 1941). One of Batman's oldest foes, the Penguin is often presented as a gentleman of crime, often developing elaborate schemes whilst presenting himself as innocent of many of his activities. An eccentric criminal mastermind, he is well-known for his love of ornithology and use oftechnology-fitted umbrell...

characters.name: The_Penguin_(Telltale)
characters.description: Oswald Cobblepotis a member of one of Gotham's influential families who was forced into a life of crime asThe Penguindue to the manipulations ofThomas Wayneand his allies. Seeking vengeance, Penguin joined the terrorist organizationChildren of Arkhamand would become a key player in their schemes against Gotham's elite.

characters.name: Philip_Reardon
characters.description: Philip Reardonis a former Vietnam War veteran and security guard who is blinded in a warehouse explosion that burns his retinas. An underworld doctor namedEngstromreconnects them to his fingers. While fighting Batman he was known asThree-Eye Reardonand laterTen-Eyed Manwhen he became aMan-Batvillain. Reardon blamesBatmanfor his blindness. He was killed during the Crisis on Infinite Earths.

characters.name: Polka-Dot_Man
characters.description: Abner KrillAKAPolka-Dot ManorMister Polka-Dot, was a minor supervillain who foughtBatmanandRobinearly in their careers. He became known for committing grandiose crimes revolving around a bizarre theme of polka dots. The spotted pattern on the Polka-Dot Man's gimmicked costume also concealed a variety of hidden weapons.

characters.name: Professor_Hugo
characters.description: Professor Arnold Hugois an enemy ofBatmanandMartian Manhunter.

characters.name: Punchline
characters.description: Punchlineis a supervillain introduced in DC Rebirth. Created as the henchwoman tothe Jokerfollowing his falling out withHarley Quinn, she serves as his underboss and partner in crime to the Clown Prince of Crime. Unlike Harley Quinn, Punchline is a very cold and sadistic character.

characters.name: Query
characters.description: Querywas an assistant to theRiddler. The costumes she wears are leotard-like clothings with black net stockings and a big question mark logo over the chest. Her suits are either green, like that of the Riddler, or purple to contrast with it.

characters.name: Harley_Quinn_(Telltale)
characters.description: Harley Quinnis a masked criminal and a member ofthe Pact, her true identity wasDr. Harleen Quinzel, a former psychiatrist atArkham Asylumand Blackgate Penitentiary. Whilst working with the group to retrieve a biological weapon, she became the one-sided crush of former patient"John Doe"and an associate ofBruce Wayne. Quinn would later betray the Pact and become one of the factors for John's transformation into the Joker.

characters.name: Ratcatcher
characters.description: While the small furry army at his control is, at first glance, a rather odd and seemingly useless gift, The Ratcatcher has used his minions to plague Gotham on more than one occasion. Imagine, if you will, a single rat. Small, weak, but strangely intelligent (just like Flannegan, who possesses an odd similarity in look to the small creatures.) But, imagine multiplying this single biting rodent by tens of thousands; a seemingly unstoppable sea of rats able to attack on a near biblical scale, all ...

characters.name: Razor
characters.description: He was an inmate of Blackgate Prison, and was shipped to Arkham after a mysterious fire at Blackgate. Razor is first seen when the prisoners lockAaron Cashand a doctor in a Joker-gas infected room. One of them mentions that Razor is still in there. Joker remarks, "He was too slow." When Batman goes up through the ventilation system and enters the room flooded with gas, he sees an inmate, presumably Razor, struggling on a line. Batman is forced to cut Razor down to get to the control panel. Razor...

characters.name: Rex_Calabrese
characters.description: Rex "The Lion" Calabreseis a lion themedGotham Citymobster created for the New 52. Calabrese was retconned into being the biological crime-lord father ofCatwoman, a position most traditionally and more popularly held byCarmine "The Roman" Falcone.

characters.name: Rhino_and_Mugsy
characters.description: The Ventriloquist is most accompanied by Rhino who serves as a loyal bodyguard. Rhino is sometimes portrayed as genuinely believing Scarface to be the boss, but more often is shown as humoring Wesker (and sometimes forgetting and addressing the Ventriloquist directly, to Scarface's outrage). Rhino, as his name implies, is a massive, musclebound thug. His real name has been referred to as Frederick Rhino. Rhino also has a sister named Moose, who nearly as strong and loyal as he is. She takes his ...

characters.name: The_Riddler
characters.description: The Riddleris a criminal themed around riddles, puzzles and games, and frequent enemy ofBatman. Co-created byBill FingerandDick SprangforDetective Comics#140(October 1948),Edward "E." Nigma(sometimesNygmaandNashton), he themes his crimes around these, even leaving clues for Batman and thepoliceto solve hinting to his plans. Whilst not as physically capable as other enemies in the rogues gallery, Riddler is often considered one of Batman's most intelligent foes and has even manipulated others int...

characters.name: Roland_Desmond
characters.description: Roland Desmondis the secondBlockbuster, the first having been his brotherMark. He is a drug-enhanced behemoth, one of the reigning crime-lords ofBlüdhaven, and a major enemy ofNightwing.

characters.name: Sewer_King_(DC_Comics)
characters.description: The Sewer Kingis a villain originally created byTom Rueggeras a minor foe forBatman. He is a staff-carrying, sewer-dwelling villain with an army of runaway children he uses as pick-pockets.

characters.name: Shark
characters.description: SharkorSherman Shackleywas the alias ofGunther Hardwicke, member of theTerrible Trio. He wore the mask of a shark's head.

characters.name: She-Bat
characters.description: A few months later, the Langstroms traveled to Las Vegas, Nevada to study a rare breed of vampire bat that had surfaced following underground nuclear tests in New Mexico. While examining one of the bats, Francine pricked her finger on a fang and the toxin activated the dormant Man-Bat gene that still resided in her body. She transformed into a monster once again, but this time with more vampiric characteristics, including enhanced strength. In this iteration, Francine could only transform into a...

characters.name: Sin_Tzu
characters.description: Sin Tzuwas a master criminal obsessed with conquering seemingly unbeatable adversaries.

characters.name: Spook
characters.description: Val Kalibanis one of the world's greatest escape-artists, and uses his extraordinary abilities together with special effects to commit spectacular crimes and make people believe he was a real ghost. After several battles withBatman, he is defeated and beheaded byDamian Wayne.

characters.name: Steeljacket
characters.description: Steeljacketis an enemy ofBatmanwho is a human/bird hybrid.

characters.name: Tally_Man
characters.description: Tally-Manis a hit-man/mercenary inGotham Citywho themes himself around old-fashioned tax collectors and who was obsessed with murdering those who owed debts to others.

characters.name: Tally_Man_II
characters.description: TallymanII appears at the end ofDetective Comics#817as a new character apart of the "One Year Later" storyline. DuringBatman: Face the Face, he defeats several villains in thePenguin's employ (includingKGBeast,Magpie, the Ventriloquist, andOrca). Tally Man II even shows up at the Orca's household to finish off her husband, Terry Capshaw, who is being questioned by criminal-investigatorJason Bardat the time. Tallyman II then fires at Jason Bard's arm as he is reaching for his gun. While holding J...

characters.name: Terrible_Trio
characters.description: TheTerrible Triowas a team of three thieves who wore head covering masks that represented three different animals. They first appeared inDetective Comics#253(March, 1958).

characters.name: The_Getaway_Genius
characters.description: Roy Reynolds, a.k.a. "the Getaway Genius", is a criminal and getaway mastermind who encounters theBatmanseveral times. He first appeared inBatman#170 (March, 1965): "Genius of the Getaway Gimmicks!"

characters.name: Rupert_Thorne
characters.description: Prominent head of one ofGotham City's top smuggling gangs,Rupert Thorneis also the boss ofMatches Malone, the criminal whose identity was taken over byBatman. Rupert is portrayed as a prolific crime-lord, corrupt city councilman, and leader of Gotham's exclusiveTobacconists' Club.

characters.name: Trigger_Twins
characters.description: A blonde, female criminal rescues them from a chain gang. She fools them into believing she is their long lost sister; this is a ruse to ensure their help in her plans.Robinand many other heroes, including Pow Wow Smith and Nighthawk help take them down. Much of the action takes place in a recreation of a classic wild west town/Gotham City tourist attraction inRobin Annual #6(1997). Around this time, they are hired byRoland Desmond, operating out of the city ofBlüdhaven.

characters.name: Tweedledee
characters.description: Deever TweedAKATweedledeeis one half of the villain duoTweedledeeandTweedledum. They are ruthless gangsters and supervillains that appear as enemies ofBatman.

characters.name: Tweedledum
characters.description: Dumfree TweedAKATweedledumis one half of the villain duoTweedledeeand Tweedledum. The two are ruthless gangsters and supervillains that appear as enemies of Batman.

characters.name: Two-Face_(Telltale)
characters.description: Harvey Dentis a former District Attorney and friend ofBruce Waynewho ran for Mayor ofGothamagainstHamilton Hill. However, after being injected with a psychoactive chemical by theChildren of Arkham(and possibly disfigured), he lost control of his sanity and developed a second personality. Now dubbedTwo-Faceby the media, he became obsessed with fate, chance and cruel justice.

characters.name: Raya_Vestri
characters.description: Raya is an old friend ofDick Graysonfrom his childhood atHaly's Circus. The two seemed to share a mutual crush, but parted ways after the murder of Dick's parents and adoption byBruce Wayne. After the circus returns toGotham City, Raya is reunited with her childhood friend.

characters.name: Victor_Zsasz
characters.description: Victor Zsasz(referred to asZsaszorMr. Zsasz) is a prolific serial killer and an enemy ofBatman. Zsasz is a difficult killer to track as he has no modus operandi outside of posing his victims' corpses in lifelike poses, and carving a tally-mark into his flesh for each kill. Zsasz is motivated by believing all life to be meaningless cycles of pain and that he is actually saving his victims from having to live on.

characters.name: Vulture
characters.description: VultureorVolperwas the alias of Armand Lydecker, member of theTerrible Trio. He wore the mask of a vulture's head.

characters.name: White_Rabbit
characters.description: Jaina HudsonAKAWhite Rabbitis anAlice in Wonderlandthemed enemy ofBatmanwho is an Indian socialite with the super-power to duplicate herself as an albino criminal who has enhanced speed and dresses like aplayboy-bunny.

characters.name: Maxie_Zeus
characters.description: A deranged gang leader,Maximilian "Maxie" Zeuscame to believe himself an avatar of the Olympian god Zeus. Creating a cult-like gang of henchmen to do his bidding, Zeus became a power-player in the Gotham City underworld. His criminal activities are perpetrated by his army of followers, and—he believes—overseen by the ancient Greek gods themselves.

characters.name: Tony_Zucco
characters.description: Anthony "Tony" Zuccois a fictional character in the DC Comics universe. He was introduced in Detective Comics #38 (April 1940) and is most well known for his connections to the origin ofRobin, namely in killingDick Grayson's parents theFlying Graysons.

characters.name: Batman
characters.description: Batmanis a crimefighter operating inGotham City, he serves as its protector, using the symbol of abatto strike fear into the hearts of criminals. Unlike other superheroes, Batman is often depicted to lack any "superpowers", instead using lifelong training and equipment to fight crime. His secret identity isBruce Wayne, a rich playboy and philanthropist who swore to fight crime after witnessing his parents' brutal murder. He has served as a member of various teams, including theJustice League, th...

characters.name: Nightwing
characters.description: Nightwingis aBatman-inspired superhero/vigilante alias in the DC universe which is most-notably used byDick Grayson, the patron-vigilante ofBlüdhavenand the originalRobin. The nameNightwingis inspired bySuperman'sstories.

characters.name: Robin_(Dick_Grayson)
characters.description: The youngest in a family of acrobats known as the "Flying Graysons," Dick watched as a mafia boss killed his parents in order to extort money from the circus that employed them (whose name was later revealed to beTony Zucco). Bruce Wayne, secretly the vigilante Batman, took him in as his legal ward after witnessing their deaths, and eventually as his sidekick,Robin.

characters.name: Robin_(Tim_Drake)
characters.description: Timothy "Tim" Jackson Drakeis a crimefighter that works withBatman. As the thirdRobinin theBatmancomics, he served asBatman's sidekick, and he is a superhero in his own right. He currently uses the superhero identity ofRed Robin.

characters.name: Robin_(Damian_Wayne)
characters.description: Damian Wayneis the only biological son ofBruce WayneandTalia, the only grandson ofRa's al Ghul. The character was created by Mike W. Barr, and first appeared inBatman: Son of the Demon(1987).

characters.name: Red_Hood
characters.description: The Red Hoodis an alias assumed by several criminals in the Batman Mythos. While rarely having a consistent modus operandi between incarnations, the figure is often leader (or figurehead) of theRed Hood Gang.

characters.name: Red_Robin
characters.description: Timothy "Tim" Jackson Drakeis a crimefighter that works withBatman. As the thirdRobinin theBatmancomics, he served asBatman's sidekick, and he is a superhero in his own right. He currently uses the superhero identity ofRed Robin.

characters.name: Batgirl_(Cassandra_Cain)
characters.description: Cassandra Cainis a member of theBat-Familyas a protégé and adoptive daughter of Batman. The daughter of assassinsDavid CainandLady Shiva, she was raised to become the greatest weapon for theLeague of Assassins. However, horrified from her first killing, she fled to the Batman family for protection. Becoming the fourth claimant of theBatgirlidentity, she helped him andTim Drakeprotect Gotham. Cassandra has also used other identities, includingBlack BatandOrphan.

characters.name: Batgirl_(Stephanie_Brown)
characters.description: Stephanie was born the daughter of theCluemaster, one ofGotham City's third-rate villains. Stephanie's father spent most of her childhood in prison or away from the family, and though he claimed to be "rehabilitated upon his return to Gotham", Stephanie was furious to discover that he was actually returning to crime without his need to leave clues behind. She decided something needed to be done. Stephanie tailored a costume for herself, and called herself the Spoiler. She knew where her father w...

characters.name: Batwoman
characters.description: Batwomanis the name of several superheroines, usually mysterious, but love-interests of Batman. The mainstream version is Kate Kane and the Pre-Crisis version is Kathy Kane, on Earth 11, she is the reverse-gender counterpart ofBatmanhimself, inJLA: The Nail,Selina Kyle, takes the name afterBatgirlandRobinwere killed by theJoker. Different versions of the character appear in other media, however, Kate Kane, as Batwoman, appears inDC Universe Online.

characters.name: Kate_Kane
characters.description: Katherine "Kate" Kaneis the secondBatwoman. Debuting in52#11, she is a member of the Kane family and, throughher father, the cousin ofBruce Wayne. Batwoman has headlinedher own comic seriessince 2011 and served as a vital member of theBat-Family.

characters.name: Alfred_Pennyworth
characters.description: Alfred was originally nearly a completely different Butler character calledAlfred Beagle, a retired intelligence agent who followed the deathbed wish of his dying father,Jarvis Beagle, to carry on the tradition of serving the Wayne Family. To that end, Alfred introduced himself toBruce WayneandDick GraysonatWayne Manorand insisted on becoming their butler. Although the pair did not want one, especially since they did not want to jeopardize their secret identities with a servant in the house, the...

characters.name: Huntress
characters.description: Huntressis a mask-vigilante and superheroine. She was originally introduced asHelena Wayne, the daughter of theBatmanandCatwomanonEarth-Two. Following DC'sCrisis on Infinite Earths, the character was reestablished as Helena Bertinelli, the daughter of a mob boss turned vigilante onNew-EarthandPrime-Earth. Both characters have been adapted into other universes and forms of media.

characters.name: Oracle
characters.description: This is a disambiguation page — a list of articles associated with the same title.

characters.name: Spoiler
characters.description: Stephanie was born the daughter of theCluemaster, one ofGotham City's third-rate villains. Stephanie's father spent most of her childhood in prison or away from the family, and though he claimed to be "rehabilitated upon his return to Gotham", Stephanie was furious to discover that he was actually returning to crime without his need to leave clues behind. She decided something needed to be done. Stephanie tailored a costume for herself, and called herself the Spoiler. She knew where her father w...

characters.name: Two-Face
characters.description: Two-Faceis a criminal split between "good" and "evil" sides. OnceGotham City's amiable and courteous District Attorney,Harvey Dentwas one ofBatman's closest allies and friends, working with the vigilante to clean up the city. However, after being horribly disfigured during a trial, Dent's sanity fractured and he became one of the city's most notorious criminals, obsessed with duality, fate, chance and (occasionally) the number two. Unlike other villains, Two-Face often is displayed as having a m...

characters.name: Penguin
characters.description: The Penguin(Oswald Chesterfield Cobblepot) is aGotham Citysupervillain and an enemy ofBatman. Co-created by artistBob Kaneand writerBill Finger, he first appeared inDetective Comics#58(December 1941). One of Batman's oldest foes, the Penguin is often presented as a gentleman of crime, often developing elaborate schemes whilst presenting himself as innocent of many of his activities. An eccentric criminal mastermind, he is well-known for his love of ornithology and use oftechnology-fitted umbrell...

characters.name: Oswald_Cobblepot
characters.description: The Penguin(Oswald Chesterfield Cobblepot) is aGotham Citysupervillain and an enemy ofBatman. Co-created by artistBob Kaneand writerBill Finger, he first appeared inDetective Comics#58(December 1941). One of Batman's oldest foes, the Penguin is often presented as a gentleman of crime, often developing elaborate schemes whilst presenting himself as innocent of many of his activities. An eccentric criminal mastermind, he is well-known for his love of ornithology and use oftechnology-fitted umbrell...

characters.name: Riddler
characters.description: The Riddleris a criminal themed around riddles, puzzles and games, and frequent enemy ofBatman. Co-created byBill FingerandDick SprangforDetective Comics#140(October 1948),Edward "E." Nigma(sometimesNygmaandNashton), he themes his crimes around these, even leaving clues for Batman and thepoliceto solve hinting to his plans. Whilst not as physically capable as other enemies in the rogues gallery, Riddler is often considered one of Batman's most intelligent foes and has even manipulated others int...

characters.name: Edward_Nygma
characters.description: The Riddleris a criminal themed around riddles, puzzles and games, and frequent enemy ofBatman. Co-created byBill FingerandDick SprangforDetective Comics#140(October 1948),Edward "E." Nigma(sometimesNygmaandNashton), he themes his crimes around these, even leaving clues for Batman and thepoliceto solve hinting to his plans. Whilst not as physically capable as other enemies in the rogues gallery, Riddler is often considered one of Batman's most intelligent foes and has even manipulated others int...

characters.name: Selina_Kyle
characters.description: Catwomanis a cat-themed criminal fromGotham Cityand one ofBatman's most-well known enemies.Selina Kyleis often portrayed as a thief and cat burglar with divided loyalties. Her criminal activities are often tempered by a reluctant altruism, making her an inconstant villain and occasional ally to Batman. She regularly eludes capture by the Dark Knight and maintains a complicated relationship which frequently fluctuates between flirtatious to romantic. From 2002'sHushstoryline, Catwoman has often b...

characters.name: Scarecrow
characters.description: Dr. Jonathan Crane, also known as theScarecrow, is aGotham Citysupervillain and a major enemy ofBatman. Created by Batman creatorsBill FingerandBob Kane, he first appeared inWorld's Finest Comics #3(Fall 1941). His scarecrow costume, lanky appearance and surname were inspired by Ichabod Crane of the horror fable "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow".

characters.name: Jonathan_Crane
characters.description: Dr. Jonathan Crane, also known as theScarecrow, is aGotham Citysupervillain and a major enemy ofBatman. Created by Batman creatorsBill FingerandBob Kane, he first appeared inWorld's Finest Comics #3(Fall 1941). His scarecrow costume, lanky appearance and surname were inspired by Ichabod Crane of the horror fable "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow".

characters.name: Ra's_al_Ghul
characters.description: Raʾs al Ġhūlis a supervillain and enemy ofBatman. A former healer who later chose a moniker that translates to "Head of the Demon", he is a criminal mastermind and leader of theLeague of Assassins. In most stories, Ra's' goal is to save the Earth from possible ecological devastation, often by destroying most of the planet's population or bringing the world under his control. Though brilliant master of strategy with knowledge in various fields, Ra's al Ghul's greatest asset are hisLazarus Pits, w...

characters.name: Talia_al_Ghul
characters.description: Taliais an occasional lover and enemy ofBatman, the most cherished child ofRa's al Ghul, known as theDaughter of the Demon. As a high-ranking member of theLeague of Assassins, she is sometimes referred to by titles likeTalia HeadorTalia al Ghul, signifying her status as Daughter of the Demon. For a time she was a key member ofLexCorp. Talia was briefly married to Batman and is also the mother ofDamian Wayne, Batman's biological son and the fifthRobin.

characters.name: League_of_Assassins
characters.description: The League of Assassins was founded byRa's al Ghul(exactly when is unknown) to be the "Fang that protects the Head."[1]Members of the League demonstrated a willingness to die at a word from Ra's. They have included some of the most dangerous assassins in the world includingLady Shiva,David Cain, and master archerMerlyn. For much of its current history, any member to fail in an assassination was in turn targeted by the League (and indeed, one of its best-known members, the master-archer Merlyn wa...

characters.name: Victor_Fries
characters.description: Dr. Victor Fries(Pronounced "freeze") was an accomplished cryogenicist whose beloved wifeNorawas stricken with a fatal degenerative disease. Fries placed her in suspended animation while searching for a way to cure her. ButGothCorp's CEOFerris Boylestopped funding the research—and Nora's life—and pulled the plug, triggering an accident that transformed Fries' body into a cold-blooded form that must always be kept at sub-zero temperatures; at normal room temperature he will die.

characters.name: Pamela_Isley
characters.description: Poison Ivyis the alter ego taken byDr. Pamela Lillian Isley, an eco-terrorist and prominent enemy ofBatman. First appearing inBatman#181, she is depicted as one of the world's most prominent eco-terrorists, motivated by an obsession with plants, misandry, botany, and extremist environmentalism with a desire to save the world from the evils of man through any means necessary. A genius scientist and meta-human with hybridized plant DNA, Poison Ivy uses mutant plants, will-bending pheromones and to...

characters.name: Waylon_Jones
characters.description: Waylon Jones, also known asKiller Croc, is an alligator-wrestler and sideshow-freak turnedGotham Citymobster, sewer-dwelling super-criminal and enemy ofBatman. He is motivated due to having been born with a rare mutation that caused him to have reptile-like skin, leading to a lifetime of abuse and prejudice which drove him to madness.

characters.name: Kirk_Langstrom
characters.description: Man-Bat(real nameDr. Robert Kirkland "Kirk" Langstrom) is an enemy toBatman, who first appeared inDetective Comics#400, illustrated byNeal Adams.

characters.name: Floyd_Lawton
characters.description: Floyd Lawton, better known asDeadshot, is mercenary, and known to be the world's greatest marksman and one the most lethal assassins in the world. Lawton has created an armored suit that aids him in his battles againstBatman. Deadshot has had a longstanding rivalry withDeathstroke.

characters.name: Slade_Wilson
characters.description: Deathstroke the Terminator, more often referred to as simplyDeathstroke, is a villain published by DC Comics. First appearing inNew Teen Titans#2,Slade Wilsonis a former soldier turned mercenary and assassin hired by those who can bid the highest. He is often considered an enemy of theTeen TitansandDick Grayson's arch-nemesis. However, Deathstroke has often encounteredBatmaneither due to contracts within Gotham and conflicts involving theJustice League. He is also the father ofGrant,JosephandRos...

characters.name: Roman_Sionis
characters.description: Roman Sionis, a former business executive and mafia boss who originally hatedBruce Waynerather than Batman, wears a black wooden mask and leads the Sionis Crime Family, also known as theFalse Facers. Black Mask eventually became a mob boss controlling large sections of Gotham City's criminal underworld. Following the suspicious death of his multi-millionaire parents, Sionis had inherited their fortune and went on to bankrupt their company. Saved by a buyout by Bruce Wayne, Sionis came to resent ...

characters.name: Jervis_Tetch
characters.description: Obsessed from a young age with Lewis Carroll'sAlice in Wonderland,Jervis Tetch, a brilliant neuroscientist, embraced a delusion that he was the incarnation of a character in the story, theMad Hatter. Using his hypnotic skills for mesmerism, Tetch as the Mad Hatter has committed many crimes, often themed around the book that inspired him and his love of hats and headgear, going so far as to plant his hats, ranging from pith helmets to bowlers, with mind control chips to amplify his hypnosis skill...

characters.name: Julian_Day
characters.description: Julian Gregory Day, better known asCalendar Man, is known for committing themed crimes that corresponded with holidays and significant dates. While sometimes used as a "Joke villain" Calendar Man was reintroduced inBatman: The Long Halloween, as an unsettling criminal-mastermind who keeps track of Gotham's ongoings from his cell inArkham Asylum. Gotham City's hopes for a day off are often clouded by the knowledge that any holiday of note is likely to be shadowed by Calendar Man's presence.

characters.name: Garfield_Lynns
characters.description: Fireflyis a pyromaniacal serial-arsonist and recurring enemy ofBatman. Originally a pyrotechnics expert,Garfield Lynnsturned to crime by carrying out arson attacks and torching huge parts of Gotham in the process. True to his name, Firefly was originally conceived as a light-based enemy of Batman and Robin. However, the modern incarnations are depicted as fire-based, often using gadgets and weapons with pyrotechnical means. Firefly is rarely seen withouta suit capable of protecting him from heat...

characters.name: Ventriloquist
characters.description: Arnold Weskeris a ventriloquist with multiple personalities. His puppet is a gangster namedScarface. Under the puppet's psychological influence, Wesker is a dangerous and ruthless criminal and crime boss. It has been implied that the Ventriloquist suffers from multiple personality disorder. Wesker was originally a timid orphan whose deep repression erupted into a barroom brawl, resulting in him being sent to Blackgate Prison. There, he encountered the ventriloquist dummy Scarface and promptly mu...

characters.name: Anatoli_Knyazev
characters.description: KGBeast(or in Rebirth continuity, simplyThe Beast) is a Russian super-villain, an assassin, and also an enemy ofBatman.

characters.name: Professor_Pyg
characters.description: Lazlo ValentinorProfessor Pygis a deranged enemy ofBatman, broadly considered to be amongst his darkest and most disturbing. Pyg is a twisted surgeon, obsessed with the myth of Pygmalion and notions of physical perfection. Due to this, he kidnapsGothamcitizens to horrifically transform into his obedient, "Dollotrons". Professor Pyg is also the leader of theCircus of Strange, a syndicate of circus-freak themed meta-human criminals.

characters.name: Thomas_Elliot
characters.description: Dr. Thomas "Tommy" Elliotwas a childhood friend ofBruce Wayne. He becomes a costumed criminal who targets both Batman and Bruce Wayne. Although Hush's name originates from a nursery rhyme,Hushlives up to it by using manipulation and guile instead of noisy "signatures". Tommy and Bruce Wayne were childhood friends, and unbeknownst to Bruce, dark reflections of each other. A childhood sociopath, Elliot tried to kill his parents so he could inherit their fortune. When his plan failed, due partly to...

characters.name: Commissioner_Gordon
characters.description: James Worthington "Jim" Gordonis Commissioner of theGotham City Police Departmentand one ofBatman's most trusted allies. Created byBill FingerandBob Kane, he first appeared inDetective Comics#27 (May 1939) and served as one of Batman's first supporting character. In most incarnations, Gordon is the police commissioner ofGotham City. He shares the hero’s deep commitment of ridding the dark and corrupting city of crime.

characters.name: Renee_Montoya
characters.description: Renee Montoyais a character frequently featured in Batman and other DC publications. Created forBatman: The Animated Seriesbut debuting inBatman#475, she was originally a recurring member of theGotham City Police Departmentand ally to theBatman Family. Montoya became one of the main focus characters in theGotham Centralcomic series, serving as one of theMajor Crimes Unitofficers. After quitting the GCPD at the series' conclusion, she featured heavily in the52event series, during which she was se...

characters.name: Clark_Kent
characters.description: Supermanis a superhero, and ally ofBatman. Unlike Batman, Superman has a vast amount of superpowers at his disposal naturally occurring in the presence of a yellow star.

characters.name: Superman
characters.description: Supermanis a superhero, and ally ofBatman. Unlike Batman, Superman has a vast amount of superpowers at his disposal naturally occurring in the presence of a yellow star.

characters.name: Wonder_Woman
characters.description: Wonder Womanis an amazonian princess with abilities bestowed to her by the Gods. She is a member of theJustice Leagueand occasionally flirts withBatman.

characters.name: Zatanna
characters.description: Zatannais a "homo magi" that wears the traditional costume of a female magician's assistant. She sometimes fights crime withBatman.

characters.name: Amadeus_Arkham
characters.description: Amadeus Arkhamwas a prominent member of theArkham familyand the founder ofArkham Asylum. Having created the hospital after the murder of his family, he initially wanted to genuinely cure its inmates and treat their mental health. However, owing to a number of factors, Amadeus gradually lost his sanity and was eventually imprisoned within his own creation. Though long dead byBatman's time, Amadeus has affected the superhero's operations indirectly through either his family or asylum, which was us...

characters.name: Quincy_Sharp
characters.description: Quincy Sharpwas the Warden onArkham Islandand Mayor ofGotham Cityduring theArkham Cityera. Though he was seemingly a trustworthy authority figure, he was a covert serial killer and a puppet to ProfessorHugo Strange, with both men sharing a connection to a powerful criminal organization using them for their own operations.

characters.name: Warren_White
characters.description: Formerly crooked investor Warren "The Great White Shark" White, avoided prison time by pleading insanity and was sentenced to Arkham Asylum. There, among other indignities and tortures, White later attempted to get transferred to a minimum security prison. However, Dr. Anne Carver was revealed to have been killed and replaced byJane Doesome months earlier. Her boss, Dr.Jeremiah Arkhamorders that all the paperwork concerning White's transfer be destroyed in revenge for White robbing Arkham of his...

characters.name: Humpty_Dumpty
characters.description: Humphry Dumpler, a large, portly, well-mannered man, is obsessed with putting broken things back together again, even if he has to take them apart. Obese and bald, Dumpler was nicknamed "Humpty-Dumpty" for his egglike form. His crimes at first were minor break-ins, leading to small mechanical items no longer functioning properly due to Dumpty's inability to adequately reassemble them after taking them apart. But soon his obsession grew to the point that major disasters occurred in Gotham and Dum...

characters.name: Fish_Mooney
characters.description: Fish Mooneyis a former nightclub owner and mobster who led a gang under Don Falcone and was the former boss of Oswald Cobblepot.

characters.name: Martha_Wayne
characters.description: Born Martha Kane, Martha was the heir to the Kane Chemical fortune and a member of one ofGotham City's wealthiest families. It has not been revealed whether she has any connection to the other prominent Kanes of Gotham, Kathy or Bette. In her youth, Martha had a reputation as a notorious party girl, socialite, and debutante, frequenting all the most prestigious country clubs, night clubs, and soirees. However, she also had a developed social conscience and often used her family's wealth and stat...

characters.name: Thomas_Wayne
characters.description: Dr. Thomas Waynewas the father ofBruce Wayneand husband ofMartha Wayne. He was a well-known surgeon, philanthropist and CEO ofWayne Enterprises(which he inherited from his own father, after his father made patients on industrial technology, which he invested in real estate making the family billions). In some versions of the mythology he studied to become a surgeon with Dr.Leslie Thompkins, who would open up her own clinic inPark Row, andMatthew Thorne, a.k.a. The Crime Doctor. Thomas worked at ...

characters.name: Leslie_Thompkins
characters.description: Leslie Thompkinsis a medical doctor and a mentor toBatman. Close friends with his parents, Leslie serves as a godparent, along withAlfred Pennyworth, and close confidante to Bruce Wayne.

characters.name: Outsiders
characters.description: The Outsiders form in the fictional Eastern European country of Markovia. Batman and Black Lightning have traveled there in order to free the captive Lucius Fox from Baron Bedlam, who has killed the country's king, King Viktor. Geo-Force himself is the prince of the country who gains powers from Markovia's top scientist, Dr. Helga Jace, in order to stop Bedlam. Metamorpho is searching for Dr. Jace in order for the doctor to help him with his powers. Katana arrives in Markovia in order to kill Ge...

characters.name: Teen_Titans
characters.description: TheTeen Titansare a group of teenage superhero vigilantes who are counterparts to theJustice League. They consist of teenage super heroes and younger versions who fight the crime with the villains.

characters.name: Titans
characters.description: TheTitansis made up of ex-members of theTeen Titanswho have passed the maximum age limit, a kind of purgtory of young heroes not yet permitted join the ranks of theJustice League.

characters.name: Suicide_Squad
characters.description: Task Force Xis a group mostly comprised of incarcerated super-villains who are sent on black ops missions, by the government. The missions in question are often amoral with the government using the supervillains as contingencies for blame. The missions have a low chance of survival in return for lowering their incarceration time, earning the group the nickname of, the "Suicide Squad".

characters.name: Secret_Six
characters.description: TheSecret Sixis brought together in Villains United, a group of villains faced off against other super criminals. Now neither hero nor villain, these rogues do whatever is best for their interests.

characters.name: Rogues_Gallery
characters.description: A gathering of the most traditional top tier villains byBrian Stelfreeze.

characters.name: Batman_Beyond
characters.description: Batman Beyond(also known asBatman of the Futurein some regions) is an American animated television series created by The WB Television Network.Beyondis a futuristic continuation of theThe New Batman Adventures, which was cancelled in favor of a more youth orientedBatman.

characters.name: Terry_McGinnis
characters.description: Terry McGinnis is Batman several decades into the future, also known as Batman Beyond. He is the successor of Bruce Wayne and protector ofNeo-Gotham. After his father, Warren McGinnis, was murdered, Terry took up the mantle of Batman from Bruce Wayne. After avenging his father's death, Terry continued to fight crime as Batman in Neo Gotham. The history of this Terry McGinnis follows the same history as that of the DCAU with the addition that this universe had aBatman Incorporated.

characters.name: Talon
characters.description: William Cobbwas the most foremost and formidable of theTalonassassins used by theCourt of OwlswhenBatmanuncovered the secret society. He is also the great-grandfather ofDick Grayson, AKANightwing.

characters.name: Theo_Galavan
characters.description: Theo Galavanwas a member of theOrder of St. Dumasand Mayor of Gotham City. Along with his sisterTabitha, he was one of the last surviving heirs to the Duma family. Seeking revenge on the Wayne family, he and his sister plotted to sacrificeBruce Wayne. After being killed byJames Gordon, Galavan was subsequently resurrected byIndian Hill's experiments, though memory loss resulted in him donning the identityAzrael.

characters.name: Butch_Gilzean
characters.description: Butch Gilzean(bornCyrus Gold) is a criminal inGotham City. He originally worked for theFalcone Crime Familyunder enforcer and nightclub ownerFish Mooney, before later becoming associated withOswald Cobblepot/The Penguin. After being shot and put into a coma byBarbara Kean, Butch is later dumped inSlaughter Swampby the hospital where he is resurrected after being exposed to chemicals originating fromIndian Hill. He is revived as a ghoulish being, and undertakes the identity ofSolomon Grundy.

characters.name: Silver_St._Cloud
characters.description: Silver St. Cloudis a Gotham City socialite who had a romantic connection toBruce Wayne/Batman. She was also once engaged to U.S. senator Evan Gregory. She is aware that Bruce Wayne is Batman.

characters.name: Jerome_Valeska
characters.description: Jerome Valeskais a major antagonist in the television seriesGotham. Jerome has a twin brother namedJeremiah. In their own way, each were the show's equivalent toThe Jokerat different points in time.

characters.name: Jeremiah_Valeska
characters.description: Jeremiah Valeskais a major antagonist in the television series,Gotham. He is the twin brother of the terrorist cult leader,Jerome Valeska, as well as being the arch-nemesis ofBruce Wayne.

characters.name: Pyg
characters.description: Lazlo ValentinorProfessor Pygis a deranged enemy ofBatman, broadly considered to be amongst his darkest and most disturbing. Pyg is a twisted surgeon, obsessed with the myth of Pygmalion and notions of physical perfection. Due to this, he kidnapsGothamcitizens to horrifically transform into his obedient, "Dollotrons". Professor Pyg is also the leader of theCircus of Strange, a syndicate of circus-freak themed meta-human criminals.

characters.name: Frank_Boles
characters.description: Frank Boleswas a corrupt security officer atArkham Islandin the employment of theJoker. Boles was instrumental in assisting the Joker andHarley Quinnwith their orchestrated takeover of the asylum.

characters.name: Zsasz
characters.description: Victor Zsasz(referred to asZsaszorMr. Zsasz) is a prolific serial killer and an enemy ofBatman. Zsasz is a difficult killer to track as he has no modus operandi outside of posing his victims' corpses in lifelike poses, and carving a tally-mark into his flesh for each kill. Zsasz is motivated by believing all life to be meaningless cycles of pain and that he is actually saving his victims from having to live on.

characters.name: Jack_Ryder
characters.description: Jack Ryder is an outspoken television newscaster and reporter for a Gotham City TV station. As Ryder, he is the anchorman of a show in which he deliberately antagonizes his guests in order to raise attention on hot topics, like stem cell research and medical nanotech. During his research on the revolutionary "nanocells" therapy of Doctor Vincent Yatz, he discovered an experimental mixture which enabled the body to regenerate to the point of completely replacing the skin of a badly scarred burn v...

characters.name: Drury_Walker
characters.description: Killer Mothis a supervillain who was primarily remembered as an antagonist ofBatgirlandBatman. Having decided that the lawbreakers ofGotham Cityneeded a costumed protector just as honest citizens had Batman, Killer Moth emulated the Dark Knight in every way, copying his paraphernalia and building on his legend to create his own super villain identity. He eventually came to resemble a dark mirror image of Batman, even adopting the alter ego of a wealthy philanthropist similar to Bruce Wayne. Moth...

characters.name: Lock-Up
characters.description: Lyle Boltonwas a formerArkham Asylumsecurity guard who specialized in incarceration and high tech security systems. After being fired for using brutal methods to keep the Asylum's patients in line, he would take up the vigilante identityLock-Upand target those who had terminated his employment. Lock-Up was voiced byBruce Weitz.

characters.name: Lyle_Bolton
characters.description: Lyle Boltonwas a formerArkham Asylumsecurity guard who specialized in incarceration and high tech security systems. After being fired for using brutal methods to keep the Asylum's patients in line, he would take up the vigilante identityLock-Upand target those who had terminated his employment. Lock-Up was voiced byBruce Weitz.

characters.name: Film_Freak
characters.description: Burt WestonAKAThe Film Freakis a serial-killer enemy of Batman. Obsessed with films, Weston's modus operandi is to recreate famous movie deaths in his killings.

characters.name: Cavalier
characters.description: Mortimer Drakeis a swashbuckling supervillain who calls himself theCavalier. Drake was once a millionaire who turned to crime when his desire to build a private history museum outstripped his ability to pay for the exhibits, so he stole them. Since then, he has lost his millions and his motivation now is theft for profit. As an enemy of ofBatmanhe uses a rapier as his main weapon and whose trademark is excessive (and often false) gallantry.

characters.name: Monk
characters.description: The MonkorThe Mad Monkis avampiresuper-villain ofBatman. He was the second super-villain ever fought by Batman in publication history as well as the main-antagonist of Batman's first ever two-part storyline. Along with this, the Monk's henchwomanDalais the first female Batman villain in publication history.

characters.name: Dr._Death
characters.description: Doctor Death(Dr. Karl Hellfern) is historically the first super-villain encountered byBatman. He has been reinterpreted several times throughout the series.

characters.name: Karl_Hellfern
characters.description: Doctor Death(Dr. Karl Hellfern) is historically the first super-villain encountered byBatman. He has been reinterpreted several times throughout the series.

characters.name: Alexander_Knox
characters.description: When Knox and Vicki Vale were atWayne Manor(where Bruce Wayne hosted a charity ball to raise $250,000 for Gotham’s 200th Anniversary), Bruce and Vicki hit it off with a great conversation. Knox appeared jealous, but was also a little intrigued by seeing how they got together. Bruce told Knox that he had read his work and liked it “a lot.”

characters.name: Summer_Gleeson
characters.description: Summer Gleesonwas a news reporter and anchor in Gotham City. Summer hoped of one day getting the story on the identity of Batman.

characters.name: Chase_Meridian
characters.description: Dr.Chase Meridianwas a psychologist who moved toGotham Cityas a consultant to thepolice. Chase eventually became romantically involved withBruce Wayne/Batman.

characters.name: Max_Shreck
characters.description: Maximillian "Max" Shreckwas a ruthless business mogul who served as the boss ofSelina Kyleand an ally to thePenguin.

characters.name: Chip_Shreck
characters.description: Charles Shreck, better known as "Chip" (as in both short for Charles, but also "chip off the old block"), was born into immense wealth and privilege, thanks to his father, multi-millionaire industrialist, Max Shreck. In fact, Max's plan to develop an apparent power-plant with the underlying intention of stockpilingGotham City's power was undertaken with the purpose of endowing Chip with a legacy. However, it was also apparent that Chip'smotherwas dead by the point.

characters.name: Jack_Napier
characters.description: Joker becameBatman's first great enemy after he attempted to take control of the city from the mob and committed mass random murders. Unknown to both parties until their later confrontations, Joker and Batman shared a secret past that made them greater enemies. Batman was regarded as an urban legend but his attempts to thwart Napier gradually left him more exposed to the public and made him to be a more local figure.

characters.name: Bob_the_Goon
characters.description: During Jack Napier's career in the mob, his most loyal enforcer and friend was Bob, who defended and protected Jack wherever he went, according to Jack. Bob was always busy trying to accommodate Napier, even in little things such as straightening the mirror or polishing the door handle on Jack's Car.

characters.name: Lawrence
characters.description: Fortunately for Lawrence, he was able to survive and land in the floorboards of the next floor underneath. Shortly after the Joker's demise, Lawrence was taken into medical custody and put into traction due to the injuries he incurred. For a time he was placed in prison. However, due to the manipulations of a mysterious third party, Lawrence was scheduled for a transfer for medical evaluation. An unlocked door and keys left inside a pickup truck allowed Lawrence to escape imprisonment.

characters.name: Magpie
characters.description: Magpiewas an enemy of Batman with an obsession for shiny objects.

characters.name: Margaret_Pye
characters.description: Magpiewas an enemy of Batman with an obsession for shiny objects.

characters.name: Bookworm
characters.description: The Bookwormwas a villain created for the1960s Batman television series. The character was identifiable by his thick glasses and dark brown leather suit, made to match rare old book bindings. He had an affinity for books and centered many of his schemes around them.The characterwas first referenced as part of the mainstream Batman comic books in 1989'sSecret Origins Special#1 and appeared, in a form dramatically different from his television counterpart, as an enemy of the Huntress inThe Huntres...

characters.name: Roddy_McDowall
characters.description: He is a actor for play the role of Cornelius inPlanet of the ApesandEscape from the Planet of the Apes.He have play Ceasar inConquest of the Planet of the ApesandBattle for the Planet of the Apes.He play also Galen in TV SHOWPlanet of the Apes.

characters.name: King_Tut
characters.description: King Tutwas a villain and enemy ofBatmancreated specifically for theBatman1960s TV Series. He was portrayed byVictor Buono.

characters.name: Victor_Buono
characters.description: His character proved among the most popular original villains of the series, and Buono relishied the opportunity to playfully overact on the series.

characters.name: Egghead
characters.description: Eggheadwas a villain created for the1960s Batman television series. He was portrayed byVincent Price. The character was identifiable by his pale bald head and white and yellow suit. He believed himself to be "the world's smartest criminal," and his crimes would usually have an egg-motif to them as well as including egg puns in his speech where appropriate such as "egg-zactly" and "egg-cellent." Additionally, he would use a wide assortment of egg-shaped weapons, such as laughing gas eggs and tear...

characters.name: Louie_the_Lilac
characters.description: Louie the Lilacis a villain and enemy ofBatmancreated specifically for theBatman1960s TV Series.

characters.name: Ma_Parker
characters.description: Ma Parkerwas a villainess and enemy ofBatmanin theBatman 1960s TV Series. She was portrayed byShelley Winters.

characters.name: Shelley_Winters
characters.description: The lateShelley Winterswas an american actress who portrayedMa Parkerin theBatman1960s series.

characters.name: Shame
characters.description: Shamewas a villain and enemy ofBatmanin theBatman1960s TV Series. He was portrayed byCliff Robertson.

characters.name: Cliff_Robertson
characters.description: Cliff Robertsonwas an actor and aviator who portrayedShamein theBatmantelevision series.

characters.name: False_Face
characters.description: False Facewas a criminal make-up artist and master of disguise who uses his skill to impersonate wealthy people.

characters.name: Phantasm
characters.description: The Phantasmis a murderous vigilante and former love-interest ofBatman. Once the romantic partner of Bruce Wayne,Andrea Beaumontbecame a murderous vigilante after her father's death at the hands of criminals. Under this alias, she became an enemy of both Batman andCatwoman.

characters.name: Lloyd_Ventrix
characters.description: Lloyd Ventrix(also known asMojo) was an ex-con that used a suit that rendered him invisible. Using it to commit crimes, he became an enemy ofBatman. Ventrix appears in theBatman: The Animated Seriesepisode "See No Evil".

characters.name: Red_Claw
characters.description: Red Clawis the leader of an international terrorist organization of the same name. She is a stout, opposing figure and master of martial arts, able to match Batman in hand-to-hand combat.

characters.name: Tygrus
characters.description: Tygruswas a hybridized cat-man created by Dr.Emile Dorian.

characters.name: Emile_Dorian
characters.description: Dr. Emile Dorianis a character fromBatman: The Animated Seriesvoiced byJoseph Maher. He is a geneticist who experiments with combining the DNA of humans and animals, most notably felines.

characters.name: Matches_Malone
characters.description: Matches Malone was a small time criminal who was actually a decent human being. One didn't have to be trained in the art of observation to pick him out in a crowd. The tinted glasses, the carefully groomed hair and mustache, the striped shirt and plaid suit.Dick Graysonwould later describe his voice, in Nightwing # 14, as "a perfect North Jersey accent. Flat and nasal." Most significantly, there was the ubiquitous stick match clutched between his thumb and forefinger, ready to be flicked into li...

characters.name: Harper_Row
characters.description: Harper Rowgrew up in the Narrows ofGotham Citywith her younger brother,Cullen. They both had a rough life due to abuse, abandonment and the lack of money. She later became the vigilanteBluebird.

characters.name: Cullen_Row
characters.description: Cullen Rowis a teenage resident of theGotham CityNarrows, and younger brother toHarper Row.

characters.name: Signal
characters.description: Duke Thomasis a vigilante and a member of theBat-Family. He joined the We Are Robin movement and became one of hundred of civilian teenagers to don the Robin R and fight for their city. Eventually, he would leave the movement and join the Batman Family as the vigilante calledThe Signal.

vehicles.name: The_Bat
vehicles.description: The Batwas the name that was given to the aircraft that was operated byBatmanin The Dark Knight Rises.

vehicles.name: Bat-Glider
vehicles.description: TheBat-Glideris an airborne vehicle used byBatman. Inspired byLeonardo da Vinci'sglider designs, it is used by Batman to glide through the sky without being noticed. It is typically used on stealth missions instead of theBatplaneorBatcopter. In recent years, the Bat-Glider's functionality has been merged withBatman's cape.

vehicles.name: Bat-Rocket
vehicles.description: The Bat-Ship was created byBatmanandRobinafter being transported to the year 2050 by futuristic crime-fighter,Rokej. The ship was was created to assist Rokej in hunting down a gang of space-pirates who were stealing space-ships.

vehicles.name: Bat-Rocket_(Dozierverse)
vehicles.description: TheBat-Rocketwas the space travelling vehicle used byBatmanandRobin.

vehicles.name: Bat-Sub
vehicles.description: The first model of the Bat-Sub was in fact an upgraded version of the Batplane, which could be transformed into a submarine by retracting its wings and using the torpedoes for underwater propulsion. It also had car and boat modes.

vehicles.name: Bat-Sub_(Dozierverse)
vehicles.description: TheBat-Subis an underwater vehicle used byBatmanandRobin. It appears inBatman '66.

vehicles.name: Batarang_X
vehicles.description: Batarang Xis a large redBatarangthat can be launched from theBatmobileas a means of transportation. It is kept under a tarp in theBatcave, deemed "too dangerous" byBatman.

vehicles.name: Batblade
vehicles.description: TheBatbladewas a customIce Armorvehicle that was owned byBatman.

vehicles.name: Batboat
vehicles.description: The BatboatisBatman's personal watercraft. At times the Dark Knight has to take to the waters. Using a Catamaran type boat, the Batboat can reach speeds of up to 120mph standard.

vehicles.name: Batboat_(Batman_Forever)
vehicles.description: TheBatboatappeared inBatman Forever. It was piloted byRobinand quickly destroyed byTwo-Face.

vehicles.name: Batboat_(DC_Animated_Universe)
vehicles.description: TheBatboatis the personal watercraft used byBatman. It also functions as a submarine.

vehicles.name: Batboat_(Dozierverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatboatwasBatman's personal watercraft that debuted in the1966 spinoff moviebased on thetv show.

vehicles.name: Batboat_(Matsudaverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatboatisBatman's boat used mostly for underwater movement.

vehicles.name: Batcopter
vehicles.description: The first appearance of the Batcopter was in the 1966 filmBatman. Unlike theBatmobile, theBatcycle, and theBatboat, it was not intended for use in the1960s Batman television series, which did not have the budget to create such elaborate vehicles. While the other vehicles were bought by 20th Century Fox, the Batcopter was only leased for the movie. It cost Fox $750 a day for five days from April 7 to April 11, 1966.

vehicles.name: Batcopter_(Dozierverse)
vehicles.description: BatmanandRobinused the Batcopter on their rescue mission to saveCommodore Schmidlapp, which turned out to be a trap. The Batcopter was later used to track theBatmobilestolen by thePenguin, and it got damaged by one of theRiddler's Polaris underwater missiles.

vehicles.name: Batcopter_(Filmation)
vehicles.description: TheBatcopteris the second aircraft used by Batman and Robin.

vehicles.name: Batcycle
vehicles.description: TheBatcycleis the motorcycle counterpart to theBatmobile. TheBatcycleis the personal motorcycle ofBatman. In the comic book universe, Batman's personal Batcycle is a modified street-bike with a 786 cc liquid-cooledV-4 engine. It contains a computer-controlled carburetor and bulletproof wind-guard.

vehicles.name: Batcycle_(Beware_the_Batman)
vehicles.description: When Deathstroke stole the Batmobile to travel to the Batcave, Batman uses the Batcycle to head to the cave to stop him.

vehicles.name: Batcycle_(Burtonverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatcyclewas a vehicle owned byBatman. Obtained some time beforeHarvey Dent's campaign against him, it was stored in theBatcave. After joining his operations,Drake Winstonbegan using the Batcycle as his main vehicle of transport as "Robin".

vehicles.name: Batcycle_(DC_Animated_Universe)
vehicles.description: The Batcycle is most often used byRobinand is sometimes used byBatmanwhen theBatmobileis too cumbersome or is being repaired.

vehicles.name: Batcycle_(Dozierverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatcyclewasBatman's personal motorcycle with a rigged sidecar forRobinknown as ago-cart.

vehicles.name: Batcycle_(Filmation)
vehicles.description: Batgirl uses the Batcycle to travel anywhere in Gotham City to assist Batman and Robin in capturing the known supervillains. It has a sidecar attached to its right side.

vehicles.name: Batcycle_(Matsudaverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatcyclewas another road vehicle used byBatmanonly a few times in The Batman.

vehicles.name: Batcycle_(The_Batman_film)
vehicles.description: TheBatcyclewas a vehicle used byBatmanwhilst on patrol in Gotham. It was often used to travel to at faster speeds and to areas where theBatmobilecould not access. Whilst conducting survience or avoiding attention, Batman instead usedanother motorcycle. Batman made use of the Batcycle afterGothamwasfloodedbythe Riddler. He also drove the vehicle whilst bidding farewell toSelina Kyle, driving it through theGotham Cemeteryalongsideher motorcycle.

vehicles.name: Batgirl_Cycle
vehicles.description: During Barbara's stay inGotham City, she changes into her Batgirl suit and enter the secret garage where she stores her Batgirl Cycle, and drives it out of the garage's secret door in an alleyway. It has the same gadgets and captivities like theBatmobile.

vehicles.name: Batgyro
vehicles.description: TheBatgyrowas first air-based vehicle used byBatmanin his operations. It was the first vehicle to bare abat-style, predating theBatmobile. The Batgyro served as a prototype for theBatplane, with it later abandoned in favor of both it and the similarBatcopters.

vehicles.name: Bathammer
vehicles.description: TheBathammerwas a custom vehicle that was created byBatmanto combat theFreezemobile.

vehicles.name: Batmissile
vehicles.description: TheBatmissilewas a kind of escape vehicle that was integrated into theBatmobile. When needed, the Batmobile shed its outer "skin" and formed that bullet train-like vehicle that was able to pass through narrow spaces that it was not able to go through normally.

vehicles.name: Batmobile
vehicles.description: BatmobilesareBatman's high-powered roadsters and primary mode of transportation. The cars have appeared in almost every Batman iteration, including comics, movies, and television and has since gone on to be a part of pop culture.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(1943_Serial)
vehicles.description: The first live action Batman film was a serial produced by Columbia in 1943. Like most other serials, these were low-budget affairs that were run once a week, featuring "cliffhanger" type endings to draw audiences back for the next installment. Lacking the funding of laterBatmanprojects, the "Batmobile" was simply a factory-stock convertible.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(1949_Serial)
vehicles.description: Batman returned to live action for hissecond(and final) serial run in 1949. Though it lacked any significant budget, most elements of the Batman universe were retained: the costumes, Wayne Manor, the Batcave, and a "Batmobile."

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(1992_animated_series)
vehicles.description: Batman's second and first major hi-techBatmobile. It was later phased out in favor of asleek two passenger coupe.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Arkham_Knight)
vehicles.description: Uniquely, the Batmobile (designed by Lucius Fox) had the ability to transform, on the fly, into "Battle Mode" which gave it the appearance of a battle tank, with a wider wheel base, and higher ground clearance. featuring various weapons and movement capabilities, including a Vulcan Minigun, 60mm Cannon, Missles,non-lethal riot suppressors, full 360 wheel spin and the ability to strafe with built in thrusters. Enemies who touched the Batmobile were knocked out by a charge of electricity. Other features included an EMP to stun hostile drones and knock missiles out of the air, a Drone Virus; a de...

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Arkhamverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobilewasBatman'smain mode of transport aroundGotham City, and in his fight against the combined forces of his deadliest foes. He later took to using a moretank-like, off-road vehicle.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Batman_Beyond)
vehicles.description: This new flyingBatmobilewas first introduced in the Batman Beyond episode, "Black Out", whenTerry McGinnishad to pursue the shape shifting criminalInque, and has used it ever since. It can be assumed thatBruce Waynemust have built it some time after he retired as Batman, as when he retired, that sort of technology was probably not present yet to make that sort of Flying car, and its design is more similar to other flying cars of the Beyond era.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Batman_Forever)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobilewasBatman's primary mode of transportation inBatman Forever. After theRiddlerbroke in to theBatcaveand destroyed this car it was replaced with asingle-seater, open canopy Batmobile.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Batman_Unlimited)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobileis the main road vehicle used by Batman in theBatman Unlimitedmovies.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Burtonverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobilewasBatman's primary mode of transportation. At first, Batman only referred to this vehicle as simply "the car", and years later Alfred referred to it as the Batmobile. This armored roadster was one of the most daunting components in Batman's vast arsenal, and he kept it stored in theBatcavewhen it was not in use.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Caped_Crusader)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobileis Batman's primary mode of transportation.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(DC_Animated_Movie_Universe)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobilewas a high-tech vehicle that Batman uses to travel around Gotham. It was designed by Lucius Fox.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Matsudaverse)
vehicles.description: In the animated seriesThe Batman, theBatmobileresembled a sports coupe with multiple jet exhaust slits protruding from the back bumper. When the first Batmobile wasn’t fast enough to stop the speed demon Gearhead (and also not able to be repaired after a massive accident), Batman upgraded his wheels with both a much faster engine and a far lighter chassis. With more speed behind him, Gearhead was no match for The Batman.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Super_Friends)
vehicles.description: In 1973,Batmanreturned to television with the debut of the Superfriends cartoon series. Teamed withSuperman,Aquaman, Wonder Woman, and "hero trainees" Wendy, Marvin, and Wonder Dog, the hour-long show had the heroes facing danger around the world. The character roster evolved as the show went on, but Batman &Robinwere always part of the cast.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(The_Brave_and_the_Bold)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobileis the key form of transportation used byBatmanin his war against crime. In this incarnation the Batmobile has a unique application - a triple changer function which features theBatplane, theBatboat,Batcycleanda robotic exoskeleton suit.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Titans)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobileis a car used byBatmanin his operations.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Tomorrowverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobileis a modified armored car used by Batman.

vehicles.name: Batmobile-J
vehicles.description: TheBatmobile-Jis a road vehicle and Japanese counterpart of theBatmobile. It only appeared inBatman '66.

vehicles.name: Batplane
vehicles.description: TheBatplaneis Batman's personal aircraft. He sometimes travels with it as an alternative to theBatmobile. It has also been called the Batwing (not to be confused withBatwing).

vehicles.name: Batpod
vehicles.description: TheBatpodis intended as a kind of "escape pod" integrated into theTumbler, it also served an auxiliary vehicle. Armed with dual front-mounted cannons, machine guns and grappling hooks, the Batpod affords Batman greater mobility at the cost of some protection.

vehicles.name: Batskiboat
vehicles.description: TheBatskiboat[1]is a hydrofoil watercraft used by Batman. It was a single-seater and had a similar arsenal to theBatmobile, including torpedo launchers.

vehicles.name: Batskiff
vehicles.description: TheBatskiffwas a customIce Armorvehicle that was owned byBatman.

vehicles.name: Batwing
vehicles.description: TheBatwingwasBatman's custom-built air combat vehicle. The craft was fully armed with mini-guns and missiles. It was unknown where the vehicle was stored, but it was presumably kept somewhere near the grounds ofWayne Manoror inside theBatcave.

vehicles.name: Batwing_(Batman_Forever)
vehicles.description: TheBatwingwas the second flying craft that was developed byBatman, following the destruction of theoriginal aircraftby theJoker. When it was not in use, the Batwing was stored in theBatcaveand hung upside down from the ceiling like a bat.

vehicles.name: Batwing_(Matsudaverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatwingisBatman's aerial vehicle which he uses to fly with.

vehicles.name: British_Batmobile
vehicles.description: TheBritish Batmobileis a road vehicle and the British counterpart of theBatmobile. It only appeared inBatman '66

vehicles.name: Catmobile
vehicles.description: TheCatmobileis the cat-themed automobile owned byCatwomanandCatman, and the counterpart of theBatmobile.

vehicles.name: Cobblepot_Campaign_Trailer
vehicles.description: TheRed Triangle Gangstole one of theBat O' Ridecoin machines and rigged it so he could control the real Batmobile remotely using the steering wheel. The kiddie ride was hooked up to receivers on top of the trailer during the of the Relighting of the Tree inGotham Plaza. Penguin oversaw the kidnapping of theIce Princesswhile theBeacon Rodwas installed on theBatmobile. Penguin rocked the RV wildly back and forth while he wreaked havoc piloting the Batmobile from inside.

vehicles.name: Compact
vehicles.description: TheCompactwas a purple Mini Cooper compact car with the ability to transform into a smallBatmobilethat was give toStephanie BrownbyBatmanwhen she joinedBatman Incorporated.

vehicles.name: The_Duck
vehicles.description: The Duckwas thePenguin's primary mode of transportation through the waterways in the sewers ofGotham. Originally a cable cart boat from theOld Zoo, Cobblepot modified it to function as an all-terrain vehicle.

vehicles.name: Freeze_Truck
vehicles.description: The truck later attacks theSave the Rainforest Costume Ballwith its freeze ray, and was then pursued by Batman and Robin in theBatmobileandRedbird. After landing safely on the roof of the Gotham Water and Power building, Mr. Freeze used the truck's freeze ray to freeze the Batmobile, but Batman ejects from the vehicle and crashes through the truck's windscreen, and captures Freeze. It was later impounded by the police after Freeze's arrest, but was later reclaimed by Freeze after he escapedArkham Asylumwith help fromPoison IvyandBane.

vehicles.name: Joker_Goon_Car
vehicles.description: Joker Goon Carswere custom cars driven by theJoker Goons. The cars were 1978 Dodge 3700 GT sedans that were painted in theJoker's trademark colors; purple and green. The body was purple, with both the hood and tire rims green. Multi-colored lights were strung around the rear window, and fuzzy dice hung from the rear-view mirror.

vehicles.name: Joker_Van
vehicles.description: Joker had a van that was personalized with his trademark colors of purple and green. It sat outside theFlugelheim MuseumwhenBatmanescaped withVicki Valein theBatmobile.

vehicles.name: The_Joker%27s_Helicopter
vehicles.description: The Joker's Helicopter was first used to escapeBatman'sassault onAxis Chemicalswith theBatmobile. Prior to that he was chauffeured in a purpleJoker Van.

vehicles.name: Joker%27s_Train_(Matsudaverse)
vehicles.description: It is designed to have the appearance of the Joker and first appeared when Joker knocked outBatman,RobinandBatgirland put them inside a cage, Joker used it to store the valuables Gotham citizens threw onto his ship while brainwashed by the train lights, as well as the Dynamic Trio'sutillity belts, Joker also revealed his plan of blowing upGotham Cityusing dynamite inside an cave, planning to have the city swallowed into a sinkhole, eventually Joker took off on the train while leaving them trapped, but they eventually got out with key and chased after the Joker inside theBatmobile, Joker escape...

vehicles.name: Jokermobile
vehicles.description: The Jokermobileis a vehicle owned by theJokerwhich he uses as a pastiche ofBatman'sBatmobile. It first appeared inBatman #37.

vehicles.name: Jokermobile_(Dozierverse)
vehicles.description: TheJokermobile(also known as theJokemobile) was theJoker's road transportation and the equivalent ofBatman'sBatmobile.

vehicles.name: Knightcrawler
vehicles.description: TheKnightcrawleris an unusual vehicleBatmanused to fight an army of parademons.

vehicles.name: Liberty
vehicles.description: Whenthe Jokerannounced that he would ruleGotham Cityat midnight, the police began a massive evacuation of the city. However, the Joker implied that the tunnels and bridges were rigged with explosives, forcing the police to evacuate using ferries. The last ones to be loaded before midnight were theLiberty, which was carrying civilians, and theSpirit, which was carrying criminals.

vehicles.name: Nightbird
vehicles.description: TheNightbirdis the hi-tech car used byDick Grayson. Initially the Nightbird was a modified muscle car that Nightwing used as the protector ofBlüdhaven, but was later traded in for the current model when he returned toGotham City.

vehicles.name: Penguin%27s_Pre-Nuclear_Submarine
