vehicles.description: Briefly, the submarine was utilized by theUnited Underworldas a mobile base of operations during their efforts to obtain the invention ofCommodore Schmidlapp. They were able to capture the Commodore's Yacht, imprisoning the Commodore in the hold, and establish a holographic replica of the yacht to lureBatmanandRobininto a trap. Later the submarine was used to attack Batman and Robin while they investigated aboard theBatboat.

vehicles.name: Raven_X1-11
vehicles.description: It is likely that, after the Raven fiasco, Wayne Enterprises abandoned weapons manufacture. By the time of Wayne's brief partnership with LexCorp, Wayne was adamant that his company would not be party to military uses of his technology.

vehicles.name: Red_Roadster
vehicles.description: TheRed Roadsterwas a road vehicle drivenBatmanin his first appearance in the comics.

vehicles.name: Red_Triangle_Circus_Train
vehicles.description: TheRed Triangle Circus Trainwas a vehicle that thePenguin'sRed Triangle Gangused to snatch the first-born sons ofGotham City. It pulled five empty wagons behind it.

vehicles.name: Redbird
vehicles.description: TheRedbirdis a camouflaged sport coupé with all the armaments of theBatmobile. In addition to that, there are polarizing windows and exterior sliding bulletproof conversion panels, enabling it to be driven by an uncostumedTim Drakeas a "normal" car.

vehicles.name: Redbird_(Batman_%26_Robin)
vehicles.description: AfterMr. Freezestole a diamond necklace from a charity ball,Batmanand Robin chased after him, with Batman in theBatmobileand Robin on the Redbird. They chased Freeze down a giant statue's arm, and with the fingers at the end, Freeze used those fingers as a jump. Batman realised that Robin couldn't make the jump, so he insisted Robin stand down, but Robin repeatedly refused. When they got closer to the jump, Batman shut down the Redbird from the Batmobile using the remote engine deactivation feature. Batman safely made the jump, but while the Batmobile didn't survive, the Caped Crusader ejected...

vehicles.name: Riot_Tank_Batmobile
vehicles.description: Before being forced into retirement,Batmanbuilt this tank to deal with a period of extreme rioting in the city. Unlike his small standardflying Batmobiles, this vehicle is massive, withcaterpillar tracksand functions as a ground AFV only.

vehicles.name: Robin%27s_Motorcycle
vehicles.description: Robin's Motorcyleis a customized vehicle utilized by the variousRobinsand their personal transport. Often depected as a red version of theBatcycle, it allows the Boy Wonder to travel independant of theBatmobileand through narrow corners ofGotham City. The Robin Cycle has often been utilized byDick Graysonin his later career as both Robin and occasionally asNightwing, andTim Drakeafter he joined the Batman family.

vehicles.name: Scarecrow%27s_Glider
vehicles.description: The Scarecrow used this glider to escape Batman. When he returned to his factory, Scarecrow crashed the glider nose first onto the ground when he landed.

vehicles.name: Spirit
vehicles.description: Whenthe Jokerannounced that he would ruleGotham Cityat midnight, the police began a massive evacuation of the city. However, the Joker implied that the tunnels and bridges were rigged with explosives, forcing the police to evacuate using ferries. The last ones to be loaded before midnight were theLiberty, which was carrying civilians, and theSpirit, which was carrying criminals. Commissioner Gordon wanted to get some criminals off the island, as he did not want them to take part in whatever the Joker was planning.

vehicles.name: Two-Face%27s_Helicopter
vehicles.description: Two-Face's Helicopteris an aircraft used byTwo-Faceduring theSecond Bank of Gotham Heist.

vehicles.name: Wingcycle
vehicles.description: TheWingcycleis the hi-tech motorcycleDick Graysonused as Nightwing. Originally a white, gold, and blue motorcycle with a sidecar for a second passenger, the Wingcycle was upgraded to a more advanced black-and-blue version with a Nightwing-symbol headlight.

vehicles.name: 1996_Batmobile
vehicles.description: In January of 1996 thisBatmobilewas introduced and ended up being the longest standing single Batmobile until its destruction during theearthquake, along with the oldBatcave.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(New_52)
vehicles.description: A new standardBatmobilewas created for the New 52 comics.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_of_1950
vehicles.description: TheBatmobile of 1950is one of the best known comic bookBatmobiles.

vehicles.name: Breyfogle_Batmobile_Mk.III
vehicles.description: ThisBatmobilewas used byJean-Paul ValleyasBatmanin the early to mid 90s. This is also the primary vehicleBruce Waynewas using at the time of his defeat byBane. This car was succeeded by the1996 Batmobileafter its destruction.

vehicles.name: New_Look_Batmobile
vehicles.description: .TheNew Look Batmobilewas introduced in 1964 in preparation for the developingtelevision show, creating a car that would be easier to translate and more maneuverable for stunt drivers likeHubie Kerns.

vehicles.name: Batplane_(DC_Animated_Universe)
vehicles.description: TheBatplaneorBatwingwas the aircraft used byBatmanin the DC Animated Universe.

vehicles.name: Batplane_(Filmation)
vehicles.description: TheBatplaneis the customised aircraft used by Batman and Robin.

vehicles.name: Batwing_(Arkhamverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatwingisBatman's personal aircraft. He sometimes traveled in it as an alternative to theBatmobile, and it could also be controlled remotely to deliver items. An example of that was when Batman summoned the Batwing to deliver the Line Launcher inBatman: Arkham Asylum, theBatsuitand the upgraded Grapnel Gun inBatman: Arkham City, the cure to stopCopperhead's poison inBatman: Arkham Origins, and the XE Suit inCold, Cold Heart.

vehicles.name: Batwing_(Snyderverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatwing(sometimes referred to as theBatplane) was an aircraft used byBatman. It was often used to patrol the skies ofGothamand battle enemies via the air. The Batwing could also be controlled remotely from theBatcave computer system. The Batwing was used during Batman's alliance withSupermanand theJustice League.

vehicles.name: Batwing_(The_Flash)
vehicles.description: TheBatwingwas a custom aircraft used byBatmanto fly around the airspace ofGothamand travel internationally at short notice. The craft was created afterits predecessorwas destroyed in a confrontation withthe Joker. Batman made use of the Batwing after coming out of retirement to helpthe FlashfreeSupergirland battleGeneral Zod.

vehicles.name: Batboat_(Beware_the_Batman)
vehicles.description: TheBatboatis the water transportation used byBatmanand Katana. It only appeared in the comic book series based the TV series with the same name.

vehicles.name: Batboat_(Filmation)
vehicles.description: TheBatboatis the personal watercraft used by Batman and Robin.

vehicles.name: Final_Offer
vehicles.description: TheFinal Offeris a large ship owned by Penguin. It was stationed at Amusement Mile duringBatman: Arkham Origins. The ship's whereabouts after the incident was unknown.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Beware_the_Batman)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobileis the main road transportation used byBatmaninBeware the Batman.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Dozierverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobilewas the Dynamic Duo's main road transportation.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Filmation)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobileis the main road transportation used byBatmanandRobininThe Adventures of BatmanandThe New Adventures of Batman. It was the first Batmobile to appear in animation.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(The_New_Batman_Adventures)
vehicles.description: Batman's third Batmobile. It was shorter in length and wider than thesecond Batmobile, with a similar sliding visor cockpit.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Under_the_Red_Hood)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobileis Batman's primary source of transportation.

vehicles.name: Turbocharge_Tumbler
vehicles.description: Alfreduses this Tumbler to pick up Batman from a sewer after he was wounded by gunshots from a homeless man. It resembles the1989 Batmobilein this short, therefore it may well be a different vehicle entirely.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Batman_%26_Robin)
vehicles.description: ThatBatmobilewas the third known model that was used byBatmanin the feature film series.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Snyderverse)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobilewas a customized car used byBatmanin his operations. Presumably created by the vigilante, it was often used to patrol the streets and chase after criminals. The Batmobile was frequently used during Batman's operations involvingSupermanand theJustice League.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(The_Batman_Saga)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobile[1][2]was an armored muscle car used by theBatmanto traverseGotham Cityand chase criminals.

vehicles.name: Black_Tumbler
vehicles.description: ABlack Tumblerwas used byBatman.Tumblerswere a military prototype, off-road tank vehicles. Batman's black Tumbler came custom with an array of weapons and gadgets.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Telltale)
vehicles.description: TheBatmobilewasBatman's personal method of transportation. Developed by both the Dark Knight andLucius Fox, the car came equipped with multiple gadgets and equipment to aid Batman in fighting crime.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(Batman_&_Robin)
vehicles.description: ThatBatmobilewas the third known model that was used byBatmanin the feature film series.

vehicles.name: Batmobile_(The_Batman)
vehicles.description: In the animated seriesThe Batman, theBatmobileresembled a sports coupe with multiple jet exhaust slits protruding from the back bumper. When the first Batmobile wasn’t fast enough to stop the speed demon Gearhead (and also not able to be repaired after a massive accident), Batman upgraded his wheels with both a much faster engine and a far lighter chassis. With more speed behind him, Gearhead was no match for The Batman.

vehicles.name: Tumbler
vehicles.description: ABlack Tumblerwas used byBatman.Tumblerswere a military prototype, off-road tank vehicles. Batman's black Tumbler came custom with an array of weapons and gadgets.

vehicles.name: Bat-Gyro
vehicles.description: TheBatgyrowas first air-based vehicle used byBatmanin his operations. It was the first vehicle to bare abat-style, predating theBatmobile. The Batgyro served as a prototype for theBatplane, with it later abandoned in favor of both it and the similarBatcopters.

locations.name: Ace_Chemical_Processing_Plant
locations.description: TheAce Chemical Processing Plant(often referred to as"Ace Chemicals") is a chemical plant inGotham City. Located next to theMonarch Playing Card Company, it is often used as a hideout for criminals who use chemical weapons, primarily theJoker. Various accounts point to the plant as the place where the Clown Prince of Crime began, often due to falling into one of its mixing vats.

locations.name: Amusement_Mile
locations.description: Amusement Mileis an amusement park inGotham Cityfound along the city's waterfront.

locations.name: Arctic_World
locations.description: Arctic Worldwas a section at the abandonedOld Zoo. The underground pavilion served asPenguin's hideout. The exterior was adorned with a statue of a polar bear, and a skylight view of the massive cavernous exhibit. The waterways in the interior connected to large tunnels leading to theGothamsewer system.

locations.name: Arkham_Asylum
locations.description: TheElizabeth Arkham Asylum for the Criminally Insane, better known asArkham Asylum, is a psychiatric hospital north ofGotham City. It has featured prominently in the various continuities of the DC Multiverse. Depicted as a remote, labyrinthine stone facility, Arkham has housed many of Batman's most notorious foes, includingJoker,Riddler,Two-Face, and theScarecrow.Jeremiah Arkhamis the asylum's current director.

locations.name: Arkham_City
locations.description: The video gameBatman: Arkham Citytook place entirely in the new incarnation ofArkham Asylum,Arkham City(known asNorth Gothambefore the events of the game). A maximum security prison set in a walled-off district ofGotham City, Arkham City was located in Uptown Gotham with Amusement Mile, the Industrial District, Park Row, and the Bowery. After theJoker's takeover of the asylum which was thwarted by Batman, WardenQuincy Sharptook full credit for the Joker's defeat and was quickly elected as Mayor of Gotham.

locations.name: Bat_Building
locations.description: TheBat Buildingis a memorial building commissioned by theGotham CityCouncil to honor their savior. a plaque uner aBatgargoyle reads 'named for Gotham's Fearless Caped Crusader'

locations.name: Batcave
locations.description: TheBatcaveis the secret headquarters ofBatmanand the extendedBat-Family, consisting of a series of subterranean caves beneathWayne Manor. The most prominent tool in the Batcave is its famousCentral Computer Console, used daily by Batman to research and solve crimes.

locations.name: Batcave_(Arkham_Island)
locations.description: A major auxiliaryBatcavewas built onArkham Island, established just in case of a mass breakout at the facility's holding cells, which eventually occurred.

locations.name: Batcave_(Arkhamverse)
locations.description: TheBatcavewas an underground cave system that was located belowWayne Manorand was home toBatman.

locations.name: Batcave_(Columbia_serials)
locations.description: TheBatcaveis the underground headquarters ofBatmanandRobin, beneathWayne Manor. The entrance to the cave is through the Grandfather clock in Bruce's lounge room.

locations.name: Batcave_(Matsudaverse)
locations.description: The Batcave is located deep beneath Wayne Manor, and acts as The Batman's secret base of operations, holding all his equipment, vehicles, costumes and of course, The Batwave. Among the vast reaches of the cave include a trophy room, a gathering of souvenirs The Batman has collected since he began fighting crime, a lab and holding cells for anyone Batman feels is too dangerous to allow occupancy in Arkham or jail. The cave also has easy access to Wayne Manor. It includes acentral computer consoleand many relics on display from all the enemies that Batman defeats. There are many entrances toWayn...

locations.name: Belle_Reve_Penitentiary
locations.description: Belle Reve Penitentiaryis a prison and sanatorium facility used to contain metahuman criminals.

locations.name: Blackgate_Penitentiary
locations.description: Blackgate Penitentiaryis aGotham (State)prison traditionally located on a small island in the Gotham Bay.Batman: The Long Halloweensuggests that it was preceded by Gotham State Penitentiary, which appeared often in pre-Crisis comics.

locations.name: Blackgate_Prison_(Arkhamverse)
locations.description: Blackgate Prisonwas a key location in the story for the video game,Batman: Arkham Origins, as well as where the story of the video gameBatman: Arkham Origins Blackgatetook place. The prison was located on an island with five primary sectors: The Harbor to the east, the Industrial Sector, the Cell Blocks, the Administration Sector, and the Arkham Wing.

locations.name: Bl%C3%BCdhaven
locations.description: Blüdhavenis a city usually depicted as being geographically close toGotham City, about a two-hour drive away. It is where the heroNightwingmainly operates.

locations.name: Burnley
locations.description: The Burnley district appears on the official map of Gotham City and is shown to be located on Gotham City's nothern island. It is bordered byCrime Alleyand the Bowery to the east.

locations.name: Burnside
locations.description: Burnsideis aGotham Cityneighborhood located across theGotham River. In theNew 52,Barbara Gordonmoved there when she needed to take a break from Gotham. It first appeared in the 2014 comicBatgirl(Vol. 4) #35.

locations.name: Chicago
locations.description: Chicagois a midwestern city in the United States. It served as a filming location forGotham CityinBatman Begins,The Dark Knight,The Dark Knight Rises, andThe Batman. TheChicago Board of Trade Buildinghas often been used to representWayne Towerin live-action media, includingBatman Begins,Batwoman, andGotham Knights.

locations.name: City_Hall_(Arkhamverse)
locations.description: Gotham City Hallis a town hall located inGotham City. It is where elected officials and authorities make decisions based on events in Gotham. City Hall has been rebuilt several times due to destruction from criminals. It is usually located near theWayne Enterprisesbuilding.

locations.name: Cobblepot_Manor
locations.description: Cobblepot Manorwas the old mansion owned byTucker Cobblepot, somewhere nearGotham City. This is whereEsther Cobblepotgave birth toOswald Cobbplepot.

locations.name: Corto_Maltese
locations.description: The islands were mentioned to be the location of one of a number of Lexcorp '33.1' project labs that were located throughout the world.

locations.name: Crime_Alley
locations.description: Park Row, later calledCrime Alley, is a historical landmark inGotham Cityand was rather infamous for being the location where Bruce Wayne's parents Thomas and Martha were murdered, which started off Bruce's career as Batman.

locations.name: Evanstown
locations.description: Evanstown, also known asEvanston,[1]is a suburb ofGotham Cityand formally part ofSommerset Township. It is a located west of the city on the mainland and is mainly a middle-class community.[2]

locations.name: Falcone%27s_Bar
locations.description: Falcone's Barwas a bar inGotham Citythat served as the headquarters ofCarmine Falconeandhis thugs.

locations.name: Gotham_Botanical_Gardens
locations.description: Gotham Botanical Gardensis the botanical gardens inGotham City.

locations.name: Gotham_City
locations.description: Gotham Cityis the hometown ofBatmanand theBat-Family. Though it first appeared inDetective Comics#27, it was first identified byBill FingerinBatman#4(Winter 1940). Often depicted to be on theEast Seaboard of the United States, Gotham has changed depiction, including with the city geography and architecture. From the Bronze Age of Comics, Gotham's politics has often been depicted as having heavy ties to organized crime and corruption. Gotham itself has become a major location in the DC Universe, with many characters likeSuperman,Swamp Thing,Green Lanternsand theJLAvisiting the city on occasions...

locations.name: Gotham_City_Olympus
locations.description: TheGotham City Olympuswas a nightclub owned by the criminalMaxie Zeus.

locations.name: Gotham_City_Police_Department
locations.description: TheGotham City Police Department, often referred to as theGCPD, is the police department ofGotham City. Aside from a handful of recurring characters, such asHarvey Bullock,Sarah Essen,Renee Montoya, andJames Gordon, the department has a well-deserved reputation for being extraordinarily brutal and corrupt. It has alternatively supported or opposedBatmanover the course of his vigilante career, and their complicated relationship often varied depending on contemporary Gotham politics and outlook of individual commissioners.

locations.name: Gotham_City_Police_Headquarters
locations.description: TheGotham City Police Headquarters(also referred to asGCPD HQ) is the base of operations for theGotham City Police Department. Located inOld Gotham, it is used as the main hub for the police and where the commissioner's office is located. TheBat-Signalis often equipped on the Headquarters' rooftops, allowing the GCPD to callBatmanto help them.

locations.name: Gotham_City_Subway
locations.description: TheGotham City Subwayis the public transport system consisting of various rail lines and underground tunnels. Stretching across the city, it is often used by the public of Gotham to travel underground. However, due to neglecgence and route changes, various stations and lines throughout Gotham have been abandoned. Gotham's criminals have also set up bases within the subway.

locations.name: Gotham_General_Hospital
locations.description: Gotham General Hospitalis the most prominent health care institution inGotham City.

locations.name: Gotham_Harbor
locations.description: Gotham Harborwas a body of water that connectedGotham Cityto the Atlantic Ocean.

locations.name: Gotham_Museum_of_Art
locations.description: Gotham Museumis a multidisciplinary museum inGotham City.

locations.name: Gotham_Observatory
locations.description: TheGotham Observatoryis an astronomical research facility located on a hillside outside Gotham City.

locations.name: Gotham_State_Penitentiary
locations.description: Gotham State Penitentiaryis the prison located nearGotham City. It was often used to hold many ofBatman's enemies who were deemed legally sane. On bothEarth-TwoandEarth-One, the prison was often used as Gotham's main prison and correctional facility. However, the prison's usage has been taken up byBlackgate Penitentiaryafter the change over toNew Earth.

locations.name: Gotham_University
locations.description: TheGotham Universitywas the main institution for higher education and research on Gotham City.

locations.name: GothCorp
locations.description: GothCorp is one of the largest companies operating inGotham City.Dr. Victor Frieswas a brilliant scientist and cryonics expert working for GothCorp, but when his wifeNora Friescontracts a terminal illness, while Fries works on a freeze ray. Fries' boss decides to tell the mob about the gun, leadingBatmanto create a team of specialists to help him do his job better. Fries decides to use the device on Nora, to put her in cryo-stasis.

locations.name: Gracey%27s
locations.description: Gracey'sis a large department store in downtownGotham City. A criminal wearing a skelton mask and a Santa suit, wielding a pair of nunchucks attacked Christmas shoppers here.

locations.name: Hall_of_Records
locations.description: TheGotham Hall of Recordsis where thousands of documents and birth records related to the city's populace are stored. ThePenguinwanted access to this building to keep information on the first-born sons to privilege in the city, to eventually target them for murder. Completely unbeknownst to the public and even his conspiratorMax Shreck, who thought his dream in life was to find his parents and learn his family name.

locations.name: Haly%27s_Circus
locations.description: Haly's Circus travelled to Gotham City for a performance but were met by Gotham's then kingpin of crime, BossTony "Fats" Zucco. The circus owners refused to pay protection-money to Zucco and as a result, Zucco had his men cut the ropes of the Flying Grayson's no-net trapeze-act.

locations.name: Hedare_Beauty
locations.description: Hedare Beauty(also known asHedare Beauty Company,Hedare Beauty Corporation,Hedare CorporationandHedare Company) is an international beauty cosmetics conglomerate that is responsible for the creation of the toxic beauty cream known as Beau-Line and an antagonistic group in the 2004 movieCatwomanand the videogame adaptation of the same name. This snazzy, wealthy corporation was founded byGeorge Hedareand later run by his wifeLaurel.

locations.name: Hudson_University
locations.description: Hudson Universityis a location in the DC Universe. It was first mentioned inBatman#217 (December 1969). According to the Atlas of the DC Universe (published by Mayfair Games), it is located in the city of New Carthage, New York.

locations.name: Iceberg_Casino
locations.description: The casino is a secondary business run byOswald Cobblepotin theGotham Bayarea while theIceberg Loungeis located downtown.

locations.name: Iceberg_Lounge
locations.description: TheIceberg Loungeis a posh, trendyGotham Citynightclub, and is the base of operations for thePenguin.

locations.name: Indian_Hill
locations.description: Indian Hillis a research facility which acts as a division forWayne Enterprisesin the seriesGotham. It serves as one of the major story arcs in the second season, having been previously referenced to in the first season.

locations.name: Jezebel_Center
locations.description: Jezebel Center(also known asJezebel Plaza) was a shopping center inBatman: Arkham Origins,andBatman: Arkham City',that was located in the Bowery.

locations.name: Joker%27s_Funland
locations.description: Joker's Funlandwas the base of operations ofthe JokerandHarley Quinnwithin the confines ofArkham City. It was comprised of the formerIndustrial District, particularlyFalcone ShippingandSionis Industries.

locations.name: Kakure-Zato
locations.description: TheKakure-ZatoisTsunetomo's hidden village where he trains Shinobi warriors in Japan.Bruce Waynelearned to master his body here and survived being attacked by four ninja assassins at once.

locations.name: Lady_Gotham
locations.description: TheLady Gothamwas a large statue that overlookedGotham Harborand bore significant resemblance to theStatue of LibertyinNew York City. The head of the statue was partially damaged byTwo-Facewhen he locked his helicopter on course to collide with it in an attempt to killBatman.

locations.name: Lazarus_Pit
locations.description: Beyond him, however, Bane and Batman together also served an important role in the history of Lazarus Pits: the destruction of nearly all pits on Earth. Now while supposedly only one pit exists, there are actually four remaining. The first belongs toRa's al Ghul'sdaughterNyssa, who also discovered a way to use the pits indefinitely — whereas before a pit could only be used once. The second is located in theBatcave, created by Batman after he learned that the Pits were necessary to maintain the stability of the world, but wanting to ensure that Ra's could never use the pit to return from the de...

locations.name: Los_Angeles
locations.description: Los Angelesis a major metropolitan city located in the state ofCalifornia,USA.

locations.name: Markovia
locations.description: Former nazi, "Baron Bedlam" took over the nation and killed its monarch, King Viktor. During this incident,Wayne IndustriesCEOLucius Foxwas visiting the nation and was taken prisoner by Baron Bedlam. Fox's allyBatmanlearned that he was taken captive and pushed for theJustice Leagueto attack and free the nation from the nazi, only for the Justice League to refuse out of diplomacy. Angered, Batman quit the Justice League and founded his own superhero team called, "The Outsiders" to liberate Markovia.

locations.name: Mercey_Island
locations.description: Mercey Islandis a triangle-shaped island in the northern part ofGotham City. It is known as the second location ofArkham Asylumafter the original asylum inSommerseton the mainland was destroyed duringKnightfall.

locations.name: Metropolis
locations.description: Metropoliswas a fictional major metropolitan city located in the state of Delaware,USA. It is best known as the home ofSuperman.

locations.name: Monarch_Theatre
locations.description: TheMonarch Theatreis an abandoned movie theatre/cinema located inGotham City'sPark Rowdistrict. The theatre was visited by the Wayne family prior toThomasandMartha Wayne's murder. The theatre has often served as a hideout for some ofBatman's theatrical enemies, includingthe Joker.

locations.name: My_Alibi
locations.description: My AlibiBar and Grillis a seedy underworld bar near the outskirts ofGotham City. It was frequented by small-time hoods, petty criminals, and failed supervillains, who met there to look for work or trade gossip. Regular patrons ofMy AlibiincludedKiller Moth, thePolka-Dot Man, andFirefly.Batmanoften visited the bar in the guise ofMatches Malone.

locations.name: New_Jersey
locations.description: New Jersey, abbreviated to NJ, is located on the East Coast of the U.S. Southern New Jersey is home to one of the country's most infamous localesGotham City.

locations.name: New_York_City
locations.description: New York Cityis a major metropolitan city located in the state ofNew York,USA. Its Wall Street served as a filming location forThe Dark Knight Rises. In the DC Universe, New York City is the home of Firestorm and theTeen Titans.

locations.name: Old_Gotham
locations.description: Old Gotham Cityis a large architectural scheme for Gotham City designed byCyrus Pinkneyand promoted by JudgeSolomon Wayne.

locations.name: Old_Wayne_Tower
locations.description: Old Wayne Towerwas the tallest building in Gotham (pre earthquake). Part of a larger architectural scheme forOld Gothamdesigned byCyrus Pinkneyand promoted by JudgeSolomon Wayne.

locations.name: Old_Zoo
locations.description: TheOld Gotham City Zoowas located within the overallGotham Parkarea ofGotham City. It was closed down and abandoned thirty years prior toBatman's emergence in Gotham. ThePenguin's returned here in adulthood and set up a base of operations in theArctic World Pavilion, where he was raised a small child. The entire site ended up being destroyed by the missiles from thePenguin Commandos.

locations.name: Paektu_Dojang
locations.description: A mysterious remote dojang whereMaster Kirigiresides, located on the North Korean side of the Paektu mountain range.Bruce Wayne,Minhkhoa KhanandBen Turnerall studied martial arts here.

locations.name: Pe%C3%B1a_Duro
locations.description: Peña Duro, is an infamous prison located inSanta Prisca, a Caribbean country in the DC Comics universe. It was where theBatmanvillain known asBanewas born and raised. Inmates of the prison were also used as test subject for the steroidVenom.

locations.name: Powers_Tech
locations.description: Powers Technologyalternatively known asPowers International, Powers CorpandWayne-Powers Enterprisesor theWayne-Powers Corporationin future timelines is a technology company defined by it's rivalry withWayne Enterprises. The company first-appeared in the seriesBatman Beyondas being a recurring enemy toTerry McGinnis. Since then it has been introduced in mainstream comics during the New 52.

locations.name: R.F._Schreck_Criminal_Holding_Facility
locations.description: TheR.F. Schreck Criminal Holding Facilityis a detention area used by theGCPD. The detainees are kept in holding cells here before their court date. It is often referred to as simply "The Shreck.'

locations.name: R.H._Kane_Building
locations.description: TheR.H. Kane Buildingis a multi-story apartment complex inGotham City. It is owned by the Kane family and was named in honor of Robert H. Kane.

locations.name: Rallstone_Castle
locations.description: Rallstone Castlewas the palatial estate ofThomas Rallstonelocated inGotham County. It became the home of avampirecult led by Niccolai Tepes.

locations.name: Robinson_Park
locations.description: Robinson Parkis a public park located inGotham City. Usually depicted as part of its midtown island, it contains one of the city's reservoirs and botanical gardens. Robinson Park has often served as a hideout or place of operations forPoison Ivy, who has used it as her domain.

locations.name: S.T.A.R._Labs
locations.description: Science and Technology Advanced Research LaboratoriesorS.T.A.R. Labs, is a research facility. They first appeared inSupermanvol. 1 #246in December 1971, and was created byLen WeinandCurt Swan.

locations.name: Santa_Prisca
locations.description: Santa Priscais a fictional Latin American island country, located in the northeastern Caribbean. Renowned in the Batman mythos for rampant political corruption and an equally infamous prison,Peña Duro, it has also been remembered as the birthplace ofBane.

locations.name: Selina_Kyle%27s_apartment
locations.description: Over the years,Selina Kyle, also known as Catwoman, has resided in a variety ofapartments. They are often used as her permanent hideouts, with hidden areas used to hide her costume and equipment, and access to the rooftops. Most of them are located withinGotham City, usually in or near theEast Endof the city.

locations.name: Slaughter_Swamp
locations.description: The Slaughter Swampis a paranormal wetland region found inSommerseton the outskirts ofGotham City. It is best known for its role in the birth ofSolomon Grundy, with its waters and plant-life bonding to Grundy's corpse to resurrect him as an undead behemoth.

locations.name: Solomon_Wayne_Courthouse
locations.description: TheSolomon Wayne Courthousewas the base of operations for bothAnarkyinBatman: Arkham OriginsandTwo-FaceinBatman: Arkham City.

locations.name: Sommerset_Township
locations.description: Sommerset Townshipis a civil township inGotham County, New Jersey. It is located on the mainland northwest ofGotham Cityand includes several suburban communities likeEvanstownandLittle Stockton.

locations.name: Statue_of_Justice
locations.description: TheStatue of Justiceis a giant sculpture that overlooks theGotham dock areaand is located on a small island in Gotham's bay. It is a statue of a robed woman and theGotham Cityequivalent of theStatue of LibertyinNew York Citywhich it closely resembles.

locations.name: The_Belfry
locations.description: The Belfryis one of the secret headquarters forBatmanand theBat-Family. Created in theOld Wayne Tower, it was constructed by Bruce Wayne andTim Drakefor the group to operate out of.

locations.name: United_States_of_America
locations.description: TheUnited States of Americais a country with fifty states and a federal district. It was the land ofGotham City'slocation.

locations.name: Wayne_Foundation_Building
locations.description: TheWayne Foundation Buildingis a major location at the center ofGotham City. It served as the main headquarters for both theWayne FoundationandWayne Enterprises. WhenDick Graysonleft for Hudson University,Bruce Waynemoved to a penthouse atop the building, moving most of his equipment to a hidden basement area located under the building.

locations.name: Wayne_Manor
locations.description: Wayne Manoris the stately residence of billionaireBruce Wayne, secretly Batman. Under all the expensive china and bookcases, it also serves to hide the massive underground cave used as Batman's base of operations, theBatcave.

locations.name: Wayne_Manor_(Arkhamverse)
locations.description: Wayne Manorwas the home ofBruce Wayne. Wayne Manor also housed theBatcave, located deep below Wayne Manor that Bruce found when he was a young boy.

locations.name: Wayne_Tower
locations.description: Wayne Toweris the headqauters ofWayne EnterprisesorWayne Industries, depending on the writer.

locations.name: What_a_Way_to_Go-Go
locations.description: TheWhat a Way to Go-Gowas a nightclub inGotham City.

locations.name: Willowood
locations.description: Willowood, depending on the continuity known asWillowood Asylum,Willowwood Sanitarium,Willowood Orphangeor theWillowwood Home for Childrenis a location in theGotham Cityarea. Willowood is most commonly affiliated with being a dark location connected to theWayne family's secrets.

locations.name: Wonder_City
locations.description: Wonder City(also identified asOld Gotham) was an abandoned city that was located below North Gotham City which housed one ofRa's al Ghul'sLazarus Pits. It was an actual city while Ra's developed the Lazarus Pit. Ra's eventually returned to Wonder City to replenish himself from the pit and planned the events that took shape inBatman: Arkham City.

locations.name: Wonder_Tower
locations.description: Centuries before the events withinArkham City, the legendaryWonder Citywas built byRa's al Ghulin effort to purgeGotham Cityfrom the plague of crime. After Wonder City's completion, Ra's began to work on his crown jewel: Wonder Tower. Standing high above Wonder City was the great tower, a monument of prosperity, but it was also part of Ra's' experiments with a life-replenishing compound that he later namedLazarus.

locations.name: Wayne_Enterprises
locations.description: Wayne Enterprises(formerlyWayneCorp) is a company in the DC Universe. Wayne Enterprises is owned by billionaireBruce Wayneand run by his business managerLucius Fox. It was founded by merchant ancestors of the Wayne family in the 17th century as a merchant house. It changed and gradually grew when it was officially erected in the 19th century when Alan Wayne, heir to Solomon Wayne, founded Wayne Shipping and Wayne Chemical. Along with Wayne Manufacturing, which came later, the Industrial Revolution fueled Wayne Enterprises into becoming a major powerhouse. In addition to providing an income for...

locations.name: Ace_Chemicals
locations.description: TheAce Chemical Processing Plant(often referred to as"Ace Chemicals") is a chemical plant inGotham City. Located next to theMonarch Playing Card Company, it is often used as a hideout for criminals who use chemical weapons, primarily theJoker. Various accounts point to the plant as the place where the Clown Prince of Crime began, often due to falling into one of its mixing vats.

locations.name: Blackgate_Prison
locations.description: Blackgate Penitentiaryis aGotham (State)prison traditionally located on a small island in the Gotham Bay.Batman: The Long Halloweensuggests that it was preceded by Gotham State Penitentiary, which appeared often in pre-Crisis comics.

locations.name: City_Hall
locations.description: Gotham City Hall first appeared inThe Dark Knight. It housedMayor Garcia'soffice.

locations.name: Gotham_City_Hall
locations.description: Gotham City Hall first appeared inThe Dark Knight. It housedMayor Garcia'soffice.

locations.name: Park_Row
locations.description: Park Row, later calledCrime Alley, is a historical landmark inGotham Cityand was rather infamous for being the location where Bruce Wayne's parents Thomas and Martha were murdered, which started off Bruce's career as Batman.

locations.name: The_Narrows
locations.description: The Narrowsis an island in the middle of the Finger River, situated between Midtown and Downtown Gotham City.

locations.name: East_End
locations.description: TheEast Endis a district located inGotham City. It is located on the north island as one of the poorer districts, with heavy crime rates and activities such as mugging, prostitution and drug trade. Its most prominent location is "Crime Alley", the alleyway whereBruce Wayne's parentsThomasandMartha Waynewere murdered byJoe Chill, an event which started off his career as Batman.

locations.name: Gotham_Cathedral
locations.description: Gotham Cathedralwas a condemned church inGotham City. The highest point in the city's skyline at 800 feet tall, it is instantly recognizable towering over all other buildings.

locations.name: Gotham_Clock_Tower
locations.description: Gotham clock tower is a building in Batman universe.

locations.name: Gotham_Subway
locations.description: TheGotham City Subwayis the public transport system consisting of various rail lines and underground tunnels. Stretching across the city, it is often used by the public of Gotham to travel underground. However, due to neglecgence and route changes, various stations and lines throughout Gotham have been abandoned. Gotham's criminals have also set up bases within the subway.

locations.name: Gotham_Underground
locations.description: Gotham Undergroundis a series of comics in which the gangs of Gotham try to fill the gap with the death of the Black Mask. Bruce Wayne is posing as a criminal under the name 'Matches Malone'. This means that Nightwing and Robin (helped byThe Oracle) are on their own.

locations.name: Gotham_Sewers
locations.description: Gotham Sewersis the underwater sewage system under Gotham City.

locations.name: Stacked_Deck
locations.description: TheStacked Deckis a bar and pool hall locatedGotham City. Depending on the writer, it is located either inOtisburg,Park Rowor theGotham Harbor. It was regularly visited by members of the criminal underworld, includingthe JokerandCatwoman.Batmanhimself also visits the Stacked Deck, usuallyin disguise.

locations.name: Gotham_Stock_Exchange
locations.description: TheGotham Stock Exchangeis a large stock exchange located inGotham City, shown inThe Dark Knight Rises.

locations.name: Gotham_Gazette
locations.description: TheGotham Gazetteis a metropolitan newspaper based out of Gotham City with nation-wide syndication.

locations.name: Old_Gotham_Cathedral
locations.description: Gotham Cathedralwas a condemned church inGotham City. The highest point in the city's skyline at 800 feet tall, it is instantly recognizable towering over all other buildings.

storylines.name: Batman_%26_Son
storylines.description: After returning from a trip across the world with Nightwing and Robin, Batman meets his alleged son, Damian al Ghul, who's mother is Ra's al Ghul's daughter, Talia al Ghul. Damian lives with the Dark Knight for a while, expressing his interest in replacing Tim Drake as Robin.
storylines.simple_summary: After returning from a trip across the world with Nightwing and Robin, Batman meets his alleged son, Damian al Ghul, who's mother is Ra's al Ghul's daughter, Talia al Ghul. Damian lives with the Dark Knight for a while, expressing his interest in replacing Tim Drake as Robin.

storylines.name: Batman_R.I.P.
storylines.description: Batman R.I.P.is a graphic novel containing the story arc originally printed in DC Comic issues #676-683. In 2009 it was reprinted in a deluxe hardcover edition.
storylines.simple_summary: Batman R.I.P.is a graphic novel containing the story arc originally printed in DC Comic issues #676-683. In 2009 it was reprinted in a deluxe hardcover edition.

storylines.name: Battle_for_the_Cowl
storylines.description: In the aftermath of the apparent death ofBatman,Gotham Citybecomes the site of a three-way war asTwo-Face, ThePenguin, andBlack Maskstruggle for dominance. With theGotham City Police Departmentcrumbling under the pressure, the Bat Family calls in help, all the while struggling to determine the answer to the big question: who will assume the mantle of the Bat?
storylines.simple_summary: In the aftermath of the apparent death ofBatman,Gotham Citybecomes the site of a three-way war asTwo-Face, ThePenguin, andBlack Maskstruggle for dominance

storylines.name: Final_Crisis
storylines.description: However, Darkseid had underestimated the resolve of Batman. Recognizing Darkseid's existence as a threat, Batman made a once-in-a-lifetime exception and used a gun to fire the radion bullet Darkseid had used to kill Orion. Darkseid was hit with the radion bullet, but not before he unleashed the Omega Sanction, the "death that is life", upon Batman. Superman then returned to New Earth, breaking through Darkseid's forces and finding what appeared to be Batman's corpse. As Darkseid mocked his old enemy and fired the bullet that killed Orion, Barry Allen and Wally West lead the Black Racer to Darkseid, who removed his soul from Dan Turpin. Superman allied with the Secret Society under Lex Luthor and Doctor Sivana, managing to break the Anti-Life Equation's hold over Wonder Woman, who in turn b...
storylines.simple_summary: Recognizing Darkseid's existence as a threat, Batman made a once-in-a-lifetime exception and used a gun to fire the radion bullet Darkseid had used to kill Orion. Darkseid was hit with the radion bullet, but not before he unleashed the Omega Sanction, the "death that is life", upon Batman. Superman then returned to New Earth, breaking through Darkseid's forces and finding what appeared to be Batman's corpse. As Darkseid mocked his old enemy and fired the bullet that killed Orion, Barry Allen and...

storylines.name: Judgment_on_Gotham
storylines.description: Judgment on Gothamis a 2011 comic book story arc that ran through monthly series. The story depicts Azrael, as he sees Gotham City as the modern day Sodom and Gomorrah, and they only way to purify the city from its sins is to destroy it. But standing in Azrael's way will be the likes of Dick Grayson, Tim Drake and Selina Kyle.
storylines.simple_summary: Judgment on Gothamis a 2011 comic book story arc that ran through monthly series. The story depicts Azrael, as he sees Gotham City as the modern day Sodom and Gomorrah, and they only way to purify the city from its sins is to destroy it. But standing in Azrael's way will be the likes of Dick Grayson, Tim Drake and Selina Kyle.

storylines.name: Knightfall
storylines.description: "Knightfall"is a story arc published from April 1993 to August 1994. The series coversBruce Wayne's defeat byBaneandJean-Paul Valleybecoming the new Dark Knight. The series has been subsequently republished a trilogy of storylines with "KnightQuest" and "KnightsEnd".
storylines.simple_summary: "Knightfall"is a story arc published from April 1993 to August 1994. The series coversBruce Wayne's defeat byBaneandJean-Paul Valleybecoming the new Dark Knight. The series has been subsequently republished a trilogy of storylines with "KnightQuest" and "KnightsEnd".

storylines.name: The_Penguin_Affair
storylines.description: The Penguin Affairis a Batman and Detective Comics comic book story arc first published in the early 1990s. It ran inBatman#448-449andDetective Comics #615, published in 1990.
storylines.simple_summary: The Penguin Affairis a Batman and Detective Comics comic book story arc first published in the early 1990s. It ran inBatman#448-449andDetective Comics #615, published in 1990.

storylines.name: Batman_Incorporated
storylines.description: Batman Incorporatedwas a global non-profit organization publicly funded byWayne EnterprisesandBruce Wayne.  The group selects vigilantes from across the world to train and supply for crime-fighting purposes while also making them swear oaths.
storylines.simple_summary: Batman Incorporatedwas a global non-profit organization publicly funded byWayne EnterprisesandBruce Wayne. The group selects vigilantes from across the world to train and supply for crime-fighting purposes while also making them swear oaths.

storylines.name: Batman:_Year_One
storylines.description: Batman: Year Oneis the title of a Batman comicstory arcwritten byFrank Miller, illustrated byDavid Mazzucchelliand colored byRichmond Lewis. It originally appeared in issues #404 to #407 ofDC'sBatmancomic title in 1987. It is one of the first examples of the "limited series within a series" format that is now prevalent in American comic books, with the intent of future printings intrade paperbacks.
storylines.simple_summary: Batman: Year Oneis the title of a Batman comicstory arcwritten byFrank Miller, illustrated byDavid Mazzucchelliand colored byRichmond Lewis. It originally appeared in issues #404 to #407 ofDC'sBatmancomic title in 1987. It is one of the first examples of the "limited series within a series" format that is now prevalent in American comic books, with the intent of future printings intrade paperbacks.

storylines.name: The_Killing_Joke
storylines.description: Batman: The Killing Jokeis a "prestige edition"  one-shot written byAlan Moore, drawn byBrian Bollandwith colors byJohn Higgins. First published by DC in 1988, it has continuously been held in print since then.
storylines.simple_summary: Batman: The Killing Jokeis a "prestige edition" one-shot written byAlan Moore, drawn byBrian Bollandwith colors byJohn Higgins. First published by DC in 1988, it has continuously been held in print since then.

storylines.name: The_Dark_Knight_Returns
storylines.description: Batman: The Dark Knight#1, more commonly referred to as"The Dark Knight Returns", is the first issue ofFrank Miller'sBatman: The Dark Knightcomic miniseries. The issue followsBatman'sreturn after ten years retirement.
storylines.simple_summary: Batman: The Dark Knight#1, more commonly referred to as"The Dark Knight Returns", is the first issue ofFrank Miller'sBatman: The Dark Knightcomic miniseries. The issue followsBatman'sreturn after ten years retirement.

organizations.name: The_Agency
organizations.description: The Agencyis the public face of a shadow committee, consisting of military leaders, intelligence experts, and government officials. It is currently under control byAmanda Waller. In order to capturethe Pact, the organization would work with the vigilanteBatmanto capture the group.

organizations.name: Batmen
organizations.description: The"Batmen", or theBatmen Militia, were a group of people who were inspired byBatmanto fight crime and corruption inGotham City. Members of the party had suffered injustice and decided to follow in Batman's footsteps, albeit with the contrasting intention of murdering criminals instead of apprehending them to the proper authorities, which is presumably why Batman refuses their assistance and has them arrested. Noted members includedAntonand the former GCPD officer,Brian Douglas.

organizations.name: Black_Glove
organizations.description: The Black Gloveis a criminal organization of wealthy hedonists lead byDoctor Hurt. They meet at-least once a year to place bets the deaths of a third party.

organizations.name: Carmine_Falcone%27s_Thugs
organizations.description: After Falcone's mental decline from being injected with Crane'sfear toxin,Sal Maronitook over the Falcone Family, and all of Falcone's remaining thugs joined up with him.

organizations.name: Children_of_Arkham
organizations.description: TheChildren of Arkhamwere a political group turned terrorist organization led byLady Arkham. Comprising of both mercenaries and victims of Gotham's criminals, their goals were to expose corruption in Gotham, get revenge on the responsible parties and bring the city under their control. The group was the first threat faced byBatman.

organizations.name: Club_of_Villains
organizations.description: The Club of Villainsis a team of super-villains from around the world assembled byDr. Simon Hurtto defeatBatman, theOutsidersandBatman Incorporatedwhile acting as a task-force for theBlack Glove. Their ranks are made up of villains who act as foils to theBatmen of All-Nation's with their name being a play onThe Club of Heroeswhich was the group of Batmen's name. They first appeared inBatman #676in the June of 2008.

organizations.name: Court_of_Owls
organizations.description: Bruce dismissed the possibility that the fabled Court of Owls exists, not thinking them much of the threat. He refused to entertain the notion that there was some ancient organization pulling the strings of Gotham, as he believed no one knows the city better than he does. However, during a meeting with Gotham mayoral candidateLincoln March, he was warned by Lincoln that an ancient evil has come back to Gotham, awakened by the ambitious new plans for the city that Bruce had been promoting. Almost immediately,Talonburst from an elevator, leaving two deceased security guards in his wake. After pl...

organizations.name: Court_of_Owls_(Gotham_Knights)
organizations.description: The Court of Owlswere a secret society operating in Gotham City. Consisting of the city's most powerful and influential families, they were heavily involved in its history and development, utilizing their shared resources and undeadTalon assassins. Most members sought to extend their life spans through various means, drawing them into conflict with theLeague of Shadows. The Court's existence was a major factor inBatman'sfinal case and the subsequent investigations by thehis proteges.

organizations.name: Falcone_Crime_Family
organizations.description: The Falcone Crime Family, also known asThe Roman Empire, was the untouchable criminal empire headed byCarmine Falcone. It dominated the criminal underworld prior toBatman's crusade and was often cited as the source of Gotham's corrupt political structure. During Batman's first years, the Falcone Crime Family would fall into decline due to both the actions of the vigilante and his allies, and the rise of various supervillains in the city.

organizations.name: False_Face_Society
organizations.description: TheFalse Face Society(also known asThe False Facersas well as theSionis Crime Family) are a criminal organization inGotham Citywhich revolve their modus operandi around wearing masks. The team is presumably named after an unrelated Iroquois medicinal society. They first appeared inBatman #152in the December of 1962 and were created byBill FingerandSheldon Moldoff.

organizations.name: First_Families_of_Gotham
organizations.description: By the 2010s, apparently only three of the five original families would be staying strong. The Wayne family was still highly successful due toWayne Enterprisesand its patriarch,Bruce WayneAKABatman. The Kanes were still powerful thanks to their own businesses and having combined with the Waynes with the marriage of Bruce's parentsThomas WayneandMartha Kane; most notably the matriarch of the Kane family would beKatherine Kane AKA Batwoman. The Cobblepots on the other hand would survive predominately through criminal means thanks to the empire of oneOswald "The Penguin" Cobblepot.

organizations.name: Gotham_City_Police_Department_(Gotham_Knights)
organizations.description: TheGotham City Police Departmentis an allied faction inGotham Knights. Once allied to theBatman Family, relations between them ceased after the death ofCommissioner James Gordonand the result of building corruption in the department. AfterBatman's apparent death, the vigilantes once again begin a working relationship withCpt. Renee Montoya.

organizations.name: Gotham_City_SWAT_(Nolanverse)
organizations.description: SWAT first acted when Scarecrow's base under Arkham Asylum was discovered by Batman. Scarecrow had the police brought over to the asylum and SWAT was called for back up. They were going through the asylum when they were stunned by the swarm of bats used by Batman. Gotham SWAT was called in for security whenRa's al Ghuland hisLeague of Shadowsbegan their assault onGotham City'sNarrowsdistrict.

organizations.name: Haly%27s_Circus
organizations.description: Haly's Circusis the circus thatDick Graysonand his family theFlying Graysonstoured with up until the Grayson parents' deaths.

organizations.name: Hockey_Thugs
organizations.description: The Hockey Thugs used used chrome hockey sticks for weapons, the toe and heel area was a razor blade and doubled as a scythe. They outfitted themselves in hockey gear and other assorted custom armor and raggedy thermal material. It seems likely that they may be a disgraced hockey team, withFrostybeing their former coach andMs. B. Haven, a loyal cheerleader.

organizations.name: Joker%27s_Thugs_(The_Dark_Knight)
organizations.description: The Joker employed three bounty hunters to bring him toGambol, pretending to have been killed by them, and laying lifeless in a bag. The Joker then viciously murdered Gambol. With Gambol's men on the floor, and the bounty hunters aiming handguns to their heads, the Joker informed Gambol's men that he had opened tryouts for his new gang. He snapped a pool cue in half and dropped one half on the floor, then ordered his enforcers to be quick, hinting that he intended for Gambol's men to fight to the death until the sole survivor joins Joker's team.

organizations.name: Justice_Society_of_America
organizations.description: TheJustice Society of Americais the world's first superhero team. On the world of Earth-Two (prior to the history-altering Crisis on Infinite Earths),Batmanwas a member.

organizations.name: League_of_Assassins_(Beware_the_Batman)
organizations.description: TheLeague of Assassinsis a secretive international criminal organization consisting of highly trained ninja warriors.

organizations.name: League_of_Shadows
organizations.description: TheLeague of Shadowswas an international organization led byRa's al Ghulin the filmBatman Begins, and later by his daughterTaliainThe Dark Knight Rises.

organizations.name: Major_Crimes_Unit_(Nolanverse)
organizations.description: Out of all nineBatmanfilms, the Christopher Nolan series prominently featured the GCPD with aSWATteam mostly because of the series' realistic tone. (However, GCPD vehicles bear only the letters "GPD".)

organizations.name: Maroni_Crime_Family
organizations.description: TheMaroni Crime Familywas a crime family operating inGotham City.

organizations.name: National_Guard
organizations.description: TheUnited States National Guard(often referred to as theNational Guard) are a branch of the US Government. Often comprising of reserved soldier for theUS Armyor US Air Force, it is often deployed to deal with situations on US soil, often riots or heavy street violence. The National Guard has sometimes played a role in stories related toBatmanand theBat-Family.

organizations.name: NygmaTech
organizations.description: TheNygmaTechCorporation was a company that was located inGotham Cityand was founded by Edward Nygma, A.K.A. theRiddler.

organizations.name: Order_of_St._Dumas
organizations.description: A splinter group of the Order created a new champion calledAzrael, a hereditary title given to the splinter order's near-superhuman enforcer and assassin. Members of the splinter order enlarged the organization's power by killing their enemies, hoarding knowledge and kidnapping some of the greatest thinkers in the world. The order also spread disinformation to ensure that the theories of the kidnapped geniuses would look so silly that nobody would miss them or examine their research. The most recent Azrael, Jean-Paul Valley, eventually destroyed the splinter group.

organizations.name: The_Pact
organizations.description: The Pactconsists of some of the most notorious and dangerous criminals in the world that were assembled to unite againstthe Agency. Initially led by a veteran criminal known only as"the Riddler", the Pact searched for anexperimental restorative agenthidden withinGotham. The group's arrival foreshadowed darker days, particularly forBatmanand theGotham City Police Department.

organizations.name: Red_Hood_Gang
organizations.description: The Red HoodGangis a defunct criminal-organization inGotham Cityaffiliated with theRed Hood.

organizations.name: Red_Triangle_Gang
organizations.description: The group began to operate as a criminal operation using Gotham's sewer tunnels. They started to appear afterJoker's defeat, perhaps taking some inspiration.Commissioner Gordonand Batman began to gradually take note of their increasing activity before theLighting of the Tree Ceremony, at which they launched a theatrical attack on the crowd. The circus gang emerged from an oversized gift box in the middle ofGotham Plazaand starting terrorizing the crowd with gunfire and torch jugglers. TheOrgan Grinderdestroyed the lights and ornaments on the tree using an old-fashionedgatling gunhidden in a mu...

organizations.name: Religion_of_Crime
organizations.description: The Religion of Crime, also known as the Dark Faith, is an old, secret organization that follows the word of the Crime Bible and its lessons of deceit, greed, lust and murder.

organizations.name: SANCTUS
organizations.description: SANCTUSis a former division ofthe Agency, in charge of experimentation and research into new weapons for the organization. After seemingly being shut down, the organization continued to operate in secret. They are responsible for the creation of a biological weapon known asProject LOTUS, which became the target for a group of criminals calledthe Pact.

organizations.name: Talons
organizations.description: Throughout the Court of Owls' existence there has always been the Talons sect, a loyal group of lethal assassins that serve The Court. They are sent out when The Court of Owls feels that their existence or goals are being threatened. The Talons are first mentioned in the oldGotham Citynursery rhyme story about the Court of Owls; in this old story a figure is simply known as Talon. There have been many different Talons throughout the existence of the Court of Owls, but it is not known exactly who these assassins are- only that they are known by one name: The Talon.

organizations.name: TYGER_Security
organizations.description: Ultimately, TYGER's poor imagination and emphasis on inflexible tactics allowed Batman and his allies to outwit its units with unconventional thinking. This was most amply demonstrated by the organization's obsession with specifics - such as naively insisting that Batman traveled along mapped routes with no deviation from earlier observed patterns - while failing to develop even basic contingencies for what happened when said deviation occurred. During their initial engagements, it took Batman only about four minutes to defeat three companies of TYGER troops.[4]

organizations.name: United_Underworld
organizations.description: TheUnited Underworldis an evil organization that is formed in theBatmanspinoff movie.

organizations.name: Wayne_Enterprises_(Nolanverse)
organizations.description: When Bruce finally returned to Gotham, he did not show obvious interest in reclaiming the family business. Instead, he chose to work in the Applied Sciences Division, and used it and his coworker,Lucius Fox, to provide him with high-tech equipment. Bruce took gear that was originally made for the U.S. Military, includingbody armorand aprototype armored vehicle, and used them to create the equipment that he needed for his war on crime. BeforeRa's al Ghul's attack on Gotham, Earle transitioned Wayne Enterprises' in a public corporation to increase his financial gain.

organizations.name: Bat-Family
organizations.description: TheBat-Family[1]is a network of crimefighters who operate in and aroundGotham City. Nearly all members trained directly underBruce Wayne. These include theBirds of Preywho operate out of theClock Towerand thethe Belfry.

organizations.name: Bat-Family_(Gotham_Knights)
organizations.description: TheBat-Familyis a crime-fighting organization operating inGotham City. Founded byBruce Wayne / Batman, they continued to operate after their leader's death. Its membership includedDick Grayson / Nightwing,Barbara Gordon / Batgirl,Jason Todd / Red HoodandTim Drake / Robin.

organizations.name: Batman_Incorporated
organizations.description: Batman Incorporatedwas a global non-profit organization publicly funded byWayne EnterprisesandBruce Wayne. The group selects vigilantes from across the world to train and supply for crime-fighting purposes while also making them swear oaths.

organizations.name: Batmen_of_All_Nations
organizations.description: The Batmen of All Nationsalso known as theClub of Heroesand theInternational Club of Heroesis an international team of vigilantes lead byBatmanwhich consists of vigilantes who were inspired or otherwise take influence from Batman.

organizations.name: Cluemaster%27s_minions
organizations.description: They areCluemaster's old football teamand currently hisminions.

organizations.name: Court_of_Owls_(DC_Animated_Movie_Universe)
organizations.description: TheCourt of Owlswas a secret organization dating hundreds of years back inGotham City. After a fallout with their secret assassin,Talon, every member was murdered. The members of the Court all wear owl masks to cover their faces.

organizations.name: Crime_Syndicate
organizations.description: The Crime Syndicatealso known as theCrime Syndicate of America,Crime Syndicate of Amerika, and theCrime Societyis a fictional supervillain team of DC Comics. It is one of the DC's parallel universe where the evil counterparts ofJustice Leaguewho they often fight.

organizations.name: The_False_Face_Society_(Batman_Adventures)
organizations.description: TheFalse Face Societyis a DCAU criminal organization consisting of mostly masked supervillains, led byBlack Maskand based on the comic-booksyndicate of the same name. Additionally, The False Face Society was unknowingly in the employ of theRed Hood, the actual founder of the organization.

organizations.name: Flying_Graysons_(Schumacherverse)
organizations.description: TheFlying Graysonswere the acrobatsJohn,Mary,Mitch, andDick Grayson. They were a family of traveling acrobats who performed a trapeze act in a circus.

organizations.name: The_Ghosts
organizations.description: The Ghostsare a small time criminal group that took over the part ofGotham Cityknown as the Cauldron.

organizations.name: Kobra_Cult
organizations.description: Originally a cult in an underreported part of the world, Kobra had a prophecy that one day someone would lead them to greatness. Finding this someone as one of a set of twins, they selected one at random and took him to be raised by them. This baby, named Jeffrey Burr by his parents, grew to be a formidable warrior and a criminal mastermind. As he took control of the organization, he was awarded the title "Naga Naga". Under Burr, Kobra began using cutting-edge science to fulfill it ultimate goal of bringing about the Kali Yuga the Age of Chaos, in which the imperfect world will be swept away b...

organizations.name: League_of_Assassins_(DC_Animated_Universe)
organizations.description: TheLeague of Assassinswas a formidable global organization founded and led by Ra's al Ghul.

organizations.name: League_of_the_New_Order
organizations.description: TheLeague of the New Orderis a group of dishonored business men.

organizations.name: Legion_of_Doom
organizations.description: The Legion of Doomis the name of a team of super-villains in the DC universe which often includes a large sum ofBatmanVillains.

organizations.name: Man-Bat_Commandos
organizations.description: TheNinja Man-Batsare a group within theLeague of Assassinswho use Man-Bat Serum to turn themselves into monsters. They are led byTalia.

organizations.name: Miagani
organizations.description: The Miagani tribe itself did not survive to the 20th century, destroyed in the making of the modern Gotham City on the gravesite of Doctor Gotham possibly by Blackfire. Still, their cave remained, along with their holistic object, the Batsuit that Batman had worn when he shot Darkseid. All that remained was their descendants, Batman, and his family.

organizations.name: Outlaws
organizations.description: The Outlaws, sometimes referred to as theDark Trinity, are a team of violent vigilantes lead byJason Todd'sRed Hood.

organizations.name: Outsiders
organizations.description: The Outsiders form in the fictional Eastern European country of Markovia. Batman and Black Lightning have traveled there in order to free the captive Lucius Fox from Baron Bedlam, who has killed the country's king, King Viktor. Geo-Force himself is the prince of the country who gains powers from Markovia's top scientist, Dr. Helga Jace, in order to stop Bedlam. Metamorpho is searching for Dr. Jace in order for the doctor to help him with his powers. Katana arrives in Markovia in order to kill General Karnz, Bedlam's military commander, as vengeance for her family. During the adventure, Batman ...

organizations.name: Outsiders_(Beware_the_Batman)
organizations.description: The Outsidersis a superhero group created by Batman.

organizations.name: Outsiders_(The_Brave_and_the_Bold)
organizations.description: The Outsidersare a group of teenage heroes inBatman: The Brave and the Bold.

organizations.name: Royal_Flush_Gang
organizations.description: TheRoyal Flush Gangis a criminal-syndicate in the DC universe which themes themselves around playing-cards. While traditionally enemies of theJustice League, they have notably quarrelled withBatmanand his successorTerry McGinniswith notable appearances agains them in other media.

organizations.name: Royal_Flush_Gang_(DC_Animated_Universe)
organizations.description: The Walker family were a group of well to do crooks who committed crime for enjoyment and sheer thrill. They adopted costumes to conceal their identities theming themselves after playing cards, becoming known as the Royal Flush Gang. They then preyed on Gotham City duringBatman's early years. The gang all utilize weapons shaped like playing cards that can fly across the city on card-shaped sky boards.Ten(real name Melanie), the daughter of King and Queen, is constantly torn between her empathetic and hardnosed sides and develops a semi-romantic relationship with Batman.

organizations.name: Run-Offs
organizations.description: The Run-Offsare an emotional-support group for enemies ofNightwing. The team assisted super-criminals ofBlüdhavenreform from crime.

organizations.name: San_Ho_Hui
organizations.description: San Ho Huiwas a small Chinese triad based inGotham City's Chinatown. Led byMickey Chen, they served as part-time enforcers for theFalcone Crime Family. In November 2020, they were killed during their Thanksgiving dinner by theHoliday Killer.

organizations.name: Secret_Society_of_Super-Villains
organizations.description: TheSecret Society of Super Villainsis a crime syndicate and enemy of theJustice League. The group mainly comprise of enemies of major villains around the world and are often lead byLex Luthor. Members ofBatman'sRogues Galleryhave often served as members of the society, likeTalia.

organizations.name: Society_of_Shadows
organizations.description: TheSociety of Shadowswas a formidable global organization founded and led by Ra's al Ghul.

organizations.name: Suicide_Squad
organizations.description: Task Force Xis a group mostly comprised of incarcerated super-villains who are sent on black ops missions, by the government. The missions in question are often amoral with the government using the supervillains as contingencies for blame. The missions have a low chance of survival in return for lowering their incarceration time, earning the group the nickname of, the "Suicide Squad".

organizations.name: Suicide_Squad_(DC_Animated_Movie_Universe)
organizations.description: Task Force X(also and better known as theSuicide Squad) was a special forces black ops team created by Amanda Waller. It consists of incarcerated supervillains who act as deniable and expendable assets for the United States government, undertaking high-risk black ops missions in exchange for reduced time on their prison sentences. If enough missions are completed or, at Waller's discretion, they can be released from the team indefinitely. In the Apokolips War film, the team is considered "Destroyed".

organizations.name: Sweet_Tooth%27s_Kids
organizations.description: Sweet Tooth's Kidsare a group of overweight kids that serve as henchmen toSweet Tooth.

organizations.name: Teen_Titans_(DC_Animated_Movie_Universe)
organizations.description: TheTeen Titans(also known asTitans) was a group of young superheroes that work together with the Justice League and all other superhero teams to fight crime and protect the innocent.

organizations.name: Terrible_Trio_(Matsudaverse)
organizations.description: The Terrible Triowere a group of students inGotham City.

organizations.name: The_Irish
organizations.description: The Sullivan Crime Family(otherwise known asThe Irish) is a group of Irish hitmen operating inGotham City.

organizations.name: The_Misfits
organizations.description: The Misfits are a syndicate of super-criminals in Gotham City assembled by Killer Moth. Feeling envious towards larger criminals such as the Joker while being a black-sheep on the criminal-underworld, Killer Moth made the team to include other foes of lesser renown. The original incarnation of the team includedCatmanandCalendar Manbefore they recruited Texan criminal,Chancer.

organizations.name: Three_Devils
organizations.description: TheThree DevilsAKA theDaredevilsare a group of supervillain enemies toBatmanandRobinwho have adept acrobatic abilities. They first appeared in Detective Comics #50 in the April of 1941 and were created byBill Finger.

organizations.name: Three_Ghosts_of_Batman
organizations.description: The Three Ghosts of Batmanis the fan-name given to a group of super-villains themed afterBatman. The three are known respectively asJosef MullerAKABat-Cop,BrancaAKABat-Bane, andMichael Washington LaneAKA theBat-Devil.

organizations.name: Three_Jokers
organizations.description: The Three Jokersare the informal name for a super-villain organization from the DC storylinesDarkseid WarandBatman:Three Jokers, created by writerGeoff Johns. They are a reimagining ofthe Jokerand his origins, separating him into three separate characters who represent different incarnations of the character, namely: the golden-age depiction of the character, the silver age version of the character (inconsistently mixed with 1980s versions) and a version of the character specifically based off ofBatman: The Killing Joke. The canonicity of the team is unknown.

organizations.name: Trigger_Twins
organizations.description: They later try and make more money by robbing a local mafia numbers runner; despite two of his men being killed by the duo, the boss of the organization talks the twins into working for him. They soon set to work killing the man's adversaries. Later, the two encounterAzraelduring a heist of a Gotham Subway train.

organizations.name: Wonderland_Gang
organizations.description: The gang appears within theBatman: The Adventures Continueseries which is co-headed by Paul Dini. Here we see them being lead by a non-brainwashedMad Hatterwho wishes to steal technology for his hats. The group we see consists of Walrus, Carpenter, March Harriet and the Tweedles.

organizations.name: Black_and_Whites
organizations.description: The Black and Whitesis the name given toGotham City's "plain coat" supervillains. Consisting ofthe Penguin,Black Maskand theGreat White Shark, the group often pool their resources to deal with matters as a collective. These included the attacks byMr. Bloomand an attempt byBatmanto "cure"Two-Face.

organizations.name: Justice_League
organizations.description: TheJustice Leagueis an organization comprised of the world's most powerful superheroes dedicated to fighting crime and injustice. Formerly known asJustice League of Americaor theJLA, they carry on the legacy of theJustice Society of America. They work a strike-force, acting as Earth's first line of defense against both terrestrial and extraterrestrial threats.

organizations.name: Justice_League_of_America
organizations.description: TheJustice Leagueis an organization comprised of the world's most powerful superheroes dedicated to fighting crime and injustice. Formerly known asJustice League of Americaor theJLA, they carry on the legacy of theJustice Society of America. They work a strike-force, acting as Earth's first line of defense against both terrestrial and extraterrestrial threats.

organizations.name: Batman_Family
organizations.description: TheBat-Family[1]is a network of crimefighters who operate in and aroundGotham City. Nearly all members trained directly underBruce Wayne. These include theBirds of Preywho operate out of theClock Towerand thethe Belfry.

organizations.name: Birds_of_Prey
organizations.description: TheBirds of Preyare a all-femaleBat-Familyadjacent group of crimefighters based inGotham City.

organizations.name: Teen_Titans
organizations.description: TheTeen Titansare a group of teenage superhero vigilantes who are counterparts to theJustice League. They consist of teenage super heroes and younger versions who fight the crime with the villains.

organizations.name: Titans
organizations.description: TheTitansis made up of ex-members of theTeen Titanswho have passed the maximum age limit, a kind of purgtory of young heroes not yet permitted join the ranks of theJustice League.

organizations.name: Wayne_Enterprises
organizations.description: Wayne Enterprises(formerlyWayneCorp) is a company in the DC Universe. Wayne Enterprises is owned by billionaireBruce Wayneand run by his business managerLucius Fox. It was founded by merchant ancestors of the Wayne family in the 17th century as a merchant house. It changed and gradually grew when it was officially erected in the 19th century when Alan Wayne, heir to Solomon Wayne, founded Wayne Shipping and Wayne Chemical. Along with Wayne Manufacturing, which came later, the Industrial Revolution fueled Wayne Enterprises into becoming a major powerhouse. In addition to providing an income for...

organizations.name: GCPD
organizations.description: The strongest blow against police corruption in the force came when an increasing amount of conspiracy charges against Loeb forced him to resign his position, replaced byPeter Grogan. The Falcone crime family, which had a stranglehold on Gotham's underground for generations, finally crumbled when a series of killings shook the structure of the mafia organization. After the death of Carmine Falcone, the mob lashed out in sloppy, retaliatory crimes, which, in combination with rising gang violence, severely crippled organized crime in Gotham City. Simultaneously, the ebbing presence of corrupt po...

organizations.name: Gotham_City_Police_Department
organizations.description: The strongest blow against police corruption in the force came when an increasing amount of conspiracy charges against Loeb forced him to resign his position, replaced byPeter Grogan. The Falcone crime family, which had a stranglehold on Gotham's underground for generations, finally crumbled when a series of killings shook the structure of the mafia organization. After the death of Carmine Falcone, the mob lashed out in sloppy, retaliatory crimes, which, in combination with rising gang violence, severely crippled organized crime in Gotham City. Simultaneously, the ebbing presence of corrupt po...

organizations.name: Department_of_Extranormal_Operations
organizations.description: The Department of Extranormal Operations also known as DEO is a United States of America government agency which investigates, monitors, and processes all metahuman activities and persons. This agency's main goal is to prevent any threats to the general public about any extranormal superpowered people. The agency is headed by Former Infinity Inc MemberMister Bones. The agency's headquarters is located in New York and they report to the US Secretary of Metahuman Affairs which was originallyAmanda Waller.

organizations.name: League_of_Assassins
organizations.description: TheLeague of Assassinsare a sect of highly trained warriors that act as bodyguards/mercenaries for theBrotherhood of the Demoncriminal empire. They have sworn eternal loyalty to the man who calls himselfRa's al Ghul, the Head of the Demon.

organizations.name: Injustice_League
organizations.description: The Injustice League is the opposite of the Justice league. The Injustice League goal is to spread chaos and confusion. They are one of the many bigger foes of The Justice League.

organizations.name: Secret_Society_of_Super_Villains
organizations.description: TheSecret Society of Super Villainsis a crime syndicate and enemy of theJustice League. The group mainly comprise of enemies of major villains around the world and are often lead byLex Luthor. Members ofBatman'sRogues Galleryhave often served as members of the society, likeTalia.

organizations.name: Ace_Chemicals
organizations.description: Over the years, the Joker has revisited Ace Chemicals several times, and on occasion has even used it as a temporary hideout. Notable examples includeDeath of the Family, where Joker andHarley Quinnlure Batman to the Plant to repeat the "accident" that transformed the Red Hood into the Joker.

organizations.name: S.T.A.R._Labs
organizations.description: Science and Technology Advanced Research Laboratories, usually shortened to S.T.A.R. Labs, was a research organization founded by a scientist named Garrison Slate, who wanted a nationwide chain of research laboratories unconnected to the government or any business interests.

organizations.name: Arkham_Asylum
organizations.description: According toArkham Asylum: A Serious House on Serious Earth, the crumbling Victorian mansion at the heart of the original Arkham Asylum was a single-family home, occupied at the beginning of the twentieth century by the Arkham family.Arkham Asylum: Living Hellelaborates on this information, disclosing that the actual structure was built long before the early 1900s as the "Gotham House of Madness and Ill Humors". The grounds were owned by an occult expert namedJason Blood, who carried out exorcisms on the mentally ill. His patients hailed predominantly from Gotham's poor and superstitious towns...

organizations.name: Gotham_University
organizations.description: The G.U. was later the target of a vicious attack by former professor Vilmer, who sought revenge against the institution and the headmaster for his sacking after unethical experiments. The institution was saved by the timely intervention of Batman and Robin. Much later, the laboratories of Gotham University were used as a trap to capture The Pi-Meson Man. After several inmates from Arkham Asylum were released, Scarecrow used a large group of students at the Gotham University as his test subjects and using one of the building's classrooms, he transformed them into his minions. With a small army...

organizations.name: Gotham_Knights
organizations.description: The nameGotham Knightsis a nickname given to the extended "Bat-Family." However, it has also been shared with various organizations inGotham City, though mainly sporting teams. The title has also been used for severalBatmantitles and media products.
